description:
I've got nothing but love for my local bakery. Not as splashy as Tartine, not as trendy as Mr. Holmes, not a cafe like Jane. Just a good, honest bakery with delicious pastries, bread and cakes - the kind of place parents take their kids after school, the kind of place with regulars who stop in for a morning coffee and croissant. I personally ask A to get my birthday cake from NVB every year because the Carrot Cake is made of the stuff of dreams but I have never had a bad slice of cake or cupcake.

In addition to a display case full of treats, NVB also serves coffee and espresso drinks, though I can only vouch that the cold brew is good. They also have take-and-bake cookie dough which is a great idea but I can't bring myself to buy since I'll eat it all. Besides their standard items, NVB also offers seasonal items and special delectables for holidays (Jewish, Christian and Secular that I've seen) all of which taste like they're classics and not an afterthought.

They also do some form of "Happy Hour" deals from 3-6 which used to be discounted coffee though I'm not sure what the exact deal is at this point. IMO, NVB is one of the best bakeries in the city and if you're in the area, you have to stop in. My one complaint is that it isn't open later to get a late night dessert, but my waistline is probably grateful that they close at 7.
author: Carrie W.

description:
Cake was so rich but so so good! 

I ordered the Got Milk? cake for my friends birthday a few weeks ago. The online ordering system required at least 48 hours in advance to place the order. I needed a cake the next day so I called the bakery and placed my order over the phone.

Pick up was a breeze and my friends and I all enjoyed the cake the next day! Highly recommend!
author: Joycelin L.

description:
Walked in yesterday to get cake and cupcakes for two different birthdays! 

Their cake selection wasn't big but simple enough to help you make a decision. I was contemplating between the strawberry cake and salted caramel, and I ended up going with salted caramel. The cake design wasn't the prettiest but oh man it tasted so heavenly. 

A small 6" cake was only $38. Initially I was gonna get a cake from 85C bakery but their cake is average and probably cost about $30, so I thought I'd spend a little bit more for something with more quality in it, and I wasn't disappointed. Everyone loved it and for the first time I saw an entire cake gone within minutes. Oh I also requested the store to write a happy birthday message on the cake and their handwriting was so pretty!

Their cupcakes were $3.75 each, many of them were chocolate based.

At the end of the night everyone asked where I got the cake from and they loved it! I'm really happy with my decision to go with a random bakery I saw while walking around Noe Valley.
author: Elle T.

description:
This bakery is amazing!!!  I used to live near the bakery in Noe Valley before moving to Silicon Valley and I truly miss it! I still work in SF, so every opportunity I can, I go there! 

Everything is made fresh! I've had the cup cakes, tarts, cakes, pastries and love it all! I have never been disappointed and love getting items and taking them to parties, bdays etc and introduce people to Noe Valley Bakery! 

ASI mentioned all the items sold daily are fresh and taste phenomenal. I love the fact that there are also special sweets made during holidays. I ordered the Kings Cake during Mardi Gras, there are also other holiday cakes and pastries available. If you get a chance, join the newsletter to get notified of the special holiday goodies! 

Located in the heart of. Or Valley, this family owned bakery has it all. Cookies, coffee,etc. It is always busy, so I suggest you go early and get your sweets as this is a very popular spot. 

Parking is metered parking along 24th street, there is a small parking lot a few doors down too, which is often full. Close to the 24 Divisadero bus line which stops at 24th/Castro a few doors down from the bakery. 

Service is always amazing, they treat you so nice, like family and all the locals in the neighbourhood o there to get their sweets and coffee. 

Price is also very reasonable. You get a lot for your money and it's simply decadent. One of my all time favourite bakeries to date!
author: Albie E.

description: Found this spot after getting brunch around the saw area and got some cupcakes for my mother in-law since my husband and I were gonna visit. They have nice variety of baked goods. I ended up getting 3 of the mini most-est cupcakes and one of the regular most-est cupcake. They were cute and resembled the ones from Hostest. The cupcake was very moist and not overly sweet. The center frosting was my favorite and it wasn't too dense. My mother in law loved it and she normally doesn't eat too much sweets. They are a bit pricey but they are a nice treat to bring for your family or friends.
author: Lisa H.

description:
Edit: read this review in all CAPS. This was in all caps but I guess yelp didn't like that. It's important though! 

Flakey, just-the-right-amount-of-sweet-almond-filing, perfectly tender apple slices, warmed to perfection. I die every time for their fruit slabs. 

Also their savory slices same thing ^ but with cheese filling and artichoke hearts. I die. 

I could go on but i dont want to waste time - get to noe valley bakery!
author: Miranda M.

description:
So many great memories of this place...where do I even start?!  

One of my favorite things to do on Saturdays was running errands on 24th Street, and part of the reason for that was Noe Valley Bakery (hereby abbreviated as NVB).  

Need to bring pastries or dessert to a party? NVB.  
Celebrating your cat's first birthday and need to custom order a cake for the party? NVB.  
Got hungry while walking around and need fresh milk and cookies? NVB.
Just got a craving for a fruit tart? NVB. 

All the pastries and desserts here are top-notch, but my favorite thing about Noe Valley Bakery are their cakes.  I mean, if super moist and lightly sweet cakes are your thing, this is the place for it.

And yes, I really did order a cake from here for my cat's first birthday party.  It was a vanilla chiffon cake with strawberry Bavarian cream and fresh strawberries that went well with Prosecco .  The human guests loved it!

Given this was my go-to place for all things sweet and delicious, it was no surprise that I ordered my wedding cake from here as well.  The wedding cake was a devil's food chocolate cake with a raspberry mousse filling and cream cheese frosting on the exterior.  I still dream about that cake, it was *that* good.  Wedding Pro-Tip: I made sure to order the cake plain, so I could put fresh flowers on it later.  It kept the cost of the cake down to about 20% of the quoted price from their cake artist.  

Great neighborhood bakery!
author: Nancy C.

description: Price kept going up at Noe Bakery. I think they even shrink the size of the pastries. Quality is ok, comparing to Starbucks, but not the standard of boutique bakeries in the city.
author: Melvon M.

description:
Hello cake! We meet again ;-)

My love for all things cake only intensifies when September comes around. It's as if, all my friends want to buy me cake. And why turn it down? my birthday does come around only once a year. 

My good friend Cassie and I are the designated cake buyers in our group. Noe Valley Bakery is her faithful standby, whereas I like to mix it up. (Schubert's, Dianda's, B patisserie) However, I do have to hand it to Cassie because she knows how to pick the best cakes! And the ones I've had at Noe Valley Bakery has not disappointed through the years that I've been the lucky recipient. From Lemon passionfruit to Strawberry Shortcake, the flavors are always spot on, the presentation is simply wonderful and the prices are affordable for the size of cake you get. 

One time, she brought Salted Caramel cake to a brunch party and I could not forget about this cake. It is a sinfully delicious devil's food cake layered with burnt caramel and topped with caramel buttercream. Imagine caramel on caramel then crowned with ganache and sea salt. OH MY GAH. 

I've never step foot inside the bakery but with friends like her, I just have to wait for the next celebration and I can get my cake and eat it too.
author: Janice C.

description: I walked in randomly today as I was about 10 minutes early for an appointment and still felt a little groggy.  I ordered a small espresso bev and a cranberry scone and went on my way.  I finished my coffee and scone outside and was very happy, especially with the scone.  It was flavorful and light inside with perfect crispy edges.  After my meeting, having been already impressed, I went back and ordered another coffee.  While waiting for it to be made, the employee behind the bar engaged with me about the scones and her passion for the blueberry convinced me to buy one to take home for later.  The two ladies behind the counter around 1215pm were very nice and engaging and really rounded out a great experience.  This bakery isn't even in my neighborhood but I'll be back to try more delicious pastries!
author: Benjamin D.

description:
This bakery is pretty good! I just wish it wasn't so darn pricey!!

I got the got milk cake for a birthday and it was really good! Super chocolaty, moist, but not super sweet. But that awesome cake came at a $40 price tag. You got about 8 good slices from it, but damn, when did cake get so expensive. I also wanted to try a ton more, but at about 5:30PM, they had run out of most stuff. I ended up getting the blueberry pecan scones to bake at home, about $14/15 dollars for 6 biscuit-sized scones to bake at home. I tried those and they were pretty good, sort of cakey, reminded me of a biscuit. Not the best scone I've ever had, but alright.

I'll be back to try their other goods!
author: Eva C.

description:
Love your Seeded Levian bread, just one question. I seem to remember last time I bought it, it was darker and more dense, am I wrong.
Did the recipe change?

Cheers,
Stein
author: Steiner A.

description: The quiche is VERY good!!! I loved it! The lemon tart is pretty good too! They have a good selection of things to choose from! I will be back to try other things!
author: Auriyon J.

description:
Was not expecting to go to this place but like most things Yelp I had it bookmarked and happened to be in the area. 

I tried: 

dipped cupcake- Looks like a chocolate dipped ice cream cone and it was  so so good if only it wasn't topped by or equally impressive as...

Moistess cupcake-  Super moist as the name implies. It has a white filling and it also very very good. 

Great find , look forward to bring friends/family here again.

I like lists what can I say? 

When I look at reviews sometimes just want to know where to go or how a user compares one venue against another to see if we have similar tastes. 

Here is a look at how I rank the SF Bakeries I've visited and I indicated what they're known for or a dish I recommend:

Rod's SF Bakery rankings (and what they're known for or what I like). ?) Follow my profile to see my most recent reviews I hope I can be helpful since so many Yelpers have helped me discover new places.

2 B Patisserie=Choco Bannana croissant
3 Zanze's Cheesecake=Regular cheesecake

6 Chili Pies Baking Co=Pies
7 Dynamo Donuts=donuts
8 Golden Gate Bakery=Egg tart
9 Mr Holmes Bakehouse=Green tea croissant ,Cruffin, 
10 La Luna Cupcakes=cupcakes
11 Three Babes Bakeshop=pies
12 Anthony's Cookies=Cookies
13 New Hollywood Bakery=Egg tart
14 Dianda's Italian American Pastry=Napoleon , Cannoli
15 Mission Pies=Banana Cream Pie
16 Schubert=Swedish Princess cake
17 Yummy Bakery=egg tarts
18 Stella Pastry & Café=Cannoli , Tiramisu
19 Craftsman & Wolves=Rebel within
20 Bob's Donut & Pastry Shop=any donut 
21 Noe Valley Bakery=dipped cupcake
22 Café Greco=Cannoli 
23 Kings Bakery=Tres leches cake
24 Benkyodo Co=mochi
25 Cupcake cove=cupcakes
26 Cups and Cakes Bakery=cupcakes
27 Good Mong Kok Bakery=dim sum
28 Karas cupcake=cupcakes
29 Mission Minis=cupcakes
30 Sift Dessert=cupcakes
31 Tartine Bakery=lemon tart
32 Jane The Bakery=matcha twist , cardamom Lattice Bun
33 Café Madeline=various goods
34 Panaderia La Mexicana=mexican sweet bread
35 Hot cookie=Cookies
36 Les Gourmands Bakery=Croissant
37 Mee Mee Bakery=Cow ears
author: Rod M.

description:
A hidden treasure in San Francisco. I'm going to keep this review short, go here if you're looking for cakes, cupcakes, really good bread, and anything else baked! 
My favorite are the Hostess Mostess cupcakes.
author: Muhammad U.

description: Dear omnipotent being in the sky who may or may not exist (or Mister Rogers if you need a real person to believe in); Please let me eat this cake every day of my life, all day, for every meal and I promise to be a better person. I really don't care if I get fat or diabetes because it will be worth it just to have this glorious, magnificent, face-meltingly delicious cake anywhere near my mouth. That is all. Thank you.
author: Matt N.

description: I have got the twice baked almond croissant. Flaky on the outside with almond sprinkled on top and I could taste the almond-y pasta in the middle!Flavourful and delicious! Will def go back!
author: Ava A.

description: Great spot.  Been going there for years.  A little pricey but the Milky Way bombs, tarts, morning buns and raspberry pastries are awesome
author: David G.

description:
BLAND AS FUCK


We ordered a cake here and we were so excited for it. For the size we chose, it was surprising how light it was. 

The cake was bland and dry as hell. All the flavor was in the frosting. The cream between each layer of cake was plain which is unexpected considering that we DIDN'T order a basic vanilla cake. It was so goddamn dry, I had to have a glass of milk with it. 

The cake was a HUGE disappointment. I'm never coming here again, this place sucks.
author: Madison Z.

description:
***3.5 stars***

i came here with my friend for a post-lunch, mid-afternoon dessert, and was a bit surprised at how small the place was.  i could've sworn i'd been here years ago, when i lived in sf, and the place was bigger, with some seating inside.  but in oct 2017, there was definitely no seating inside, or outside, aside from a small bench along the sidewalk.

also, at the time we arrived, many items had already been purchased so the pickings were a bit slim.  there were some cookies, bars, breads, cupcakes, tarts, pies, scones, and eclairs.  my friend chose the raspberry eclair, which was quite pretty with fresh raspberries on top.  i chose the cheese scone, since i don't often get to have a savory scone.

pricing was fair, for sf, $5+ for the eclair, and $3+ for the scone.  i did enjoy my scone, as it had a couple of different cheeses inside.  my friend really liked her eclair, with raspberries, and some cream inside...she savored every bite!

i definitely recommend coming earlier in the day, to get the best selection of baked goods and pastries.  and just be prepared to take your goods home or find another place to enjoy them.

note: no restroom for customers inside.
author: Ellen L.

description:
Wow! I never expected to be treated like this here at Noe Valley Bakery. After driving 5 miles out of my way to come and enjoy one of there breakfast pastries.

I stood there for about 5 minutes without even a greeting coming through the door. That was fine because I know they're pretty busy, so I would've thought.

After standing there thinking I was next, a white lady and her two kids walk in the door, and not even ten seconds of coming through the door, the Asian girl quickly finishes what she was doing, looks past me and says, "Hi! What can I get you guys?" To the ladies that just came in the door.

Wow! I have NEVER FELT so disrespected and degraded in this city as I did this morning.
author: Sodro K.

description:
Noe Valley Bakery never disappoints! I had ordered two celebratory cakes from Noe Valley Bakery so far, and both times I was very pleased with the cakes.

The buche de noel cake looked very well made. The only criticism is that it's a bit too sweet for my taste, but maybe this type of cake is just generally sweeter?

The baby shower cake was sooooo cute! It was a strawberry cake with bavarian cream. The cake was perfectly moist and not too sweet.

Both cakes were reasonably priced too, and the lines are not as bad as some other popular bakery in the city.
author: Sam M.

description:
Super yummy and super friendly service. They do run out so if you want something specific or special go early or order it. 

DIPPED cupcakes - mini vanilla cupcakes with a light moist bavarian cream with the top dipped in hardened chocolate. Sounds so simple. I was not that excited but someone there recommended it as her favorite so I figured why not try since my previous favorite chocolate caramel cupcake was sold or at the time. FAVORITE THING IN THE WHOLE BAKERY now.  

Chocolate caramel cupcake: delicious. My second favorite to the dipped cupcakes. Not too rich on the caramel flavor but just enough to balance out the chocolate goodness. 

Red velvet: a little on the dense and dark side.  The frosting doesn't taste like a real creamy cream cheese frosting so that made me sad.  Tasted more like a cream cheese flavored buttercream to me 

Carrot cake cupcake - really good except it's full of raisins and other things related to raisins. And I don't like raisins. So this was a lot of work to try to pick out all of those squishy things so not my thing. But it's super real with real carrots in it. 

Moistess cupcake - it's good. Reminds me of a fancy homemade hostess ho-ho or ding dong (do they even make those anymore?!). So yes it's chocolate and good but doesn't seem super special 

Bombe - super rich chocolate goodness. Like a rich multi layer mousse. 

Meat and cheese quiche - really enjoyable breakfast. Not too meaty. Not to cheesy. Fluffy egg. 

Be careful because their boxes don't always close well and the stickers aren't the stickiest so your box may spring open at the wrong time so ask for extra tape or just be careful so your goodies don't end up on the floor.
author: Traci H.

description:
The staff welcomes you with amazing smiles and warmth. 
The young ladies were great and had great recommendations.  Loved the ham and cheese tart is was a pastry with the heart of a full meal.   Fresh cheese toasted perfectly with crusty corners. 
And they have tons of sweets and fresh bread daily.  An army of chefs preparing treats and bread in the back. 
They also gave a happy hour in the afternoon with very reduced coffees and other beverages. I do wish the train in the display window was working though
author: David C.

description: Love this place, their caramel cake and their birthday cake are outstanding.
author: Balu V.

description: We had a terrible experience with the contact for custom cake order. We kindly asked for the line item costs for a custom cake. The response from the contact was not only untimely but extremely rude. We had to follow up several times via email for a response. When they finally responded, it was very condescending.
author: Kim Y.

description: I really like this genuin bakery in Noe Valley. Now days it's difficult to find the place which provide daily fresh baked products. When I drive down to my office in south bay, I usually get a plain Croissant and cup of coffee for my breakfast. In weekend, I get blueberry scone which is delicious and could not get at other places.
author: Yuki K.

description: Delicious breads and cakes. The frozen cookie dough is great. Friendly service as well.
author: Ryan K.

description: Best cake I've ever tasted so far here in SF! Not too sweet. Super moist and doesn't taste commercialized at all! Even the cupcakes are awesome. Can't wait to try the other flavors. I ordered the Birthday Cake for my baby, and a red velvet cupcake and most-est cupcake for myself to taste. Sooo good!
author: Cyreene Loise B.

description: Noe Valley Bakery is awesome. Please consider patronizing them. They have generously provided snacks for high-schoolers in the Mission that I voluntarily tutor to help get into college. Xavier, the manager, and workers are so friendly and all their baked goods are yummy. Their generous support of the needy in our community is a big deal. Thank you, Noe Valley Bakery!!
author: Ice Cream Truck I.

description: The Strawberry Cake should be outlawed for being a danger to diets EVERYWHERE.  The cake itself melts in your mouth like cotton candy then you're adding this delicious fluffy frosting, cream and fresh strawberries?! Ahh-maz-ing!
author: Kerr T.

description: It was 7:03 pm, so a few minutes ago, the door was not closed and 1 customer was still in the bakery paying. I got in and asked politely can I still buy a baguette as they were many left . Answer from the girl who appeared to be the senior one: "we are closed" I was so shocked of her answer that I re asked the question thinking that I mis heard what she was saying, she repeated we are closed ! So I said but the door is open and you have many baguettes to sell and you cannot sell them tomorrow so sell me one, she answered we sell them tomorrow and then same answer : we are closed . It is the first time I faced that kind of attitude in that bakery. There were 2 girls in the bakery when it happened . The Chinese girl was nice and smiling but the other one with long curly hair was very rude and the owners should know about it.
author: Jacques H.

description: I dig their chocolate-dipped coconut macaroons, my mini loves their mini cupcakes, and the train in the front window, when running, is pretty effen magical.
author: Gabriela W.

description:
Lucky me, these cupcakes were gifted, and they were SO good. Perfectly decorated, packaged, and delicious. I'm usually a Kara's or Sprinkles girl, but these are game changing.

I definitely loved and would recommend: 
-Red velvet
-The mostest (hostess cake looking)
-the fruit tart 
-the mini cheese cake 

Drool... I want some now.
author: Corinna T.

description: Excellent bakery. I have never bought anything in here that was off, stale, or broken/cracked. Even the frozen scones I purchased for baking at home were delicious. The staff seems friendly, helpful, and have pride in their baked goods. Yum!
author: Charlie T.

description: I haven't actually been in the bakery to try the treats, but my review is about the terrible lack of communication. We called wanting to talk about a custom cake design as this bakery is closest to my house. When we called we were told all custom orders have to go through email - ok, so we did. We sent an email... A week or so goes by so we send another, and no reply! Seriously? How does anyone order cakes from you? Seriously disappointed, we went with cake gallery in the mission instead, and they were happy to communicate with us.
author: Bethy B.

description: I'm a huge fan of buying bread at Noe Valley Bakery. Most recently bought a loaf of the sour wheat bread for a dinner party - and everyone couldn't stop raving about it. I also regularly buy the seeded loaf which is top notch. The homemade loaves they sell here are so much tastier than Acme breads that are sold in the corner markets and Whole Foods. And much more affordable than buying a loaf at The Mill or Jane the Bakery. Highly recommend.
author: Robin P.

description: Amazing hot cross buns. If you're from Australia or the UK come here and get one!!! Worth every penny
author: Rebecca R.

description:
Everything that comes out of this place is amazing. I definitely recommend this over Tartine to be honest, the line there is not worth it! 
Sometimes there can be a small line at Noe Valley Bakery, but trust me it's always worth it.

Must try pastries:
- Kouign Amann
- Twice Baked Almond Croissant 
- Any of the ham/apple/feta tarts

Must try cupcakes:
- Moistest
- Bavarian cream filled cupcake 

*Their pound cake is also really good and not too sweet/heavy. 

Enjoy!!!
author: Margaret K.

description: Had a piece of cake from here at a dinner party. I threw it away. Later I asked where they got the cake.........GUESS WHERE????  Horrible.
author: R H.

description:
It's been a sucky week. Had our car broken into and backpack with a lot of valuables were  stolen when we were traveling home from SFO and had to delay celebrating my daughter's 5th birthday to take care of this situation. 

Since it was going to be a belated birthday with just the 3 of us, we wanted a small cake. I decided to purchase her birthday cake at Noe Valley Bakery after reading their website and found a chocolate mousse cake with raspberry filling that I know she would like.

The guy who took the order was nice but failed to mention what the price is and that writing is extra. $40 seems a bit much for a 6" cake that was mostly mousse and had hardly any raspberry filling. It was just chocolate on top of top covered with more chocolate. 

My daughter liked it but me and my husband felt it was okay for the price. 
Too sweet for me without the tartness of the raspberry. 
Overall rating would be 3.5 stars.

2017 Prices: 6" cake - $40,  8" cake - $52
author: Alice P.

description:
One time you have to try -- dipp'd mini cupcakes. It's like an O in your mouth hahaha

Creamy goodness and so satisfying too

Also, their bacon quiche is amazing

Everything is reasonably priced - great service and variety
author: Carol Y.

description: Great bakery with good coffee, delicious sweets and cakes. Super friendly staff! Ordered cake there for an event and  everybody loved it :) happy to have this place in my neighborhood.
author: Stella R.

description:
Had my eye on NVB for a while and so glad to finally get to try it today!

I'm not typically in Noe Valley because let's face it #noevalleysowhite BUT every now and then I'll venture into the whole foods or some little boutique to spend a lot of $$$ on something for a party or nearby gathering.

I was happy to see diverse staff here and literally everything in the case looked delicious! Cheddar chive biscuit could use more cheddar but it was a minor miss and still wonderfully soft on the inside with a buttery crusty exterior. Cupcake and cookies were perfection. Beautiful loaves of bread lined the shelves and the breadsticks nearly convinced me to buy them on looks alone.

Definitely will make this a pit stop on future excursions into the valley.
author: Semuteh F.

description:
Noe Valley Bakery , after all these years , 
Staff , still indifferent to the customer .
Owners , Mary , also aloof .
Don't ever think u will get a sample , that never happens , actually only with the stolen bread at Christmas time & naturally it did prompt us to purchase it . ( samples work ) and it's gracious .
Baked goods are fair and some are exceptional.
Prices are high & the 3% additional surcharge , is ridiculous & greedy .
Years ago , Mary was quoted on the front page of the examiner , claiming they were bringing in 100 grand a month .
I was astonished at that volume , this was before other bakeries on 24 th opened and even pre Whole Foods , captive market , I guess .
When it came time to Remodel , they started a go fund me page ???
They own a beautiful large house in Mill valley & travel quite a bit , why would they expect the community to fund a remodel , for a successful business .
Well foolish people are everywhere & they were indeed funded .
I don't know , the remodel is nothing exciting , it did not change the customers side & it's quite crowded and offers no room to stand , order and pay .
I mostly avoid this bakery .
Be more cautious when purchasing a cake as they tend to be dry & very over priced .
Bread is good & usually the cookies are .
But the other day , a few cookies were stale .
They opened a second location in West Portal & I hear the owners are working there , they have not really even been seen on 24 th in many years . 
I do like to do business with people you think are good & kind , I never felt this was the case with NVB .
And the staff also are rarely sweet .
As they peddle the goodies .
author: Ellie O.

description:
Years ago, someone brought a bunch of Noe Valley cupcakes to the office. Back then, I thought I didn't like cupcakes, because one too many stale grocery store baked goods turned me off from cupcakes. Plus I thought cupcakes were more of a children's snack, maybe because of memories of school bake sales, or because they're individually wrapped in paper so kids don't have to use any forks or plates, or maybe because the decorations often look juvenile. Noe Valley Bakery & Bread Co. made me realize delicious cupcakes do exist, and I do like them! After I tried one, I paid the store a visit and became a repeat customer.
The bakery itself is on the small side. There are two display cases with cakes, cupcakes, cookies, pastries. Loaves of fresh bread are lined up on the shelves. There are also candles, cards, and dough to take home and bake yourself.

All the cupcakes are very rich, heavy, and moist. The icing is so creamy, smooth, and beautifully applied. They're pretty pricey, around $3.50-$4ish per cupcake, but they seem larger than most cupcakes. Some of them come in mini size. The filled ones cost a little more. To me, the taste is superior to most cupcakes. The cupcakes are very thick too. Cutting into one doesn't smush or deflate them.

Red Velvet - deep, dark red cake. Perhaps they use less red food coloring than most. The cream cheese icing is thick and creamy, almost like cheesecake filling, but so much smoother than actually eating cheesecake.

Most-est - their rendition of the Hostess with Bavarian cream & silky ganache

Chocolate Caramel Fleur de Sel - filled with caramel Bavarian cream, sprinkled with chunky sea salt. Sea salt is the best part, because it adds a savory component, and enhances the flavor. Otherwise, I wouldn't really like this one, as I'm not a fan of caramel. 

Boston Cream - vanilla cake filled with a pastry cream that resembles custard, topped with stiff fudge icing

Peanut Butter Cup - a tiny peanut butter cup sits atop the cake covered in chocolate ganache, filled with more rich, creamy peanut butter. It's so rich, sweet, and savory.

I'm not sure if they still have the Boston Cream or the PB cup, and that makes me sad, because I'm pretty sure they were my favorites. A few other things have changed, mostly in appearance. The lemon cupcake is no longer decorated with a bee on top. The carrot cupcake that had carrot-shaped icing is now replaced with shredded carrots on top. 

Their cakes are great - simple in design, but big on taste. They are a little expensive at ~$40 for a small cake. The writing on the cake is done very well, almost font-like. Clearly, penmanship is important here. They do some pretty amazing-looking custom cakes too.

I've tried some of the cookies, but they didn't stand out to me. They also carry Tout Sweet macarons now, which is news to me.

I'm looking forward to the next time I can grab one of these cupcakes and some flaky pastries.
author: Joy W.

description: Super delicious little bites of heaven here. Their cheesecake is amazing!
author: Avani G.

description:
Exceptional customer service! 

I live in PA. This is my brother and his wife's favorite bakery. They live nearby and have a newborn baby and haven't been able to leave the house much. On my sister-in-law's birthday I called and explained the situation. They put me in touch with the owner who made a special exception and sent a beautiful and delicious birthday cake! I'm touched and impressed. Thanks a ton!
author: Janet L.

description: I come here all the time.  It has great breakfast food and coffee.  People are nice and the service is quick which is what I need in the morning.  Thanks Noe Valley Bakery!
author: Sasha K.

description: I repeat don't, what ever you do buy the M&M cookie! It is the most addictive thing ever, along with the morning bun. In the morning the line can be long, but after 11 seem to be ok. The girls and boy behind the counter are very friendly. I also recommend the red velvet cupcake!
author: Cory T.

description: Stopped by to grab a dessert for my sister's Birthday and she enjoyed the chocolate cupcake the cake was super moist. Will come by when I'm in town again. Highly recommend.
author: Dioselin H.

description:
I worked with Xavier to arrange a delivery to the Transamerica Pyramid Building. He was very prompt with communication via email and made sure we received our treats on time. We ordered a variety of pastries for my co-workers. The favorites were the cinnamon buns, M&M cookies and the eclairs.

Will definitely order from NVB again!
author: Shannon B.

description: 7 dollar asiago cheese crust (not bread in my opinion) - 2nd time i tried this bread and both times i got a sliced loaf of crust that i can do nothing with - make a sandwich ? no - toast with butter? nope - won't order this bread again and warning you not to order it unless you want this ! rip off !
author: Gigi F.

description: This bakery is SO fresh and good. They have the best pastries, cakes and cookies. Their carrot cake is to die for! Yum yum!!!
author: Lauren P.

description:
Received a reply from Mary (a very nice person) around Thanksgiving.
My initial post was made in early May. Our Anniversary is May 4. So, though
a nice person, timelines seem to be a problem here. Dianda's Bakery has more
than successfully filled the gap left by Noe Valley Bakery.
author: Richard B.

description: A cute little bakery with beautiful cakes and pastries! My sister has picked up several cakes for special occasions from here but my personal favorite is their "Milky Way Bomb". It's small dome shaped dessert with chocolate mousse and caramel covered with a thin layer of chocolate ganache. So delicious. Credit cards accepted!
author: Lisa H.

description: I've been a customer here for well over 15 years.  Their morning buns are the best I know of-rich, buttery, full of cinnamon sugar, with crispy edges on the outside and succulent moistness inside. Their challah egg bread (plain or sesame) is a winner.  Big and bite sized cupcakes, big layer cakes, cookies galore and more.  They just opened their second store in West Portal.  Go and treat yourself!
author: Kristina H.

description: We had an AirBnB located near this bakery and it was the best experience ever! Every morning we went down for a meat quiche, tea and would split a fruit tart cake in the afternoon. Best hangover cure too! The staff was very friendly and the food was exceptional. Prices are very reasonable. We highly recommend this bakery and we look forward to visiting them again soon.
author: Frances B.

description: Perfect little bakery! Amazing fresh bread and perfect tiny treats to go or pre-order for a group. Scones and fruit tarts are to die for and a Birthday is not complete in our house without mini-cupcakes from Noe Valley Bakery. I have ordered a few special event cakes as well. A bit pricey but gorgeous and delicious.
author: Kate S.

description: Incredibly delicious selection of beautifully prepared baked goods. My almond croissant was spot-on. I'm afraid I see a long term relationship on the horizon for me and their chive & cheddar scones, as I'm moving to a place nearby. They have an extensive selection of items from cupcakes, to tarts, to cookies, scones, refrigerated cookie & scone dough, etc. etc. The staff is extremely friendly, too!
author: Orr R.

description: Okay, this is the last time I purchase cookies at this local bakery. Their products were stale again for the third time in as many weeks. I'll find another bakery to call home.
author: Chris K.

description: Cute cupcakes. But everything is pretty bland. Just, like, sweet but not rich. I don't know if I would recognize the flavors if I was blindfolded. Nice staff though.
author: Lorelei S.

description: Love coming here for a cookie and chai. I do find that it's overpriced. I tried one of the cupcakes the other day and I was a bit disappointed, the cake wasn't that moist and the icing was a bit flavorless. All in all though, a good bakery/coffee shop.
author: Claire M.

description:
One of the best bakeries in San Francisco.  

They make their own version of Hostess cakes...called "Most-est" cupcakes.
They make their own version of Oreo's...called "Noe-os."
They have a "daily bread."
They make an amazing chocolate cherry bread.
They make amazing challah bread.  
They do amazing cakes.  
Muffins.  Cupcakes.  Morning buns.  Sticky Buns.  Hot Cross Buns for Lent.
I love the pignolis & rugelach.

I've had them all & they never disappoint.

I called in an order for 2 dozen hot cross buns for Good Friday.  I wasn't sure they'd be able to fulfill it the same day, but they did!

The challah bread is exceptional.  It is especially great to make french toast with.  And days later as regular toast, it's still soft & chewy.

They're now doing cookie & scone dough for you to take & bake at home.

A gem of Noe Valley.

5 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description: Noe Valley Bakery is a lfie saver on Monday at 7am. When breakfast is needed with a coffee to go.
author: Jeanne J.

description: Wonderful staff, yummy cakes, I wanted a cake with a writing and the drawing of a cat. I described it on phone when I made the order, but I was so impressed by the fantastic job they did. I got the chocolate cake with a thin layer of raspberry jam and while I was there, bought some pastries and bread too. Very happy and will be getting all my future cake orders from here. Oh did I mention, very friendly, polite and welcoming staff?
author: Tittu T.

description: The pastries are great! Unfortunately, not in customer service. I didn't appreciate how the employee snapped at me and prior to that she made me uncomfortable by looking at me in a weird way. Like she was surprised I can afford to buy one of their pastries or because I'm Asian? Seriously? Regardless of the reason, everyone should be treated the same. No matter how good your food is, it all goes to nothing when your front of the house sucks in customer service. Food - service = bad experience.
author: Kat P.

description:
Noe Valley Bakery is a cute and quaint neighborhood shop. They serve up simple and tasty sweet and savory (though not as many) baked goods. Slightly upscale than Arizmendi offerings but not as pretentious or decadent portions as Tartine. A little bit pricey but reasonable and you get your money's worth in quantity.

Apricot Ginger Bread (Vegan?) $6 - So flavorful and well spiced with chunks of apricot baked in. It's a perfect vehicle for eating with cheese.
Brownie $2.75 - Enormous, super dense and chocolatey. If you like half baked, rich and fudgey brownies, you won't be disappointed. I could stretch out the brownie into 4 servings and be satisfied, I mean I'm guessing it's like half a days worth of calories anyways. You're gonna need a tall glass of milk to wash this down.
Milky Way Bomb $6 - The chocolate mousse dome cake. Great airy and rich mousse texture and blending of the caramel flavor. I prefer dark chocolate but knew going in this would be sweeter and milkier. Still quite good for what it is and you'll probably love it if you're milk chocolate fan.
Mexican Wedding Cookie $1.45 - Bite sized powdery and nutty cookies.
Chocolate Croissant - Flaky, light nice pastry, browned on the outside filled with generous chocolate chunk. Reasonably sized portion, buttery and not too dry. Solid, also kind of boring.

Some tasty to competent offerings, but on the boring side. Appreciably better quality than Safeway baked goods, but not amazingly better than Whole Foods bakery to justify the price.
author: Truc N.

description:
Savory tart (artichoke n feta) tasted like apples, so that was as icky. 
Also, the is coffee was sub par. 

Honestly just a subpar experience. Will no go back for coffee or tarts. Maybe their cakes are better.
author: Emily H.

description: I picked up my Strawberry birthday cake.  It was pretty and delicious!  The cake was moist and the frosting was not to sweet.  Everyone loved it.  I have a new bakery now!  I am going in on Sunday to get some of the little cupcakes and bring them to Stern Grove and enjoy the S.F. Symphony.  Also need to get the French bread to.  Thank you for making my day special and my family happy!!!
author: Barb L.

description: I stopped into Noe Valley Bakery to pick up one of their King Cakes as they're one of the few people in the city that actually makes them on a regular basis leading up to Mardi Gras! The cake was $17 and was pre-made. I was fortunate enough to find the baby, so I guess that means I'm on the hook to buy another cake next year! Thank you for bringing a little piece of Mardi Gras festivities to SF Noe Valley Bakery!
author: Lisa I.

description:
Everything I've had here taste great.  The red velvet cake was moist and good 3 days later.

Small red velvet cake cost $38 with writing and 2 numbered candles.

I've tried some pastries and my favorite is the fruit tart.  Not too sweet, which is how I like it.
author: Angelica C.

description:
Today  i bought my fave hot cross buns together w/fruit slabs (apple almond creme danish) & 2 kinds of quiche (bacon & mushroom asapargus) 
When i came home i decided  to try the veggie quiche. The quiche is quite thick in eggyness in the bottom and doesn't  hold very well while the veggies are  more on top. May i shouldn't  of microwaved it but i didn't enjoy  it.  
That's  ok I'll  still give props to my fave red velvet cake and hot cross buns which this bakery  does very well!
author: EmmettsGuRL C.

description:
BIRTHDAY CAKE! 

I had spotted this place on yelp and it looked like a great bakery with beautiful cakes so I decided for my birthday - I needed to get one of these cakes to celebrate. 
I ended up ordering the salted caramel cake since I love salted caramel. Such a delicious cake and they had really great service - make sure that I knew my cake was coming out soon and stuff like that. 

Have to come back and try some of their other flavors!
author: Nina Y.

description:
Called ahead to order the strawberry cake for my auntie's birthday. I would suggest to do so since I swung by one time and they were sold out of everything and there was only 1 cake left available. The small round and 2 cookies came out to be $45. 

The cookies were for the hubs and they're decently sized. He didn't particularly care for the cookies. The Oatmeal one crumbled and broke as he was taking it out of the bag. The chocolate chip pecan was just ok. I prefer a denser cake so I didn't enjoy the cake as much although everyone else did. They incorporated strawberry cream in between the layers along w/ fresh cut strawberry pieces. Overall, the cake wasn't overly sweet which we appreciated but I can't say it was worth the price. Penmanship on the birthday message was nice.
author: Julie L.

description: stumbled upon this place when I was in the area looking at a baby store. I'm glad that I popped in because their citrus tart and fruit tart is delicious. The citrus tart is pretty close to being lemon tart and was sweeter then the fruit tart. It's small though and pretty pricey for the size. They also have a bunch of other sweets and savory items as well as bread.
author: Tao Tao W.

description: Sweet local bakery. They have a big selection. I think a-ok is about right.
author: Jen G.

description: Ordered a carrot cake for a birthday and they were able to deliver for an extra $25 anywhere in the city. I wasn't sure if the 6 inch cake would be enough for about 10-12 people but it totally was. The cake is pretty tall so the slices can be cut thinner. The cake was excellent and homey, and not too sweet. I'd definitely order again.
author: Veronica L.

description:
Stopped by to pick up some cupcakes, but they didn't have too many options when I got there. I ended up just getting the ding dong cupcake, named the moistest cupcake. It was a chocolate cake, filled with bavarian cream and dipped in chocolate. 

WOW!! It was soo good, I basically inhaled it! The cream was perfect and I wished there was more of it! The outside chocolate was harden, but melted in your mouth. The cake was very moist, and totally lived up to its name. It'll be something I'm definitatly gonna be craving.
author: Vy T.

description:
I've always known and thought of Noe Valley Bakery for its fruit tarts which are a family favorite. The fruit tart is delicious - flaky crust, light custard topped with tons of berries. 

I'm not sure why I never stopped for the pastries but they have become an unfortunate dependence for me. It first started with the ham and cheese tart which is really like a ham and cheese croissant - flaky, buttery and just the right mix of cheesy and ham-y. And then there's the morning bun - light and just a little sweet and cinnamon. I can never decide - sweet or savory - so I will sometimes get both because I just can't decide. 

Beyond the tart, pastries, beautiful cakes, they have all sorts of cute cupcakes and adorable petit fours. The people who work at the bakery are incredibly friendly and the line moves quickly.
author: Wendy L.

description: Sometimes I hate that I love this place so much because it's SO expensive and the employees are SO rude.  We go to watch the model trains in the window (my kid) and indulge in the occasional cupcake or loaf of bread (all of us). The quality of their products is top notch, and they tie for first place with Devil's Teeth for the best cake (cup or otherwise) in SF. A manager needs to tell the employees to back it down a few notches. Like a few of my favorite taquerias, I'll deal with the attitude to get the goods but it's not particularly fun.
author: Anne S.

description:
They make delicious and scrumptious bakery goods as well as sweets and cakes!

I love their ham and cheese baked item in the mornings!  It's so flaky, buttery, fresh and a savory delight! 

They make cakes well too!  I love their chocolate covered with hazelnut creme cake!  It is for the chocolate fan in you!

If you are feeling a bit on the tart side, their fruit tart is refreshingly amazing!  Keen to the eye and tangy on the palate!  

Whether you are feeling up for something sweet and/or savory, you simply can't go wrong with any of their delectable items!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
The best cupcakes I've ever had and I love pastries. 
So happy I was walking by and needed a snack because that is how I stumbled upon this gem of a place. Got a couple of their cupcakes for home, plus a mini chocolate dipped cupcake for me to eat at the register and man, they were so tasty and moist, i know people hate that word, but it is the best word to describe this bakery's cupcakes! 

I'm already planning on going back this weekend to pick up some more cupcakes to savory.
Haven't tried any of their other items but definitely will buy a few other pastries when I go back.
author: Cicely T.

description: Turns out the extra money added to each item they sell is not tax, it's a surcharge for San Francisco's mandatory health insurance.  I have seen restaurants add this as a fee, but this is the only place I know that adds this charge for food to go.  When you are already charging two dollars for a cookie, do you really have to add a three percent surcharge?
author: Bay G.

description:
Red Velvet CAKE is the new 1st Year Anniversary Gift.

Why would you want PAPER if you could have four layers of chocolatey cake, loads of cream cheese frosting and a beautifully written message instead?

(Spoiler Alert:  TWO CAKES is the new 2nd Year Anniversary gift,)
author: Amy C.

description: Milky Way bomb is still fantastic.  Tried a couple pastries and didn't like anything too much.   But that dessert is still amazing.
author: Madhuri K.

description:
For a potluck Thanksgiving dinner, I rang up these chappies, requesting a carrot cake, which he said he'd "save till I got there". So, I take the lyft over and I wait for my cake, which I'd already paid for, pick it up, go to the party, and leave with an empty box. Between 8 people, we finished it off, and I didn't get a slice.

So, an excuse to go back, I guess...
author: Hasan D.

description: I really want to like this bakery that's right in my neighborhood but I have to say the prices are stretching what's reasonable for what you get.  This morning I thought I'd buy one of those scones in the display case that looked chock full of blueberries and pecans.  What did I get when I opened the bag to eat it? A hockey puck-sized scone, with absolutely no blueberries and a half piece of pecan.  $3.60 for this? False advertising!
author: Paul S.

description:
Good run-of-the-mill bakery & coffee in Noe Valley; the line's often to the door during the morning rush, but the staff keep things moving to some extent.   (Some of the customers aren't as focused).

Good quiche, fine ham-and-cheese croissant, reasonable coffee.  A safe but not mind-blowing choice.
author: Ken M.

description: We had coffee there and bought a loaf of asiago cheese bread. It was simply amazing, light, cheesy and fluffy. Best cheese bread I ever had.
author: Janna M.

description:
Can't believe I've been in Noe Valley all these years but hadn't tried Noe Valley Bakery until this past B-Day

Sis was brilliant enough to swing by there to pick up a surprise treat to celebrate my special day.....but it all looked so good, she was hemming & hawing between cupcakes or a choc cake.  Quick "lifeline" call to Buddy #1 & the decision was made.....Guittard Chocolate Cake

This was the fudgiest, chocolatiest, most decadent cake I've had in forever!  Rich but not too sweet, there were 4-layers of chocolaty goodness separated by this lovely ganache, which was neither too thin nor too thick - it added a dense mousse-like consistency to this cake & it was absolutely incredible!

And knowing it was all made w/ Guittard?  That just scores bonus points in my book!  ( and for those 2 people left on the planet who still may not know, Guittard is the chocolate family behind Sees Candies...& everyone loves Sees.  Everyone. )

As further testament to this deliciousness, Mr & Buddy #1 went back for seconds, even after the food coma we were all experiencing after dinner.  I was content w/ my single slice.....but that didn't mean I didn't enjoy a huge piece for breakfast the following day

It's a Birthday Girl's prerogative to have breakfast cake!  In fact, it may be a rule somewhere.....

Future visits had me drooling all over their Pumpkin Scone - subtle pumpkin flavor in a moist yet crumbly scone along w/ pecans & raisins - this was breakfast deliciousness & an experience I intend to repeat as often as possible!!
author: Adrienne G.

description:
Cakes..red velvet is good, carrot is way way over iced which makes it overly sweet and sickly, the cake it's self is nice and moist but I ended up eating around the icing and leaving it all in my plate. The strawberry cake is not great either, it doesn't know what it wants to be. The cake was flavor-less and the strawberries were a bit old and mushy which ruined the whole experience. I am really bummed that his place is not better. They charge a lot and so I expect a little more than what they are putting out right now.
  
 Yeah cakes still awful, in a pinch had to get a cake and NVB was only choice and $47 for a small cake ( four people size)  plus candles is outrageous, and yeah, cake SUCKS !! Overly iced, literally all icing and no cake, sickly sweet and what cake there was was dry cake and just awful. So embarrassed that I served this as a birthday cake ... Never again
author: sasha g.

description:
You know how there are things in life that some people only dream of?

I finally got to eat something that some people only sing of. Myself included. Until now.

An old English tradition, the $2.60 HOT CROSS BUNS were Noe Valley Bakery's seasonal Easter offering (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/noe-valley-bakery-and-bread-company-san-francisco?select=woNNoV7IxzwnxL5sRKkwSw#WmiX2PiFtqZAn2PQ7X7afQ). I had never had one before, so I don't have much to compare it too. I did like how light the dough and how it was coated with a shiny egg wash. The raisins paired well with the spices, which tasted like cinnamon, cloves, and maybe cardamom or nutmeg...or allspice. A sharply spiced bread for sure.

Noe Valley Bakery also houses a few pastries from Yigit Pura's Tout Sweet Patisserie (a winner of Top Chef: Just Desserts). As a macaron maniac, I opted for the EARL GREY DARK CHOCOLATE and the AZTEC SPICY CHOCOLATE MACARONS, $2 apiece. My first impression was, "Hot damn, these are super firm, crunchy macaron cookie shells...are they stale!?" But once I got past how tough the exterior was, I could evaluate the cream.

For the earl grey macaron, regular almond-flavored cookies sandwiched an earl grey tea scented dark chocolate cream (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/noe-valley-bakery-and-bread-company-san-francisco?select=woNNoV7IxzwnxL5sRKkwSw#eoqzXftPQwrKubXtA_rJvA). Unfortunately, I could barely taste the early grey, but the chocolate tasted light and woody.

I definitely preferred the aztec macaron with dark chocolate, sweet-spicy pastilla pepper cloves, cinnamon, and vanilla bean (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/noe-valley-bakery-and-bread-company-san-francisco?select=woNNoV7IxzwnxL5sRKkwSw#MtuvYCtZYaKVNY8v4gNl3w). The pastilla pepper cloves reminded me of ginger, a fav flavor all day erry day.

I enjoyed the seasonal hot cross bun, and other reviewers have had glowing remarks about the cakes here. However, let's hope that the brick-and-mortar Tout Sweet Patisserie doesn't produce stale macarons. I'm pretty sure the ones at Noe Valley Bakery were.
author: Adele F.

description: I had cupcakes here twice.  The first time was terrible.  Second time was the most-set cupcake and that was better.
author: V V.

description: I have been going to this bakery ever since I was little. It has a variety of sweet and some savory treats, and everything is tasty and looks beautiful and artistic. When I come here to get breakfast I usually get scones and a baguette for my family to share. The baguette they have is scrumptious and delicious and so are their scones. There cookies, tarts, and cupcakes are amazing and tasty too, and again, artfully designed with frosting. My favorite treat to get there is the Milky Way bomb, because of how sweet and chocolaty it is. I would whole heartedly recommend this place for anyone looking for great baked goods.
author: Summer B.

description:
I love this neighborhood bakery! I live in Eureka Valley and walk to this bakery a lot. They have fresh baked bread loafs of different kinds. They carry lots of cookies, pastries, and mainly cupcakes. They also have ready to go cakes that are not cut. So if you ever need an emergency cake from a baker, go here! 

I buy birthday cakes from them all the time, and everyone loves their cakes! Highly recommend them. 

Their cupcakes come in a variety, and they are really delicious. 

They make kids birthday cakes too. Check out their website for photos of designs.
author: Hiral P.

description: I was by myself so I only got a fruit tart. It was early afternoon, so I was in and out pretty quickly. The place was nice and clean, and the packaging was cute, but the tart itself wasn't anything amazing. I think I came here with the wrong expectations. They clearly excel at larger group cakes and decorating, and that's not what I got. I was happy with my purchase; it just didn't leave any lasting impression.
author: Kimberly C.

description:
Best birthday cake ever! I really had the cake I always dreamed of as a child for my 40th birthday. It was beautiful, festive, and charmed everyone.

On another note...they also have wonderful coffee drinks. And, I love the new make over of the store. After 10 years, this is still one of my favorites in the neighborhood.
author: G F.

description: this has been my fav bakery for years so i rarely have any complaints. i just want to suggest that if you are going to have me spend $3 on each mini cupcake, please come up with some innovative way for me to take them home without them getting destroyed. they put the two minis that i asked for in a box made for 4, and the cupcakes did cartwheels and tumbled over and ended up upside down.  luckily they were for the kids but still ruined the photo opp. thanks for listening!
author: Bee B.

description:
Cute little bakery shop in Noe Valley. Since I'm in the neighborhood frequently, once in awhile I like to make a stop. My favorite things from this bakery:

Tcho chocolate bun
Brown butter blueberry muffin 
Savory slab of mushroom, creme fraiche, shallots
Fresh fruit tart 
Sea salt caramel cupcake
Brown butter salty cookie 
Brownies (super rich!)
Salted caramel macarons (by Tous)
Cheesecake topped with raspberries 
Strawberry cake 
Asiago bread 

They also have a honey milk tea that's really comforting. And they serve sight glass coffee. One star off because they keep adding a price increase. As if the stuff isn't already pricey!
author: Laura T.

description:
Love this place.  My husband, son and I spent a weekday afternoon in Noe Valley to have lunch, pick up groceries and indulge in some dessert.  We walked all over 24th street and finally settled Noe Valley Bakery.  We ordered a red velvet cupcake and some frozen chocolate chip cookies to take home and bake.  All of their desserts look amazingly good and the service is top notch.  

I checked out the cakes, cookies and cupcakes and wanted to try every single one.  My son and I shared the red velvet cupcake.  By sharing, he ate the  cheese cream icing and I had the rest of the cupcake.  My son won't have anything to do with any part of the cupcake that has no icing, which cracks me up but also makes me a 'little' pissed off because I can't indulge in the moist cream cheese icing. 

I also saw their most-es cupcake which I will definitely try because it looks amazing.  I found a brief description of their most-ex cupcake (below) and can't wait to return to check it out. 

Most-es Cupcake:
A childhood favorite. Rich chocolate cupcake filled with Bavarian cream, topped with chocolate ganache and white curly Q's

Oh and since the holidays are fast approaching, you may want to check out their site for all of their goods. Here's the stuff they have for Thanksgiving and Christmas according to their website (11/2014): 

Thanksgiving treats: Pecan Tartlet, Pumpkin Spice Cookie, Pumpkin Cutout Cookie, Acorn Cookie, Leaf Cookie, Apple Pie, Mixed Berry Pie, Pear Cranberry Pie, Dutch Apple Pie (limited availability), Pecan Pie, Pumpkin Pie, Poached Quince & Frangipane Tart, Eggnog Cheesecake Tart with Cranberry Jam, Spiced Cupcake with Tangerine Cream Frosting, Individual Pumpkin Cheesecake, Turkey Stuffing Mix, Whole Wheat Dinner Rolls, Challah Dinner Rolls and Michael's Famous Christmas Stollen

Christmas treats: Pumpkin Spice Cookie, Small Gingerbread Boy Cookie, Snowman Cookie, Santa Hat Cookie, All New Cookies!, Big Gingerbread Girl Cookie, Gingerbread Cookie Kit, Gingerbread House Kit, Christmas Cookie Box, Christmas Cookie Tin, Deluxe Gold Christmas Cookie Box, Christmas Stump, Flourless Chocolate Pomegranate Cake, Hazelnut-Raspberry Roll, Grand Marnier Truffle Cake, Large Milky Way Bomb, Christmas Stollen, Christmas Petit Fours, Candy Cane Mini Cupcake, Gingerbread Boy Mini Cupcake, Present Cupcake, Snowman Cupcake

Can I have one of everything please?  

Anyway, the frozen chocolate chip cookies I purchased are waiting to be baked and are happily sitting in my freezer as I type.  We may be having those for dessert tonight along with the three twins ice cream.  YUM!  Highly recommend if you want to indulge your sweet tooth.
author: Christine P.

description:
NVB has always been a very good neighborhood bakery. Scones were always exceptional-although they discontinued the best-orange current scone and many of their breads.  Still there are many great morning pastries and desserts.  

Last weekend I got to taste the reformulated Devils food cake and it may be the best chocolate I 've ever eaten. The cake and fudge frosting are said to be made from Guittard chocolate. The cake is exceptional rich and moist and not cloyingly sweet.
author: Richard D.

description: Great variety of beautiful and delicious baked goods. Often a line which indicates popularity. Try specialty breads.
author: T S.

description:
Good god this place is pure heaven! I was almost late to my flight because I HAD to bring back baguettes from here. I had them a few days prior and had not stopped dreaming of them, they were THAT GOOD. The seeded baguettes are the best I have ever had. I would not lie to you. The caramelized onion baked right into them surprised yet delighted me it was like a little bonus treasure inside! ($2.85)

I am so glad I don't live close to here because the baguettes were not the only thing to die for...the cheddar chive scones will make you stab someone if they  tried to sneak a bite. I can only imagine how good they would be for a breakfast sammy or with gravy! *drool*
The croissant ham and cheese ($4) and heirloom tomato pizza thingy's were flaky buttery slabs of croissant pizza heaven!! The chocolate cherry Sunday only loaf ($5.95) was OVER THE TOP and toasted with butter and nutella, well it should be a crime.
 I still have a blueberry pecan scone and oatmeal cookie to eat at home in the freezer. OH they have the dough's to take home in the freezer too!!

I ALSO had the pumpkin cream cheese loaf i took it to a friends house. It was OK but it didn't really amaze me like everything else did. (womp womp, win some loose some).

The smell of my hot baguettes on the bart and airplane tortured everyone in a 10 foot radius. I had to guard them with my life, but we made it home. I have since devoured one with a hunk of brie from venissimo. OK diet starts tomorrow...or after that cookie and scone...
author: Adria D.

description: Sigh. They killed everything savory I loved here. Without the cheese croissant there's little reason to trek in. I guess if I want some kinda sweet pastry or cake then I might come in. Sigh.
author: David S.

description:
Honestly it saddens me to have to write this review. I've been coming to Noe Valley Bakery since I was a child (almost 3 decades ago). The bread, pastries and cakes have always been top notch, A1. But as their popularity has grown, so has the size of this bakery's head and that of all of its employees.
I hate to break it to you, but you are NOT Tartine. There is no reason to lose your customer service, or your humility. Your good pastries will only take you so far, even with the New San Francisco and all of the transplants with $ who may not know better.
I tried to give this place the benefit of the doubt, because I'm obviously attached to a lot of the items they have to offer, and their quality ingredients. 
But after today, no more. It has become so unpleasant to come into your 24th street storefront, to only be greeted or helped half of the time, and when asking a question, to receive attitude and snappiness (consistently). 
You have lost a decades-long customer, and that is that.
author: Nicole W.

description:
My favorite local bakery. Anything you get will be tasty, but let me tell you what I've tried and can vouch for:

- Savory scone ( cheddar, scallion) : buttery without being greasy, warm but not hot, just right!
- All of their croissants. Yes, all of them :)
- Cookies: Guittard chocolate and a gooey texture= solid
- Milkyway Bomb: da bomb
- Cupcakes: red velvet is most moist and delicious
- Hot cross buns: Not just a memory from 4th grade music class; they were somewhat spicy and good, although I prefer sweeter treats
author: Stephanie T.

description:
I am originally from Louisiana and wanted to get a king cake for a dinner party. I searched the web and found out that Noe Valley Bakery was selling king cakes for $17.50. Popular king cakes in the south are usually stuffed with cream cheese or plain cinnamon. They usually leave the baby outside of the cake so that you can heat up the cake and stuff it afterwards. The king cake a Noe Valley I had to slice it up and heat up individually so that I won't microwave the plastic baby. It's also stuffed with chocolate. The cake tastes like a cinnamon roll with chocolate filling. The baby stuffed inside is also super huge compared to originally king cakes. 

Overall the king cake was pretty good. It's not exactly the same as king cakes in the south but it does the job. 

I also ordered a cream cheese mini cake and the lemon tart. They were both delicious.
author: V N.

description: Well well, cute atmosphere and cite area that is Noe. Unfortunately the eclair au chocolat was apparently too dry and there was no chocolate in it. Which is weird because the French ones have some chocolate in it. The cookie was normal. Not amazing. I guess it's average. I haven't tried the other cute cakes tho.
author: Amélie O.

description:
Enjoyed both their red velvet cake and the quiche I ordered. The two items came out to about $9. 

I wouldn't say the cupcake was the best I've ever had but definitely good, I'd happily return if I needed a small cake for a birthday or event or something simple vs. a custom cake. 

The bakery is right in the main downtown area so worth a visit if you're taking a Noe valley stroll.
author: Melody T.

description:
Now that Hostess is on their way out (or so it's been reported) there's even more of a reason to come by and grab one of their Mostess cupcake. 

Never had anything bad here. Everytime we walk by we make it a point to drop in. The window displays do a great job of enticing you to do so.

Friendly employees.
author: Esther A.

description: Love this little bakery in Noe Valley! Their cupcakes are delightful and they also have bread/cookies/coffee/eclairs/tarts/cake. The workers are super friendly as well.
author: Katie P.

description:
Omg the cloud 9 cake...me thinks that is what they call it. Was ahmazing. light fluffy not to sweet not too heavy. Just divine. I hope the owners dont ready this but it was much cheaper than Tartine or Miette...which are great but way way overpriced. 

After I get my nutrafast membership I will try every cake and pie in the house!
author: David G.

description: All kinds of baked goods here including breads, cookies, cupcakes, macarons, pastries, and cakes which sure looked mighty fine. I may have to order one for an event in the future. I had a fruit slab which was made with flaky, fresh pastry with tart strawberry, rhubarb, and sweet cream in the center. I also had the milky way bombe which was decadent but not overly sweet and rich as I was expecting. It definitely tasted like the milky way chocolate bar and had some crunchies at the bottom of the bombe for texture. The cream inside was just lovely. I stopped by on a weekend morning and the line was non-stop but it moved quickly.
author: Maya S.

description:
We popped in here after brunch at Griddle Fresh to pick up a treat for our flight back to Indiana. Everything looked amazing, but we couldn't resist the macarons since they can be hard to find. Priced at $1.90 we picked six. I would definitely recommend eating right away as ours seemed a little stale just a couple hours later. We tried the pistachio, vanilla bean, lemon, salted caramel, raspberry and hazelnut - the salted caramel and raspberry were fantastic! 

We will definitely be back on our next visit to try their other sweets and bread.
author: Amy H.

description:
I love this bakery! The staff is always very helpful, and they get to their customers as quickly as they can when the line is long. 

I'm currently obsessed with their savory slab (with the heirloom tomatoes) and their blueberry muffins. Their new line of teas are also very light and refreshing. 

Needless to say, I will definitely be back there soon!
author: Eliza C.

description: The honey milk tea is really good! Also enjoyed their scones, kind of crispy on the outside but fluffy on the inside.
author: Andrew S.

description: Glad I found this hole in the wall before Thanksgiving. Pastries are a little pricey but hey.....Oh so good. Salted caramel cake is VERT SWEET. Cupcakes are show stoppers.......Staff friendly.....
author: C U.

description:
Adorable little neighborhood bakery! My husband and I stopped by for breakfast on a Wednesday morning. We grabbed a sausage quiche, which wasn't very good. But we also had a blueberry scone which was excellent. For later, we picked up a chocolate chip cookie, one of the best I've ever had, and one of those baguettes with the caramelized onions inside. I'll be back!

FYI - there isn't any seating so you'll have to grab and go.
author: Kendra N.

description: I come here for one thing: Onion Sesame Baguette!
author: Logan N.

description: Awesome red velvet chocolate cake.  Can't go wrong here and nice service.  It's busy in the AM.
author: Tom W.

description:
Great cake!  I got this cake for my birthday. I'm a baker and kind of picky about my cakes. It was a chocolate mousse cake with layers of chocolate chiffon cake covered with chocolate ganache. I must say it was super chocolately and delicious. Just a small slice satiates my sugar cravings. The mousse cake was light and fluffy and a bit on the sweet side. It was paired well with the bitterness of the chocolate ganache. Also, I can't help to notice the beautiful & simple handwriting on the cake. I like how they keep it simple with their cakes. 

I'm definitely going to go back to try other cakes like the red velvet!
author: Jennie C.

description:
I'm not particularly fond of cupcakes; in fact, I'm a regular patron at the Anticupcake, a mini cheesecake vendor whose slogan is "Down with the cupcake, up with the cheesecake!" 

But being that I am a tolerant and open-minded person who likes whatever tastes good, I allowed this bakery to change my life view on cupcakes. Their mini cupcakes are life-changing. I never had a cupcake so spongy and soft. The best one is the cookies 'n' cream mini cupcake, which has a cookies 'n' cream filling stuffed inside a miniature chocolate cake with whipped topping, crumbs, and a miniature Oreo resting on top!  

The selling point for me is their awesome frosting to cake ratio and the fact that they use whipped frosting for some other cakes instead of the saccharine, thick frostings that make me shudder. 
Another mini-cupcake for those who don't like frosting like me is the Dipp'd mini, which comes with bavarian cream instead and is dipped in chocolate ganache. 

For regular cupcakes, my favorite is the banana caramel cupcake which should be a hit among those who like banana bread. 

If I were to review this place solely based on the cupcakes and birthday cakes they whip out, I would give them five stars. I've went to two birthday parties that elected to get their cake here and both of them (Cloud 9 and Red Velvet) were fantastic!

They also have a great assortment of cookies. Recommendations: Pinwheels, Noe-Os (their version of Oreos also comes dipped in chocolate), Apricot Hamentashen, MmCookies, Circus Animals

Some of the misses are their breakfast pastries. The raspberry filling of my croissant tasted too sweet/artificial as well as the orange glaze on my raisin bun, although they both tasted flaky after I heated it up in the toaster oven. The scones are decent, but not amazing. 

I've had the fruit tart and the lemon tart here. They have sturdy shortbread crusts which I like but the lemon tart consistency was really thick and was hard to get through, while the fruit tart had more of a whipped cream instead of a custard or a vanilla pastry cream, which was a let-down. 

They change their offerings up every once in a while and always has the most adorable window displays that make me want to buy a custom cake for myself on the spot.
author: Alice L.

description:
Came here because my boyfriend was craving cheesecake and this was one of the few places near me that had them in stock. While the selection was limited, and by limited I mean literally 1 flavor lol, the cheesecake was on point.  

Size: It was an individual sized plain cheesecake topped with raspberries. My boyfriend and I comfortably split 1, but I can definitely see someone with a bigger sweet tooth finish the entire cake by themselves. 

Taste: Not too sweet but still got that rich and creamy flavor of well-made cheesecake. Raspberries added a nice balance of tartness to cut the cheese.

Texture: This cheesecake was on the lighter and fluffier side, which I thoroughly enjoyed because it didn't make me feel like a tub of lard after I ate it. 

Will definitely come here again, especially if they come out with more cheesecake flavors!
author: Betty W.

description:
I never quite understood what all of the hype is about.
I've never been "wowed"!
Their prices are insane--$1.25 for one small chocolate chip cookie...equals $15.00 a dozen.
The baked goods are so-so.  I've always found them to be lacking moisture--  especially their cakes.
author: Thomas D.

description:
I love this place! Customer service is awesome. The retail staff was extremely knowledgable about their products. Went in for a cookie and came out with half a dozen cupcakes. 
& the cupcakes were sooooo delish! 
Highly recommend! In fact if it was not for the friendly and helpful staff this would have just been a so so experience, I have to thank Xavier and Bud for an excellent hands on experience, definitely going back! Carrot Cupcake for the win!!!
author: Nadia A.

description:
I did a search for best cupcakes in SF and this place had their "Most-est" listed as #2 so I had to check it out. But then I saw it had a health score of 100%..and...well...how convincing is that?!

I tried 3 cupcakes, a cookie, a quiche, and a scone and I wish Noe Valley were closer to me than it is. Even though the chocolate cake of the cupcakes was extra memorable I think the cheddar chive scone just blew me away.

My only regret is the red velvet cupcake doesn't have as much frosting as it should. There's just not enough to go with all of the yummy cake. Be a little more generous with that stuff, okay?
author: Leslie K.

description:
02-March, Saturday
The Boston Cream Pie cupcake is definitely a no brainer, with its delectable not-too-sweet vanilla custard, and luscious chocolate cream frosting pipped to perfection. And best enjoyed a few degrees below room temperature.

And although not comparable by any means, but for something savory.. the blueberry scones were also has a tinge of sweetness to them with a light fragrance of vanilla, buttery with a crisp exterior and flaky interior. The perfect pairing for that morning latte, or afternoon iced coffee.
author: Ty T.

description: Loved the scones, cupcakes & breakfast croissants! I found the muffins to be a bit dry, not as tasty and too many raisins. I haven't tried the breads, but will definitely be back to get some.
author: Lissette I.

description:
how i wish i loved this place more.  it's a good, standard bakery--not exceptional but not bad.

the people couldn't be any nicer.  and things do taste better than 10 years ago. but i just bought my $4 (with tax) cupcake and it was cold and a bit stale.  that'll teach me to buy at the end of the day.
author: Philip L.

description:
Besides reading some great reviews from my Yelp friends I think the first thing that attracted me was the display case filled with delicious cupcakes.  That was many months ago, and I still haven't tried a cupcake yet.  Something else always seems to catch my eye at the Noe Valley Bakery.

I love their scones.  The Blueberry Pecan Scone (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/oHuPyoGY7nhCQeprHCv21g?select=XOowzsywUMuBGaANo9N-WQ) is amazing.  It's as buttery as Yelp friend Jennifer L. describes in her review and it's full of plump blueberries and crunchy pecans.  I haven't tried reheating it as she does because it never lasts until the next day.

I love their pastries.  One of my favorites is the Apple Wrap (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/oHuPyoGY7nhCQeprHCv21g?select=pEWeJUwO-6dvNdeT0Ktm4A).  It's an entire apple half, peeled and cored, wrapped in a thin, flaky pastry shell.  These are excellent fresh or warmed in the oven for just a bit.

I love their fresh baked breads.  One of my absolute favorites at any bakery in San Francisco is Noe Valley's Apricot-Ginger Bread (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/oHuPyoGY7nhCQeprHCv21g?select=JTsUTpi9i0To6rmRT3aMGQ).  The apricots are plump, soft, flavorful and plentiful and even though you can't see the ginger its flavor is definitely highlighted in the dense, moist bread.  I've been known to eat an entire loaf of this bread in one sitting.

I often tell people that I like my cookies hard and crispy, but that doesn't mean I won't eat a cookie if it's soft and chewy.  Noe Valley Bakery's cookies are neither hard and crispy nor soft and chewy but more of something in between.  I've tried many of their cookie varieties so far, and they've all been good.  Recently I tried their Chocolate Chip Pecan and Pinwheel Shortbread cookies (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/oHuPyoGY7nhCQeprHCv21g?select=6ueeFeF-7CuDMwv9_BthKg).  I liked the Chocolate Chip Pecan more because it had lots of crunchy pecans in it, but do you know the real reason why I haven't tried a cupcake from here?  These look so much more tasty (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/oHuPyoGY7nhCQeprHCv21g?select=Y2r2dKmUT6oUzkyUcFZufw)!!

Thanks Noe Valley Bakery!
author: Wilhelm Y.

description: Lots of really good things.  I've never been disappointed.  Seriously delicious carrot cake!
author: Ken B.

description: Noe Valley Bakery is the best bakery in the world .I ordered a rainbow cake for my daughter 12th birthday. it's the best rainbow cake I've ever seen and taste excellent !!! I give this Bakery a 10 star the staff was very helpful and they listen to what i wanted they made it happen. Thanks will order soon.
author: Darlene M.

description:
My family loves Noe Valley Bakery!  They have the most delicious cakes and pastries and unbelievable service.  Their fruit tarts are to die for and I love stopping by during the holidays to get their seasonal treats.  We actually drove a Noe Valley cake up to Tahoe for my 8 year olds birthday because she insisted she needed her red velvet from Noe Valley.

My daughter's school recently had a Centennial celebration and Michael (the owner) was kind and generous enough to donate cakes to the event.  The cakes were beautiful and people have not stopped talking about how delicious they were.  Michael was a pleasure to work with and I feel so grateful to have such a wonderful bakery in the neighborhood.

My favorite bakery in the city and a must for all your cakes and treats!
author: Meghan G.

description:
I brought a scone today.  They charged me an extra 3% for "SF Mandates."

I don't give a damn about the 3% or the 9 cents it cost me.  Rather I object to the greedy owners who can't, or won't, take responsibility for their workers.  These greedy owners have a choice of providing health care or setting aside money (3%) for employee health care.  They decide to set aside the money--but they only set aside the 3% as they are too cheap to provide decent health benefits to their workers.  

And even the SF Chronicle, bastion of downtown big business opinion, points out that most of those restaurants and bakeries just pocket the difference between what they are required to set aside and the money they spend.
