They want to promote the con that SF Mandates is taking your money.  They want to hid the truth of their disregard for their employees by not adequately funding their health care.  

I won't shop at Noe Valley Bakery.
author: Tim L.

description: Amazing breads and pastries. Such a good local spot.
author: Ben G.

description:
This review is only for the Milky Way Bomb from Noe Valley Bakery & Bread Company.

Ever have one of those days where a little chocolate is not a craving but a necessity? I have been having one of those weeks. Luckily, the girlfriend recognized the symptoms and surprised me with the Milky Way Bomb. It was nothing short of amazing.

Dome-shaped chocolate shell with three layer of harmonious mouse layered on top of a flourless cake and "rice krispy" base. I was expected a dense, intensely flavored chocolate cake but what I tasted was leaps and bounds better. Light, airy, fluffy, not too sweet with just enough texture to make the Milky Way Bomb interesting. After experiencing the Milky Way Bomb, I will probably grab another baked good from Noe Valley when I am in the area.

What I recommend:
-- Milky Way Bomb
author: Andrew W.

description: Noe Valley Bakery used to be one of the best in the old days but now the pasteries are not as good. They are being cheap putting less custard or cream fillings inside and even the chocolate frostings are very thin now while the prices have gone up way above other good bakeries in San Fran. Forget about customer service because they don't really care.. The servers have an attitude as if you owe them something as oppose to serving the customer. In fact you see this in other reviews. Today two people behind the counter were filling online orders and only one person was serving  the 4 customers waiting in the line!  So the online orders take priority over the customers that are physically standing and waiting to buy.  On top of this, they ignored one of the customers that was waiting for a long time and served the customer behind her as if she did not exist. Even after she said she was next, they went ahead and served the customer behind her. They did not even apologize to her or offer her a free pastry, God forbid!  Some of the pastries that we bought were frozen but they denied it when we told them. The frozen pastries were full of ice as if they were just removed from freezer. I wonder how fresh the frozen pastries are. They tell you all their pastries are fresh, but that is not true. Most of the time the servers behind the counter are very young people probably on min wage and are not focused on serving customers, they can be chit chatting or just uninterested. We will not go back again and do not recommend it. The only reason we have been going there is because it is near our home. There are other good bakeries in the Mission that serve you better and don't charge you as much.
author: Roz R.

description:
Disappointed with customer service.

I pre-ordered a cake based on the suggestion of a clerk (I was told they might run out). When I found out that I ordered the wrong cake, I tried to change the order first thing when they opened and was told that I couldn't. I ordered a standard cake (with no writing added) that they had in their case, along with multiples of the one I wanted. When I pointed out that I simply wanted to switch with what they had, they said they couldn't because I pre-ordered. When I told them I was disappointed, all I got was a glare in return.
author: Gian B.

description: Now Valley Bakery presented its goodies in Golden Gate Restaurants Association's industry conference in April. I loved it, and so does everyone else there. The croissant I tried there is surely one of the best.
author: Donna Z.

description: So I've never actually been to Noe Valley Bakery, but my coworker brought pastries to work, and oh my goodness. So good. I only tried the mushroom croissant / pastry, but it was super flaky, and the mushrooms had SO much flavor. I die. I'll have to stop by next time I'm in Noe Valley [which... isn't very often, but maybe it'll happen more now that I know this bakery is there!].
author: Amy L.

description:
Came by here to get a cake for my wife's birthday.  I'm not remotely close to this place, but was by here with another company event.  Small little bakery on a small shopping street in Noe Valley.  

WOW, soooo glad I got the cake!!  It was a "got milk" cake, which translates into chocolate on chocolate with chocolate frosting.  THIS WAS AMAZING!!!  One of the better cakes I've had period.

Also got a "most-ess" cupcake which is a clone of the classic hostess chocolate with white swirl across the top and filling inside.  One of the best cupcakes I've had in my life.  The perfect mix of moist cake and marshmellowy cream filling.

This place is f#%#ing awesome!!
author: Arthur Y.

description:
Noe Vallys Bakery was an awsome find , they have a great vareity of desserts , cupcakes , cookies well everything you would expect to find in a bakery, my favorite so far is im assuming an oreo cupcake , stuffed with fluffy cream and toped with frosting and a little oreo , it tasted so good..

The staff is very friendly , the bakers are perfectionists..

All in all this place is great if your cracing sweets or Bread take a stroll through noes Vally and stop at the bakery you will not be disappointed.
author: Abe M.

description:
We get baked goods here a few times a week. The savory and sweet scones are delicious. My husband lovers them.
 The pastries I've tried are generally tasty. However they put too much frosting on their cakes.
It's much easier to park in this part of Noe Valley than in the 
location near Tartine, and I think their baked products are as good.
author: Sheila F.

description: Cupcakes were basically frozen. They came with no warning or guidance that they weren't immediately consumable. Sadly the cupcakes didn't taste very good either. Was looking forward to trying his place out but unfortunately I won't be returning.
author: Patrick J.

description: Little bakery right in Noe Valley (obviously...). They are known for their Mostest Cupcakes, a fun take on the Hostess cupcake with curled icing on the top. They are totally adorable and a really big hit at parties. To be honest though, they aren't my favorite...just not sweet enough for me. If I am going to splurge and have a cupcake, I want it to be decadent! I preferred the Brown Butter-Salty Sugar Cookies. They were crunchy and a great combo of sweet and salty!
author: Kari G.

description:
The hostess with the MOST-EST... cupcake, that is. 
Don't ask me how patronizing this place on a start of an already bad day led to me making it on the ch7 news, but somehow, it all played together, and I did.  

J Church down for the count... starving... dropped off by diverting shuttle on 24th instead of Cesar Chavez. My trusted memory from all the Yelp reading remembered this bakery and its famed cupcakes... Onward, soldier... hunt for thy cupcake!!!

And so I did; and I found. Asked the kind guy for his bit of advice. Virgin cupcake visit? Must have 'gourmet Hostess cupcake'... the Most-est.

Bavarian cream.. chocolate ganache? Rich chocolate cake? Say no more, sir! One of those, please! Rested it in the sun for 3-4 mins, as was advised, to allow the cream to start melting into the cake. Ate on the street while hurtling toward Omnivore books, trying not to trip in my Danskos. 

You should pig out on their cupcakes too!: moral of the story. 
The End!
PS Grabbed, too, a petite little russian tea cake... I could make endless recipes of those suckas...
author: Jana C.

description:
This is more of a shout out to my favorite cupcakes and the Noe Valley Bakery, as this place is slowly becoming my favorite cupcake place. Cupcakes are so wildly popular these days, but kids it's not a new concept. I love cupcakes and wish I could eat one everyday of my life, but that's just not going to happen.

After walking around 24th Street, we decide to stop for cupcakes. Then she says "maybe we should get some food first", but all that's on my mind is "I wonder what the cupcakes taste like". The whole time we are eating, I'm thinking about the cupcakes. Are they getting squished in the box, maybe I should peek.

So far I've had the:

Lemon Drop cupcake
Chocolate Fudge cupcake
Red Velvet cupcake
Chocolate Cream Filled Hostess Cupcake Look-alike

After reading some other reviews, I can't wait to try the rest....
author: Rebekah T.

description: ...Bought two small scones $7.50...price gouging for mediocre product..  The scones are half as good as Bovine Bakery Point Reyes or Tartine Bakery in Mission...
author: jim b.

description:
Awful service! They would not make my cake. I called earlier to ask about printing a picture on a cake. They said bring it in on a drive or email it, I did both. I came back 1 hour later and now they only accepted printed images. With 1 hour before they close I doubt I will find a printer.

I bartered with a random person to use their printer. I got the cake just now, the quality of the print is like a printer from 1999. Hopefully the cake is better than my
author: Avishaan S.

description: Love the cookies and the friendly customer service at this bakery!  Second visit here and both times have been great. Their chocolate chip pecan cookies are huge and made with Guittard chocolate.  They also sell refrigerated cookie dough, which I haven't tried making yet, but were delicious when a friend made some for a party.
author: Donna L.

description: i was looking for carrot cake for days and weeks on our trip along the californian coast now - and here it is! FINALLY! i found the carrot cup cake at noe bakery and it was delicious!! just perfect! i just could eat another one right after. at noe's bakery there were plenty of choices, that looked wonderful. i definitely have to come back again for more.
author: diemo b.

description:
Food: I've tried all the breakfast pastries and I think they are just okay, flavor is minimal.  I've tried a few of their breads and also they are just okay.  I wish they would have variety in what they bake and offer instead of the same thing everyday.  A different bread each day of the week following the same schedule each week is not variety. 

Service: I find their sales associates to be aloof.  The last experience I had here, and is why I will never return, was this:  On a Tuesday morning I stopped in to pick up one dozen pastries for a meeting (I am not a huge fan but my colleagues may like them) and when I knocked on the door at 6:56am and politely asked if I could get come in even though they don't open until 7:00am I was told "uuuuh yeah, that's like in 5 minutes so nooooo".  Thanks so much for the attitude.  If I was told "thanks for stopping but unfortunately no, we don't open for another few minutes and can't sell anything yet" I would have waited but the snarky comment and poor attitude sent me away.

No more Noe Valley Bakery for me.
author: Joan P.

description:
great customer experience from nvb&b :)

scenario:
1)  i live in socal and boyf lives in norcal
2)  his bday was sunday, dec. xx 
3)  i couldn't make it to his bday because i'm traveling for work
4)  needed a surprise bday cake for his dinner with his friends

mission:
look for a bakery to help me bake a soccer ball cake (sculpted cake) AND deliver cake to said restaurant for birthday dinner.

experience:
excellent customer service from phone call with xavier(?) to working via e-mail with terry the manager.  xavier recommended that i email terry to check if the order can be fulfilled.  terry promptly responds to my email, understood my requests, and followed-up diligently.  

result:
unfortunately they were able to bake/sculpt the cake but couldn't deliver it to the restaurant.  since i couldn't find someone to successfully deliver the cake to the restaurant, i had to go with someone else to complete my soccer cake mission.

regardless, i will definitely keep nvb&b in mind next time i'm in town and need a cake or baked goods :)  keep up the excellent customer service!
author: Alice C.

description:
Needed just a few cupcakes to celebrate my baby boy's birthday. Got the chocolate caramel, the most-est and the vanilla cupcakes. Thank GOD they were moist and delicious! The frosting is quite thick but I LOVE that it is not so sweet.  The vanilla cupcake was a little drier than the other two but it worked out perfectly fine for my baby boy. Cupcakes here??? YES!!!!
by the way, the young lady who helped me was very kind. : )
author: Luna R.

description: Not as good as it used to be. Pricey and the signature cupcakes We all Loved are gone, replaced by boring vanilla and chocolate with no filling. Cookies are very mediocre. The store keeps remodeling with less and less display and product.
author: Deborah H.

description: 'Got Milk' is the best chocolate cake I have ever tasted.  Cookies and scones a delicious as well.  Friendly, helpful staff.
author: Tonja D.

description: I don't know if I was there on an off day, but the sourdough wasn't so great. The bread tasted good but just didn't have that tang...it was really just like a regular loaf of bread, good, but not worth going out of the way for, not for the sourdough at least.
author: Michele D.

description: The staff are nice enough, but they don't make up for the lack of flavor many products have. Case in point: a vanilla cupcake. There was no discernible taste of vanilla, and the lack of vanilla odor is curious. Then there was the chocolate cupcake. It had been over baked and the top was hard as a rock, covered with frosting it looked fine. Not.
author: William M.

description:
This place was a-buzz with patrons the day I passed by.  So, I decided to see what all the commotion was about since I had a hankering for cookies.  Cookies IMO reflect the thoughtfulness of the bakery, so I decided to have a smattering of the cookies here so I could get some sense of this bakery's talent. Here's what I found:

* Oatmeal cookie:  These were good.  Still chewy, with a little crisp outside.  Good taste, not too sweet with enough cinnamon.  Not spectacular because they didn't taste all that fresh. 

* Chocolate chip cookie: I really don't say this often, but yuck. How do you mess up chocolate chip cookies?  This batch tasted like they had been sitting around for more than a day, heck a week! Had a bitter finish. I was compelled to spit it out. 

* Ginger snap: The flavor was good, but no snap.  However, they weren't soft and chewy either, like if it was crispy at one point in it's life, but softened up from sitting out. 

* Chocoquake: It tasted fine, but just meh and a little dry - not really worth the calories.

This was a nice little bakery with a fantastic Christmas display.  It also gave the feel of the "local bakery" that the neighborhood families go to.  For that and the overall A-ok taste of the two out the four cookies I sampled, I'd give it three stars.  However, when the lady in front of me tried to point out to the guy behind the counter that there was a fly in the glass display hopping from cookie to cookie, the guy just shrugged his shoulder and said, "Oh, well." He ignored her and went on to the next customer.  That grossed me out.  That's why this was a two-star experience. Maybe I'm being generous. Sigh.
author: Paolo M.

description:
Was on a quest to find an Italian Cream Cake for my spouse's birthday.  So, I thought I  would go to the friendly neighborhood bakery and ask them if they could help.  

They said "Sorry, we don't make cakes made to order." You can only select certain cake flavors/fillings from their list, and what an uninspired list it was.  Seriously?  It's really not so hard to make a cake, and Italian Cream is a pretty classic type of cake.  Guess, it is beyond them. 

Looks like I was wrong about the friendly neighborhood bakery thing.  No worries, found a nice little bakery in the Mission that remembers what a neighborhood bakery is all about!

*Was never very impressed with the bread here anyways.  Having frequented Germany to visit relatives, I am always amazed how wonderful the bread is there.  It is a party of daily life - crisp and soft all at once.  The bread at NVBB is nothing like it, much spongier, the crust not quite crisp, and overpriced, Tartine's is much more in line with European style bread.
author: Peter S.

description:
Got a few items here while waiting to be seated at Griddle Fresh. Was pleasantly surprised at the selection and tea. 

Bought the chocolate croissant, cranberry meyer lemon scone, and a couple other pretty pastries. The chocolate croissant could not be warmed up because the store just opened/renovated but it was decent. The scone was crunchy on the outside and cakey on the insides. 

Tried the honey milk tea which was super good! My friend got the vanilla tea and it tasted like hot water even when it was brown. Think he might have put too much half and half in himself. So as a warning do not go trigger happy with the milk/halfnhalf with your tea. Whatever is prepared by your barista is good as is.
author: Liz N.

description:
Very good bread....  excellent croissants....   and friendly workers

can't say a bad thing about them......  thanks for being there!
author: linda b.

description: Love the moist red valvet cake. One of the best cake I"ve tried. Two thumbs up. Will be coming often.
author: makhine n.

description:
I had walked by this place multiple times during the week I was in the area and each time I was either not in the mood for baked goods or when I was the place was closed already. After some extensive research, I found out that if I go there during their hours of operation, I could get something that I could eat later. These are the kind of hard hitting analytical skills I learned in grad school.

I ended up getting an eclair and one of those morning bun thingy. The eclair was good but nothing really that special. I had no idea what a morning bun is other than it looking like a sugar-coated hipster cinnamon bun, which made me feel totally underground when I took that first bite.
author: Ian L.

description:
Much to my doctor's relief I'm not really a sweet tooth kinda guy so not commenting on all the goodies but I have started taking a morning Sightglass coffee from these folks on the way to work.
Have found the service to be great - staff are drop-dead cute - and the coffee hits the spot.
author: David P.

description: I tried the bakery for the first time on St. Patrick's Day and bought a loaf of Irish soda bread. It was absolutely fantastic! I was practically licking the last crumbs off of my plate this morning. Hopefully I won't have to wait until 2017 for more!!
author: Marcy C.

description: The best carrot cake cupcake ever!!! Beats Kara's hands down. I've been to this bakery a few times and had only cookies and pastries...which are also on point. The girls behind the counter are adorable and friendly. Love this place!!
author: Michelle D.

description: This place is great! I came by before closing and they only had a few options left. I settled for the ham and cheese croissant and potato and veggie quiche. Both were delicious. I would definitely come in the morning where there are more options available. A great local bakery to support!
author: Allison S.

description:
"Oh god, this Boston Cream Cupcake is so damn enchanting to watch. For $2.50, the cream-filling treat was also too pretty to eat.
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/oHuPyoGY7nhCQeprHCv21g?select=1NtN1_A8jTWUKtiY9NDQpw

As beautiful as the treat looks, unfortunately the ending was unbearable to watch!
author: Matt G.

description: Try to call last Friday to reserved an apple pie which should be a easy thing but a first got put on hold for good 5 mins this guy call Beau answer said he cannot reserved without a payment which is totally not true since a few weeks ago I call to see whether they have an apple pie or not the other guy either Bill or Michael was happy to hold the last one for me without payment and even until half an hour before they close. I was on the road and told Beau that is not convenient but happy to leave my phone # and this is not even a special order just an apple pie and I said since I m on the outside in the public area that is not  convenient to pull out my credit card but all he said he won't hold it without payment and when I ask for a store manager he said manager is not there, if he wouldn't hold then just said no but what's the point to keep me on the phone telling me he can't hold without payment so I hang up. No way I would go back with this kind of rude services.
author: K W.

description: My very favorite bakery in the world!  I come here every time I visit my sister. She can never move! Especially love there scones. Also Trying the Macarons today & fruit tarts.
author: Denise S.

description: What's with the weird pointy baguettes?  The ends are too hard to eat, unless you enjoy cracked teeth.  The bread tastes stale near the edges.  Many people, like me, enjoy the heels of the bread and you've ruined them.  Bring back the normal rounded edges.  I'm on the hunt for a replacement to my favorite baguette source, unless you change back.
author: Diappointed X.

description:
I/ve lived in Noe Valley for 10 years, yet never made it to NVB until this past Thanksgivng, 2015.
I ordered a Berry Pie for the holiday, and was so pleased. The fruit in these pies is organic - - go try to find that ANYWHERE else - - La Boulangerie and Whole Foods charge the same prices (low $20's) and don't use organic berries.
I ordered the Cranberry/Pear pie for Christmas, again organic, and also well priced.
Their Cheese Scones are delicious, too. I call up and order those on the phone so that they're waiting for pick up, as they sell out fast.
It's a charming, low key bakery in the heart of Noe Valley, and well worth the prices.
Certainly, not "run of the mill," as someone said. You get it, or you don't...
Jack Mc / jaxview
author: Jack M.

description:
Cute bakery in Noe Valley. 

Tried: 
*Red velvet cupcake (3 of 5) - Overflowing cupcake top. The top was a little hard and tasted like a brownie. But very moist in the middle and I really liked their cream cheese frosting. It wasn't too sweet like Sprinkes, and had a rich cream cheese taste. Like a cheese cake. I like the frosting on this cupcake a lot.
*Moistest (4 of 5) - Chocolate with cream filling and ganache topping. Looks like a big hostess cupcake and tastes like one. Super fresh and super moist. It is very good. 

In the window display, I saw lots of cute decorative cartoon cupcakes. Not sure what is the price, but their creative cupcakes are very appealing. I think you need 24-30 days to pre-order. Definitely worth checking out for moms looking to surprise their kids with an awesome birthday cupcake surprise party.
author: Janice T.

description: The chocolate chip cookie was so ooey gooey & perfect. A great spot for a sweet treat while shopping in Noe!
author: Lauren M.

description: Almond croissant was definitely on the sweeter side, but still delicious.  I highly reccomend it.  I recently tried "The Republic" cupcake to my dismay. After a few bites of trying to convince myself that it wasn't that bad, I had to toss it.  Their Brown Butter Cookie is fabulous, and their quiche is pretty good.  What's good is great, and what isn't --really isn't.
author: Whitney P.

description: This used to be one of my favorite bakeries in the city. In the last year or so, though, I've found that I don't like their baked goods as much as I used to. I'm not sure if it's them or me, but I feel like more emphasis is put on the appearance of the treats than on the substance and taste.
author: Lisa K.

description:
Solid bakery with good customer service. It's difficult to go wrong here, because the offerings are all tasty. I have really enjoyed their brownies, their chocolate-chip cookies, and their chocolate-caramel cupcakes. I also LOVE the lemon cupcakes - a big burst of lemon flavor under a fluffy, creamy lemon cream frosting. I'm not as huge a fan of the hostess cupcakes as some others - namely due to the heaviness of the ganache on top - but it's good, don't get me wrong. Their muffins and scones are excellent.

I will also note that the cupcakes aren't tiny, but nor are they gargantuan. More like on the larger side, though, so you get a good value for the money. If you're in the area, definitely worth it to stop by.
author: Lis B.

description: I would say amazing bakeries but the service there is not very good, they just threw my cookies, pecan pie and a brownie all together in a small brown bag... I would have expected a more gentle treatment of the food I was buying!!
author: Elisa B.

description: The baked goods look amazingly scrumptious, but I was very disappointed with their 'iced chai latte' that was served without ice!!! They apparently do not carry 'ice'! They never told me that their 'iced' drinks didn't have 'ice', so unfortunately, I had to go elsewhere for the 'iced chai'.
author: William H.

description:
it's the cutest.  breakfast, snack, or dessert.  this should be your go to spot when you are in noe.

oh, and don't forget to grab a latte!
author: Casey L.

description:
Why does this place have such great reviews? I first want to say that the people who work here are AMAZING. They are all incredibly nice, but their service could not change my mind about my 2-star review (based purely on the cupcakes and Mexican wedding cookie).

Okay after reading how great the cupcakes were, I was excited to come stop by. However, maybe my expectations were too high because the flavor of the Boston cream pie fell short. The cake was dry and lacked flavor. The chocolate frosting was too thick and overpowered the rest of the cupcake. The filling of cream cheese was minimal and not enjoyable. So much for great cupcakes...I thought they could be redeemed by their Mexican wedding cookies, but even those were not impressive.

I definitely won't be coming back. Waste of money & time. The only positive about the bakery was the great service.
author: Surge C.

description:
Let me just start by saying, Noe Valley Bakery has AMAZING cakes which is why we wanted them to make our wedding cake.   

We started by going into the store and inquiring and were  handed a really old binder filled with many different options for event cakes in the busy and small storefront.  When we asked if we could talk with someone about ordering a cake, we were given an email address and told that all ordering would happen over email.  Seemed a little weird, but fine.  However, a week later when we were ready to start the process, there was no information or catalog online to review pricing or what we wanted to get.  I emailed the person asking for this information and about a week later I got a pleasant and vague response asking me to give details about what we wanted to get and that they could do what we needed. They said they were available for our date and might possibly be available for delivery.  Not being able to make it back to the store to review options, I gave a basic idea of what we thought we thought we were looking for, with color scheme and cake flavor, there was no response. I was excited to get the process started and talk about options and pricing.  About a week later we received  an email saying that due to staffing they were no longer available to make our wedding cake for our date. 

Overall, not impressed with the customer service.  We were very disappointed with the lack of information provided and the lack of attention to our needs.  We are sad not to have their product at our wedding and are now having to start from scratch.  If this is a service they wish to provide, I suggest making some changes in the way things are handled and have more transparent information on their website and or the ability to talk with someone in person to place an order.
author: Rachel D.

description: This place really isn't that good. Way overpriced for what you get. I won't go there anymore. Not worth it.
author: Jo M.

description:
While I've been in before for their delicious cupcakes (The Most-est is incredible), it wasn't until Yelp's Sugar High promotion that I discovered Noe Valley Bakery also sells rugelach- a Jewish cookie staple! 

Thankfully the promotion coincided with my great-uncle's 90th birthday, so I placed an order for three dozen raisin-pecan rugelach for the dessert table. 

To say these went over well was an understatement. One octogenarian raved that they were just like homemade, then she corrected herself...actually, better than homemade!  My aunt raved about their delicousness, and my great-uncle took a bite and recalled his favorite memories of his great aunt Bertha painstakingly making these same cookies for him as a child, nearly weekly. Total Ratatouille moment. 

The rugelach went quickly and everyone took note of the name of the bakery for future reference. Thanks Noe Valley Bakery and Yelp Sugar High!

* Check out their website to see their Passover dessert offerings, Rosh Hashanah, and Hanukkah treats too!
author: Joanne G.

description: The cranberry lemon scone is INSANE. Best breakfast pastry of my life. I visit at least once or twice a month for scones and to pick up a loaf of bread. We have been really into the wheat sandwich bread lately. Also had a seasonally available pumpkin muffin recently that was wonderful. Love this place.
author: Rachel R.

description: I like this bakery. They serve a large variety of baked items.  I really like their cheesecake topped with fresh berries and the pumpkin cheese cake.  Both tasted delicious and fresh.   Customer service was friendly and I would definitely go there again.  I cannot think of any other bakery that could make cheesecake better than this bakery.  I am usually afraid to order cheesecake, because you do not know how long it has been sitting inside the display case.  Some people think cheese cake has a long shelf life, but I do not think that is true.
author: Hiroshi K.

description: I had an absolutely spectacular banana walnut streusel muffin here.  It brought back memories of muffins in the pre-Starbucks era...
author: Mark H.

description:
I've been curious about this place for a while and I was finally able to stop by for something.

I ordered the Milky Way Bomb by request of a friend who insisted it was amazing. He said it was made and modeled after a Milky Way chocolate bar. It looked interesting but I had no idea what exactly was inside. 

I didn't eat it til later because I was so stuffed from lunch. Silly me didn't refrigerate it, but it was still good. I didn't expect it to be filled with mousse.

First bite was CRAZY. Insane chocolate explosion in your mouth with little malt balls? I'm not sure what they were but they added texture and made it taste even better than it already was. It's interesting because I think it would have tasted even better if I ate it at the proper temperature it was supposed to be at. 

It was all so good, I started eating it too quickly. It did get kind of overwhelmingly sweet after a while but I regret nothing. I think it would be a good thing to get to share with one other person.

Anyway, I had a good impression based on that one thing I got so I do plan on going back and trying other things.
author: Sofia R.

description: Yum! Good Stuff!  The fruit tart is gorgeous and tasty, macarons are on point and the cupcakes make everyone happy! You can order over the phone, those tarts fly off the shelf on weekends and holidays!
author: Shawn C.

description:
..went to Noe Valley Bakery for a few Valentine cupcakes for my love. After a lovely dinner I surprised him with a champagne cupcake and a chocolate cake (which I understand was marked as extra-moist). sorry, driest cupcakes ever- milk barely saved them. Not sure I would go back. 


signed - crumbs stuck to my throat.
author: Ernest S.

description:
I tried their Chocolate Chip Pecan Cookies and Pecan Tartlet and it was all very good - the cookies were moist and had the perfect amount of sweetness.  The tartlet was a fantastic way to have a pecan pie as a single serving.

The variety at Noe Valley Baking Co. is pretty awesome and there's definitely something for everyone.
author: Ken G.

description: I had an amazing birthday cake from Noe Valley Bakery. The cake was decorated brilliantly (see rainbow cake pic) and was delicious - vanilla buttercream! The cake was light and fluffy, sweet (not overly sweet), and the whipped cream was light and deliciously addictive. Even my friend who doesn't eat sweets and desserts couldn't resist herself and had two big slices. I definitely recommend this bakery and will use them for future events.
author: Cheryl C.

description:
While waiting, the customer ahead of me asked "What is the red velvet cake?" to which the helpful counter person replied, "It's a red velvet cake". 

I asked for the sourdough whole wheat bread. She asks "do you want me to cut it?" I said "Sure!" Well, she charged extra without telling me in advance and the slices weren't cut all the way through. And the bread itself was TERRIBLE!!!
author: John G.

description:
I usually enjoy picking up a cookie or cupcake here when I'm in the neighborhood, but this last visit, my son wanted a chocolate croissant and I wanted a chocolate cookie, which are in different display cases.  The person helping me put the croissant in a bag and placed it on top of that counter and then walked over to me at the other counter to get the cookie in another bag and placed it on top of that counter.  Was it that hard to carry the croissant over to hand to me?  Did you really need to have me reach over customers to get my croissant when you could have handed it to me when I paid for them?

Their baked items are great, but one person's customer service needs an attitude check every now and then.
author: Maria S.

description:
yes yes yes... very good... 

We were in SF this weekend and stopped by twice...

We tried a sweet baguette..... and several pastries... A little pricey but very good to go....

Yummy.. We will be back again....
author: Joe B.

description: Delicious apricot hamantasch and pecan-raisin rugelach. Will visit again very soon. To try out tarts and other delicacies you need to visit early in the day. Most of the things get sold out by early evening.
author: Sudeep G.

description:
4 stars because I haven't tried their cookies yet; I'll be back soon! 

Forget your designer cupcakes: Sprinkles, Kara's or whatever it is that you're eating with pounds of frosting on top. Just STOP (hammer time)! 

If you've think you've had a cupcake I beg of you to differ. Noe Valley Bakery makes these delectable & edible cups of love & joy. Whether you're stopping by for a pastry, cookie or something sweet, you must not miss out on the cupcakes. 

My friend and I paid a visit after we made a stop at Chocolate Covered next door to fix our fixin' for chocolate....anyway! We stepped put into this cute bakery to check out what they had in store. There we were staring at display cases of cakes, cookies, pastries, cookie dough/scone dough to-go and cupcakes. 

I tried the Most-Est cupcake ($2.95); if the thin but luscious chocolate coating on top doesn't get you then I'm positive the moist chocolate cake and light, airy filling will. I was in heaven when I took my first bite. (Even a lady passing by told me that was her favorite cupcake and she has one almost everyday.)  

Forget those chain cupcakes & try a local one. It'll knock your tastebuds' socks off.
author: Carol L.

description:
What  can I say, I'm in love!  I stopped in just to check it out and walked out with 6 cupcakes.  This is one of the best red velvet cupcakes I've had, the frosting isn't too sweet or thick, just right.  My next best is the carrot cupcake, and let's not forget the Lemon Drop cupcake and Most-ess Cupcake, which is an adult spin on the Hostess Cup Cakes.  

I'm a true fan of supporting local businesses and that's exactly why I decided to order cupcakes and a cake from Noe Valley Bakery for my graduation party.  They were willing to accomodate my request of 50 cupcakes the day before my celecration. I'm glad I went with Noe Valley Bakery, all of the guest raved about how delicious the cupcakes were.  My custom graduation cake, with each of my favorite bay area teams decorating the sides of a hazelnut sponge and chocolate filled cake. Yummy, I can still taste the flavors of my cake!
author: ERICA G.

description: My son loves their double raisin bread, other than that nothing at this place really jiggles my wires. I also find it on the expensive side.
author: Michael S.

description:
I walked in here because their displays outside of all the cakes looked good...I bought because their selection looked even better...I'll keep coming back because their stuff, they're all DELICIOUS!  I haven't sampled everything yet, not even close.  I bought a little of everything to sample....cookies, mini cupcakes, scones and regular cupcakes and they were all good.  They have cookie dough you can buy to bake at home.

There's a lot to be said when you look inside and there are a bunch of people inside a cozy little shop. 

You have to try their cupcakes, they are sooo good.  Sinfully good.
author: M D.

description: Wow... I got two cupcakes, a vanilla and a chocolate. They were probably the most disappointing cupcakes I've ever had. They were beautifully decorated, but lacked flavor. They were also cold and dry. I was hoping I'd found a new good bakery, looks like I'll be sticking with Susie Cakes (which is delicious)!
author: Danielle J.

description:
Noe Valley Bakery has relieved me of baking things from scratch. Their red velvet cake is the most authentic that I have ever tasted and it is comparable to my family recipe that has been handed down. The mostess cupcake is a crowd pleaser from kids to the most refined foodie friends.
So thanks to Noe Valley Bakery I never need to bake again- but please order ahead because they are rightfully popular!
author: Melissa B.

description:
Holy crap these are good cupcakes!

I tried red velvet and their version of the Hostess chocolate cupcake. Both were decadently moist and fluffy. The frosting wasn't overly sweet, either. Normally, I'm not a huge fan of frosting - I usually wipe it off on the napkin (gasp!) and just eat the cake part. But not this time. I licked my fingers like a ravenous animal.

I don't mind paying $3.25 per cupcake when they are this good.
author: Mariela D.

description:
This was a cute bakery that I stumbled upon in Noe Valley. I  wanted something light, so I tried the love bun and asiago roll. Both were excellent!

The love bun was simple and delicious. Imagine soft, sweet bread topped with sugar and filled with custard. The asiago roll was freshly baked and covered with just the right amount of cheese. 

I'd love to try their cupcakes and other goodies next time I visit!
author: Patti F.

description:
The World According to Noelle
Allergic Girl's Guide to Life

"noe valley bakery 
& bread company-
the sweetest spot 
in san francisco."

- noelle w.

i've been wanting to try out this bakery for some time. we finally made a trip up there this weekend!

items we purchased:
2 boston cream cupcakes w/ fleur de sel
4 chocolate-caramel-fleur de sel cupcakes
2 savory cheese croissants 
2 apricot hamentashen
2 blueberry pecan scones
one loaf of organic sourdough wheat bread

the cupcakes were the best i've had in a long time- they had the perfect frosting to cupcake ratio. the savory cheese croissants we flaky, buttery and just delish. the apricot hamentashen were the best i've ever had in my entire life! too bad they don't make poppy hamentashen. my brother and cousin said they liked the blueberry pecan scones. the organic sourdough wheat bread was a crowd favorite. its a cozy bakery. prices are decent. everything was sweet, fresh and simply delicious!

noelle's notes
love this place!
author: Noelle J.

description: This is for sure one of the best bakeries in the city, but not everyone knows about it. It's like a neighborhood gem. I LOVE their fruit tart, which has less amount of sweetness, exactly the way I like it. The crust is super flaky and the topping is always refreshing. I have also tried their scones and red velvet cakes, and they are all yummy! My only complaint is finding a parking spot close by, which is close to impossible on 24th street, but the refreshing tart is certainly worth the parking hassle!
author: Jennifer S.

description:
Cupcake review:

So I asked my friend to recommend a place with best cupcake. Not being a big fan of cupcakes, if she had to give me ONE cupcake to change my mind, what would it be. She said Noe Valley Bakery. I was not sold.

I got there pretty late in the day so most of the cupcakes were probably gone, but I got the Red Velvet cupcake, and the Boston Cream Pie cupcake. The red velvet with its cream cheese frosting was much too sweet for me. The cake good, but also still too sweet. Same went for the boston cream pie cupcake. The cake with the custard filling was delicious, but the frosting was so sweet I scraped half of it off. 

The other pastries and cakes looked good.. I might be back to try the other items, because I guess cupcakes just aren't my thing.
author: Jaime H.

description: Adore this place! I can't get enough of their raisin bread. It is the perfect blend of sweet and chewy. I haven't tried a ton of the other stuff, but their daily bread specials sound amazing!
author: christine c.

description: Just when you think there can't possibly be more cupcake places in the city... there's Noe Valley Bakery. Lots of variety, more than just cupcakes -- and you gotta love the train display in the very front.
author: Mel G.

description: Top notch bakery with amazing cakes! I am now 3 for 3 with crowd pleasing beautiful and delicious cakes....one for a birthday party and two for baby showers. All amazing!  Thank you Now Valley Bakery! You are my custom cake go to, for sure!
author: Jessica G.

description: I needed a surprise Birthday cake for my wife last minute.   I had order from noe valley bakery and i have to say great service.  Man the best cake i have ever had.  Thanks for a special cake for my wife!  This is a must try to all my friends and family Sooooooooooo Goooood!!
author: Toan H.

description:
Milky Way Bomb was creamy good!  It was a nice chocolate mousse just like the other reviews said with a slight crunch.  The chocolate was tasty but mild almost.  But the Chocolate Caramel Fleur de Seil cupcake was the best by far.  A nice chocolate cupcake with caramel, cream and a sprinkle of salt on the frosting.  A nice combination!  

The cashiers were all very happy and helpful. Makes a difference in setting the mood to purchase something sweet to enjoy or to purchase anything in the bakery.

Would definitely go back to try the breads and more desserts.  Parking was good as I found parking in front even though it's metered.
author: Good D.

description:
My boss purchased a loaf of their pumpkin bread for each person in our group as a little present for the holidays. I haven't opened mine yet, because we still have tons of left over desserts from our Christmas Eve dinner, but I tried a little bit from a loaf we opened up during our Holiday potluck.

It's pretty good and tastes like what you would expect pumpkin bread to taste like. It's not overly sweet, but the cream cheese frosting on top is nice. My boss is allergic to nuts, so she likes to buy this pumpkin bread because it doesn't contain any pecans or walnuts, like most breads do.

We also had some of their Minty-O's, which are essentially their Noe-O's dipped in mint-infused chocolate and decorated with little candy cane sprinkles. They are just the right balance of mint and chocolate -- reminiscent of Girl Scout Thin Mints, but better!

If I were in the area and looking for some yummy treats, I would like to try some of their other items!
author: Leana L.

description: We have ordered cakes, eaten cookies and drank coffee from this bakery. The cakes are gorgeous - always a big hit. And tasty. Both grown-ups and kids enjoy them. The cookies and other treats are equally scrumptious. The staff is nice, informative and all my orders have been ready to go at the right time.
author: Sarah B.

description: Their desserts are well made. This bakery is authentic and cute. I find it charming and friendly. Service is always superb. I had cupcakes there, moist and perfectly balanced. When I'm in the neighborhood, I always bought the wheat loaf home.
author: Diana T.

description:
The breads and sweets are great.  However, I'm the kind of person that notices when there is a high employee turnover rate.  Even though the bakers, I'm sure, are stable, the counter staff people are always different week to week.  This makes me question how the owners and managers treat their employees.  I've always had a nice experience with the workers there, but there are ALWAYS new people.  This is not a good representation of what is going on behind the counter...

It really bothers me, ethically, when a place is successful, but the employee turnover rate is higher than it should be in such a "nice" place.
author: Jo M.

description:
Warning, danger ahead!  Delicious goodies!  I'm not kidding the scones are like Crack and just as addictive!  They need to add another branch to the 12-step program just for Noe Vally Bakery!

I've got it bad for this place!

Wonderful service.
Clean, welcoming space.
Beautiful location.
Yummy and I do mean YUMMY scones!  I'm totally addicted.  I don't live anywhere near this bakery but I find myself stopping by all the time because "i'm in the neighborhood".  Yeah right!  I'm NOT fooling anyone and certainly not my hips!  I'm in deep trouble and the first step to healing is admitting the problem; hence my Yelp review.

Help me!  Help me!  Please.............I need help :)


psst; there's a public paid lot nearby for easy parking......
author: Mia T.

description: From all the way across the country in South Carolina, I wanted to arrange a special birthday surprise for a friend while they were visiting San Francisco. Carley at Noe Valley Bakery was helpful, efficient, & courteous. The cupcakes were a big hit. Thanks all!
author: H S.

description:
In looking at my distribution of reviews, they're overweighted on 4-5 stars. Writing 1-2-star reviews of a business isn't kind after only one visit, but this one has been earned. Noe Bakery has a convenient location in a neighborhood shopping area, period. I live fairly close to but have given up on it. 

Rarely did I feel valued there. I could enter, or squeeze inside if even three customers were there already, and after a minute or two of checking on different items I'd look up and attempt to figure out which employee would help me....but that acknowledgement was delayed. The first occurrence was frustrating but it became amusing during my second and third (last) visits. 

Should I have been more assertive in this store? Just stating my order out loud would've been awkward, and perhaps a little crazy. :) Randomly picking someone who looked to me to be performing a less significant task, would've been presumptive, if not rude. 

The bakery is fairly small and they rarely had what I'm looking for - bread products for a meal or picnic, maybe savory tarts for a snack or meal - either because they were out or didn't make it. Said another way, I don't shop often for dessert products like cakes or cupcakes.
author: Mike H.

description:
Let's put it this way, I can name all the cupcakes I've bought and devoured  over the past two years without referring to their display case as a "cheat sheet". Here's my list of their cupcakes, in the order of scrumptiously calorifically delicious to delicious:
1. Moistest Cupcake: like a Hostess cupcake only infinitely better. I'd actually rank this as 1 and 2, just like we do Olympic standings, because it's just that good.
3. Red Velvet
4. DQ Mini 
5. Neopolitan
6. Lemon Drop
7. Fudge
8. Vanilla
9. Fleur de Sel
10. Champagne (V-day special) tied with Carrot Cake

Cupcake flavors at Noe Valley Bakery that I have yet to try:
1. Mint Mini

I believe by extensive knowledge of their cupcake menu speaks loads about the tastiness of their cupcakes. Pastries and cookies are ok but I don't think they're the highlight of the bakery. They're also somewhat pricier than other places so I'd go elsewhere if I'm in the pastry, cookie, or cake mood.

You'll only find metered parking in this area so prepare the quarters before a trip.
author: Gwen L.

description: I stopped by to pick up a few things. All three items I bought were quite good. The woman that helped me was very nice and I thought the price was right.
author: Will D.

description:
Got the chocolate mouse cake with raspberry filling for a birthday-it was delicious!  The cake itself was super moist and the raspberry is light and not overwhelming.  The chocolate ganache is divine.  I would give the cake 5 stars.  

I got the asiago bread which was tasty but had way too much cheese collecting in the center instead of being integrated in the bread itself.  I love cheese but not when it is just a big chunk in my mouth.  That is why I had to downgrade my review to 4 stars.  Still yummy, just not perfect.  

Would definitely get the cake again.
author: Vicki N.

description: This place is delicious - it's the cutest bakery with nice staff. It is a bit pricey, but great for birthday pastries as they're not overly sweet or dense. The location is in a great neighborhood with a lively atmosphere that's fun to walk around, especially on the weekends/in nice weather. The chocolate mousse bomb and the fruit tart are outstanding!
author: H C.

description:
One star because most of the staff is good and one star because their pastries and bread are pretty good.  Why not one, two or three more stars?  I'll tell you why... 
they have a younger maybe teenaged or very early twenties girl who has at least worked here for a while now and has over charged me a few times and always seems to have a bad attitude.  She will flash a smile usually at some point, I believe because she knows she has to not seem irritated at the fact that a paying customer has walked in the door.  The smile looks so forced. The rest of the experience having her roll her eyes and getting over charged only confirms it's forced.  I always know what I am going to order when I walk in, I say please, thank you, I am polite and I tip... I fail to believe that my personality if the defective one causing this situation.  Oh I almost forgot... AND I work in the area, one time another one of the good staff members mentioned to her about the discount I get for working just a few places down the block, she looked irritated at him, said "I know" continued to over charge me from the REGULAR price, looked me right in the eyes, said my total again and put her hand out.  Needless to say I now look to see if she is working and I won't go in there is she is.
My co-worker who is the sweetest woman also had a bad experience in here once as well when going in to purchase a birthday cake for her husband I believe.  I don't recall all the details but she is very loyal when it comes to places she gives her business to and she is a very understanding woman so if they had bad enough customer service to deter her from ever going here again something must be going wrong.
Lastly their pastries are okay.  They aren't bad but there are so many better places to go in the city for pastries.  If you are looking just in the Noe Valley area though then this is the place to go because they aren't bad.  They make decent breads, the morning pastries I've had such as muffins and croissants are good... they don't make their scones properly but my mother spent some time growing up in England so I am honestly probably just overly picky about my scones, and their cupcakes are decent as well.
author: Christina H.

description: Got overcharged for my beverage, so so cupcakes, but by no means Sprinkles, Tea Cake or Crumbz. Seems im not the only one getting overcharged by this place as I read other yelpers reviews who have experienced the same. When I have to tell you how much to charge me when the pricing menu is right behind you, we have a problem. Better than average crossaint, alright cookies. Would not return. Came all the way from Brisbane just to try this bakery. Sadly dissapointed.
author: Christina M.

description:
What's the big deal about their cupcakes?? They are good not great!

Trust me. I've had Kara's, Cako, Mission Minis, Baked..etc, and their cupcakes are far better looking and tasting. I only go to Noe to pick up cupcakes for my bf, who oddly likes them.

One thing that bugs me is increasing prices and diminishing quality. A few months ago I noticed their lemon cupcakes no longer had the cute handmade bumble bees with almond wings on them. They got replace with  yellow cough drops.  C'mon now bakers...$3.35 a pop? You could've created a girlfriend for the solo bumble bee.
author: Diane C.

description:
Cute bakery serving my favorite chocolate caramel fleur de sel cupcake and cheddar & chive scone.  

I love the icing on this cupcake as it's not  your typical icing...it is more fudge-like.  It's rich in flavor and texture, yet not very sweet as traditional cupcake icing.   Cupcake is very moist and not so sweet as well.  Has a nice balance of salty-sweetness.
author: Michelle N.

description: This review is for the cupcakes only. I ordered a variety of cupcakes and found that the frostings were good but the cupcake parts were very uninteresting. The cake was a bit dry and flat.
author: LeTran B.

description:
Once I get started on sweets, I can't have enough.  During lunch today I was bad and ordered a Pear Tart at the cafe.  

That did it for me, and I had to make my way over Noe Valley Bakery while I was in the neighborhood.  I went in at around 6:00pm, so many of goodies had already been sold, but luckily, they still had a few Fruit Tarts and Pecan Tartlettes left, a few of my favorites.  

The Pecan Tartlette was great--the crust was chewy and buttery.  It was sweet, but not overly sweet from the glaze inside.  One of the best little tarlettes that I've had before. 

Fruit Tarts are my weakness!  Those fruit tarts from Noe Valley Baker were so pretty in the window display and I had to order three.  Upon getting home, I couldn't help myself and devoured one.  To my slight disappointment, the tart was filled in the center with whip cream instead of a creamy sweet custard. The crust was the same as the pecan tarts.  Fruits were fresh, and glazed well with sugar syrup.  But the whip cream was definitely a turn off for me.  Almost made it a bit amateurish.

I'm so happy to have found a bakery that still had some whole wheat sourdough left.  So I had to order a loaf.  Tasted great, and although it was 6:00pm, the the texture seemed to be hard, as if it was day old.  But you can never tell. 

The Fruit Tart was $4.95 and Pecan Tartlett was about $2.95.  Whole Wheat Sourdough was a couple bucks, can't really remember.  

Prices were a bit pricey for the Fruit Tart.  Overall, presentation of tarts was beautiful, but the whip cream didn't really do it for me.  Might be back for other treats, just not the Fruit Tart.
author: Cass J.

description: NVB is one of the cities best bakeries, with delicious pastries, cakes, and freshly baked breads. The only thing you have to ask yourself is are you willing to spend quite a bit of money, because it is also one of the cities most expensive bakeries.
author: Double T.

description: Love the bread, love the cookies, love the people. Definitely worth the trip up 24th street to grab a loaf and a treat any night of the week. The babka is amazing and something I had never tried before!
author: Mario P.

description: Cute little bakery, love the cakes in the window. A plus is that there is a small bench in front of the shop, so you can enjoy your treats outside. Would definitely recommend and will keep the bakery in mind if I ever need a specially made cake!
author: Siv L.

description: LOVE this place! The soy lattes and rasperry croissants are amazing. Everything looks delicious. This place has become a part of my morning routine. Super nice staff.
author: Neal B.

description:
Don't forget to leave w/ frozen scones for breakfast the next day.

Cute place. Friendly service. They donate to the Food Runners project - awesome!

Buy one of everything - it's all great.
author: Vicki L.

description: Best. Lemon. Tart. Ever. ! Maybe i was just hungry. But no, it. Was. Delish!
author: Alan T.

description:
Damn good chocolate fudge layer cake. 

Like, it was spooky how good this cake was. The frosting was PURE FUDGE. All I could see were images of the old diabeetus guy. 

The cake was moist, decadent, wonderful. 

I did not buy this cake - it was presented to me. And now I will never forget it.
author: Andrea B.

description:
Great bakery to have in your neighborhood with a large selection of baked goods (bread, breakfast pastries, cupcakes, and cookies) at a reasonable cost.

My bf and I tried sweet and savory croissants, a danish, cupcakes, and Asiago cheese bread. Everything was pretty good, but the Asiago cheese bread was my favorite. Soft bread loaded with Asiago cheese, inside and out. Delicious. Cupcakes were very average- moist, but not as fluffy with dense frosting. Their red velvet was a little more chocolatey than most.
author: Sophia B.

description:
Five stars, why? The Neopolitan Cup Cake. That cupcake melts in you're mouth and gives you a warm fuzzy feeling...like, life is good.

And the employees are really friendly and seem to enjoy their job...
author: Michelle P.

description:
love all the sweet baked goods ... the red velvet, boston cream pie and chocolate caramel fleur de sel cupcakes are my favs. love the bear claws, and lately i've been trying their various muffins which are delish. 

it's between the post office and my bank ... which is way too convenient for me. and not so great for my waistline.
author: cynthia q.

description: Michael elegantly crafted my wedding cake last year. He listened intently to my desires for taste and structure and put forth an amazing product that everyone enjoyed aesthetically and found scrumptiously delicious.
author: Sarah H.

description: I disliked the service the lady working there didn't help me at all and was rushing me all I wanted was a cake. But she was just like yeah okay ,no, I don't know answers. Vey dissatisfied !
author: Wendy C.

description:
Peg's Very Important & Prestigious Cupcake Study* 

A random sampling of Noe Valley Bakery's carrot cupcake on Wednesday, April 22nd at 6:47 pm yields the moistest cupcake ever!

*note:  my study is neither comprehensive nor scientifically accurate.
author: Peg S.

description:
I wanted special cakes with a guitar theme for my birthday party. These guys made the perfect cakes, both when it comes to looks and taste. And it is not only me saying that, but all 50 people at the party agree And they (the cakes :-) were packed extremely well, too. 
Highly recommended!

PS. I have uploaded a picture of the cake resembling a Turquiose Fender Stratocaster EJ RW - admire the details!
author: Kaj HeGe H.

description: Somebody recommended this place for a good red velvet cake. And it was indeed very good (not the best though). Fresh and moist. Paid $30 for 8 inch red velvet cake. Very affordable in comparison to some other places. I would love to come back and try some of their baked goods.
author: Sara S.

description: I needed a birthday cake FAST and I needed a special order AND on a holiday weekend.   Just when I thought it couldn't be done - I found Noe Bakery.  Not only did they deliver an amazingly delicious cake, it was on time and designed beautifully.   Even my husband, who is very tight with his money and not so easily impressed, said, "Whatever you paid for that cake, it was worth it!".  This is one fantastic bakery!
author: Penny M.

description: I have to update this review...seems like they stock much less now and everything is always super fresh. And such a special place to stop by with kids for their cute displays. The knockoff hostess cupcakes are where its at. A local gem.
author: Oly O.

description: I love this place! My favorite treat is the mini dipped cupcake. It's like biting into heaven...
author: Chris H.

description:
Sooo disappointing.  Had been wanting to go into this place for a while, and with my birthday coming up I decided to try out a cupcake.  I ordered the vanilla cake with vanilla 'buttercream' frosting.  Not even close.  The cake was dense and tasteless, and the frosting was obviously made with Crisco NOT butter.  It was hard, tasteless, and left my mouth coated with Crisco.  Glad I didn't order a whole cake!

To top it off the staff was extremely rude.

Save your money and go elsewhere!
author: Sarah B.

description:
I'm not sure why it took me so long to hop on the Noe Valley Bakery train.  But now that I'm here, I'm not getting off any time soon.

I was gifted some of their red velvet cupcakes over Passover last year (yes, a totally weird time to be given a treat that is all leavened all the time, but let's be real- matzoh only gets you so far).  These cupcakes were one of the most amazing things I have ever put in my mouth!

The shop itself is totally cute.  I like that they also have mini cupcakes, because sometimes you don't want to commit.  I fully recommend the "Most-est" cupcake.  It is a fancy version of a Hostest cupcake and it is delightful.  You can also buy their cookie dough and make your own cookies!
author: Nora S.

description:
Holy crap!

I've always rolled my eyeballs over the whole cupcake craze, pooh-poohing it, but they have the most delicious cupcakes (cakes) I've ever eaten.  Someone brought a few in to the place I volunteer and after finding out where she bought them, I've since had to go pick up some cukecakes myself, for myself.

My favorite is the red velvet cupcake.  Mmmmm.
author: Animal K.

description: What can I say about Noe Valley Bakery? They have lots of delicious pastries,cakes, and cookies! The only down fall would be the employees they seem all not their. Over all this is a great bakery!
author: Duke Of Frisco X.

description: Yummy pastries, very expensive, staff can be nice or rude depending on who you get. I have also had mixed experiences with ordering special occasion cakes. They are VERY expensive and sometimes look great ... But my last $100 cake looked like it came from Safeway. Very disappointing and I will not order a special occasion cake from them again but I will happily pop in for a pastry!
author: Jen R.

description: I like the renovation. The bakery goods are delicious, some a little overpriced but that's okay- I support local bakers! I was so happy that sight glass coffee was being served but the coffee is poorly made. All of the staff is very kind and attentive but the coffee needs to taste better.
author: SF S.

description: NYB knocked it out of the park!  My longest friend got married at my house this week. I needed a cake!  He wanted Vanilla Chiffon, with a strawberry and whipped cream filling and buttercream frosting.  NVB had it and did a fabulous job.  We ordered a simple stacked cake with the most exquisite design (standard).  The grooms were thrilled as was I (guests too!).  Combined with Mitchell's ice cream it was a wedding dessert treat to die for!  ;-)  Thanks NVB!
author: Regina P.

description:
I typically don't eat bread but if I do, I head to Noe Valley Bakery.  Is it by far my favorite bakery in San Francisco!

Recommend:
Cupcakes - Most-ess and Chocolate Caramel fluer de sel
Chocolate Chip Cookies
Pumpkin Bread
Sweet Baguette

I'm sure the other baked goods are great, but I have a hard time pulling away from my favorites.  Definitely head there in the mornings to get the best items...they sell out pretty quickly.
author: Joel C.

description:
Great coffee and croissants! As for cupcakes, the Neopolitan (spell?) is my favorite! Oh....I can't believe I almost forgot....Their .Fruit Tarts rock my world. I used to have one everyday until my doctor advised me to stop since my sugar levels were rising....oops!

Great quality bakery at an equally great location....NOE VALLEY
author: L P.

description: We've gotten a couple of birthday cakes at Noe Valley Bakery and they were delicious. It gets 5 stars for quality but minus 1 for the prices.
author: Andrew H.

description:
I love their strawberry hazelnut cake.  It's pretty to look at (fresh strawberry slices) and light tasting (hazelnut sponge cake - I love sponge cake and I love hazelnuts).  I get it with whipped cream.  Mmm.  I was extremely excited to hear that they had greatly expanded their cupcake line recently (still hoping for a hazelnut cupcake).  

They have fancy grown-up cupcakes and they're cheaper than ones at cupcake shops ($2 to $2.50 each).  The cake is on the dry side  and the frosting is softer than average.

* Red velvet cupcake:  Dry cake and the frosting was way too sweet, but then I hate sweet cream cheese frosting.  
* Most-est cupcake: Their best cupcake.  The rich chocolate ganache is a sophisticated touch (and it's delicious) as is the elegant white squiggle.  This is a classy Hostess cupcake.  The chocolate cake is a bit dry but the Bavarian cream filling is delicious.  
* Lemon drop cupcake:  The handmade frosting bee with almond wings is adorable. The vanilla cake was on the bland side (and dry).  Doesn't taste like they use Madagascar Bourbon vanilla.  The lemon buttercream frosting was soft and subtle whereas the filling of lemon Bavarian was much more lemony.  

Okay, so I didn't fall in love with each cupcake but on the strength of their morning buns (melt in your mouth tender but still crispy in parts), hazelnut sponge cake and Most-est cupcakes, I am in love with Noe Valley Bakery.  I'm also more lenient/have lower cupcake expectations for bakeries vs. places that specialize in cupcakes.  For a bakery, NV does a fine job with cupcakes.  

This place has it all: sandwiches, quiche, breads, pies, tarts, scones, frozen scone and pie dough, tote bags, croissants, and the most amazing morning buns.  Everything in the case looked delicious (passed my "eye" test).  There is no seating and they accept credit cards.
author: Lolia S.

description:
4.5 stars

This place is so cute!  I'm a sucker for cuteness, so this place definitely got me with its non-pretentious and cute storefront.  But so did their efficient online cake ordering system.  As did the raspberry Bavarian cream they put in between layers of chocolate cake.  Oh, and those adorable cupcakes they make too, especially the lemon drop cupcake with bees made of frosting and almond slices.

Their cupcakes are much more affordable and much larger than fancy cupcakeries like Kara's.  However, I still give it to Kara's for a perfectly executed cupcake.  On the other hand, the cupcakes at Noe Valley Bakery have the looks, but their cake is on the dry side.  My favorite cupcake of theirs is the Zinger'd (vanilla cupcake filled with raspberry Bavarian cream, topped with raspberry buttercream and pink coconut flakes)--so girly!  I have yet to try more of their pastries, but I also love their blueberry muffins--moist with plump and juicy blueberries.

The service is top-notch too.  Everyone is so smiley here, especially in the morning.  I arrived on time one morning to pick up an order of cupcakes, but my cupcakes weren't packaged yet.  The girl kept apologizing, even though I was in no rush.  While I was waiting, I was wooed by the pastry cases, so I asked for a blueberry muffin and fruit tart to go.  And whaddya know, the girl let me have them on the house because I had to wait a whole 10 minutes.  It was quite unnecessary, but hey, I'm not gonna argue with free stuff!
author: Diane L.

description:
My mother-in-law requested we bring "some kind of artisan, sourdough type bread" to her most recent family get together. 
So, since we were going to be in this neighborhood the day before, we decided to buy a couple loaves from here. 

We purchased: whole wheat sourdough, and challah. 
Sadly, the whole wheat sourdough wasn't anything special. I actually was pretty disappointed with it. 
So why the 4 stars you might ask... 
The challah was AMAZING!!!! The best I've had in I don't know how long, and definitely the best I've had on this coast. 
It was perfection in every way:) 

We also split one chocolate cherry rugelach. While it wasn't the same as NY rugelach, it was still very tasty! 

There were numerous tempting items in the case, but I held back. 

Next time I'm"m in the neighborhood, I'll definitely be stopping here.
author: Amanda G.

description:
When I lived in my last apartment in Nob Hill, I remember once waking up and thinking, "this day calls for a danish."  Getting out of bed and Yelping, I also recall settling for a bowl of Kix after my call for danish in Nob Hill went unanswered.

Now in Noe Valley, oh man, did I ever hit the danish jackpot.  Just a few blocks from my house stands the Noe Valley Bakery where one will find not only danish (cheese, blueberry and more), but morning buns, muffins, scones, cookies, cupcakes, pies, cakes, croissants, tarts, baguettes, sliced bread, take-and-bake cookie dough and I'm sure dozens of other treats I'm missing.  After sampling a large percentage of their inventory, I can personally vouch for everything being delicious. 

My current personal favorites: almond croissant, the morning bun, and for lunches, the multi-grain sliced bread.  Wow.
author: Eric S.

description: Excellent pastry, nice people. Totally crappy for them to tack on an extra 3% to every bill for "SF city mandates". I'm a tiny bit sympathetic to restaurant owners who had to pay health insurance for waiters. Noe Valley Bakery is not a restaurant, it is a retail establishment. I know the pastries are already expensive, but if they really have to raise prices another 3% then just do that, don't tack it on at the end.
author: Nelson M.

description:
Great:
Baguettes
Cheese breadsticks
Maple scones
Always friendly
Molasses cookies

Bad:
Prices for pre-made dough. Looks great, but overpriced. 
Sells out early. Get there before noon!
author: Alex L.

description:
Their croissants are perfect - buttery, yet still light in their own right.  
And their scones are seriously grubbin - not dry like most scones tend to be.Today was a croissant kind of day, simply delish. I would like to kiss the baker's hands. :)

I hit up this lovely little Noe Valley gem when the fresh baked breakfast goodies craving kicks in.  It hits the spot like no other.  It's nice & close to work and although Arizmendi's recently opened on Valencia and I can skip there from my office, nothing beats NVB.  

Coffee is better than Martha Bros& the staff is consistently friendly.

Their logo "Born & raised in Noe Valley" I suppose can be geared toward stroller valley, but I can relate. They need those T-shirts in lady's fit, not just kids sizes so I could sport one when I'm in the mood to advertise my roots.

Do I recommend them?  Only to anyone not spazzing over their calories.  This is not a place for those dieting.
author: Athena S.

description:
Pretty good.  

Only thing keeping them from 5 stars is that they used powdered sugar.  
Who adds powdered sugar to things?
author: Mike R.

description: They are my go to bakery for round raisin challah for the holidays. But what I can't understand is their lack of comprehending good service. You order in advance and PAY, yet you must wait on line with all the other bakery patrons to pick up your order. And then when you leave (after asking if there is a separate line) you get the snarky comment on exit, "see that was quick". Not! Too bad. Will return to Wise Sons or Marla bakery for holiday challahs.
author: Ilene L.

description: Best cupcakes everrrr!!! I absolutely love them. The frosting is what makes them perfect for me. It's not super sugary like the kind you'd buy at safeway or any other store. It's creamy in a way and I'm just addicted! I also like going during holidays or events because they'll have cupcakes for those occasions. Had a cupcake with a snowman on it during the Christmas season and had another cupcake with a 49er logo during football season. All the other pastries were delicious as well and the service was great!
author: stephanie c.

description: Chocolate mousse cake and 'got milk' chocolate cake are both so good!  8" $33 and 6" $28 - was perfect for a friend's baby shower and son's birthday.  It's our 'go to' for cakes now!
author: Jane Y.

description:
All organic. No artificial crap. I have no plans to give up my favorite whole wheat pita bread from Trader Joe's, but if I ever change my mind, Noe Valley Bakery's rather delicious whole wheat bread might be the replacement.

See you soon for cookies.
author: Jason B.

description:
I want to like this place, but when it comes down to it, I have to admit that the cupcakes are dry, and I've tried several. I could get better quality cake at a cheap, local Chinese bakery.

JONASAPPROVED!
author: Jonas T.

description:
I LOVE NVB CAKE! 

Yep, I'm designating a nickname for you NVB, because I forsee you becoming a part of my regular vocabulary. Delicate chocolate chiffon cake filled with a layer of airy whipped cream and strawberry bavarian cream, chock full of fresh chopped strawberries. Only $36 for a 6'' cake with extra strawberries and chocolate ganache. What a steal, I should've gotten two...  (see their website for super easy-to-customize, delicious cakes).

What takes it down to 4 stars are the cupcakes (sorry Bonnie!). The Most-ess and Red Velvet were pretty good (Teacake Bake Shop has the best Red Velvet!), but the others, not so much. I think the Zinger (raspberry filled, coconut topped) and Fleur de Syl (caramel topped, chocolate ganache topped) are popular because the filling cuts the dryness, but personally I didn't like the filling and thought the cake was still dry. Sorry, cupcake snob here.

But I've gotta cut em some slack, because their specialty isn't cupcakes... For extremely friendly service and outstanding cake - an overall 4.5 stars - I'll be back for more cake and pastries soon, NVB!

Note: NVB sell pastries at the Saturday Ferry Building Farmers Market
author: Jess C.

description:
Pros: Decent baked goods, cute cupcakes, killer custom birthday cake designs for kids and grown-ups, and a nice neighborhood feel.  Terrible service, though - today (just as an example) I waited with five others in line while a staffer behind the counter ignored us to take a phone call and the busy bakers in the back pretended not to see us. Honestly, would it kill you to say "someone will be right with you?"  Finally after about ten minutes of being ignored, someone asked if anyone was working the counter - at which point a young man popped out from behind a wall and said "yes!" and then promptly went back to whatever he was doing.

I like to support the local businesses but if I want to be ignored by a hipster with attitude, I can just head over to Tartine, where at least they serve world-class baked goods alongside the diffident shrug.
author: Katy M.

description:
After months of avoiding this bakery due to a handful of unfortunate incidents involving cupcakes and an assortment of cookies (see previous review), some guests brought me a loaf of challah from Noe Valley Bakery.  Heaven - perfectly dense, barely sweet.

So when I went in on my own to get another loaf, I was introduced to the amazing, gooey, goodness that is NVB's sticky bun.  I'm hooked.  I can easily say this sticky bun is one of the best I've ever had - and I've shared it with anyone who crosses my path on a Saturday or Sunday morning.

I was also pleased to discover that NVB makes a mean hot chocolate.

Much to my "I walk past here every day" dismay, I now join the ranks of Noe Valley residents who adore this local bakery.
author: Kristin M.

description:
I chose this place based on the simple math that no less than 13 of my Yelp friends have favorably reviewed NVBBC.

Having somewhat volunteered to the happy task of bringing cupcakes to a small going away party at work, I brought 24 minis (mint, nutty, most-est, & strawberry).  Total was $47 (I thought kinda pricey for minis, but I admit to not being exactly well-versed in this crazy cupcake fad that has everyone's teeth tingling and Yelp fingers itching.)  Latte in the morning was mediocre, not quite the strength in espresso taste I prefer, but did the job of making up for me having to get up a whole 15 minutes earlier than normal for the cupcake run.

Consensus on the cupcakes?  This place made Tom R. the Mac Daddy of cupcakes, and let's just say that now I am the Mac Mommy.  (No relation, just a coincidence of pimp names.  It happens in the streets kids.  Yeah, that's right, the Noe Valley, baby stroller strewn, blond bobbed, pink finger-nailed, clickety-clackin' streets.)  

In short, the people were pleased.  Bangin' job, if you've got the cash.
author: Ravena F.

description: Michael did an awesome job on my son's lego cake for his 5th birthday party. It was easy to communicate with him via email and phone. He was able to create a custom cake with 3 days notice. Check out the photo!
author: Marley Q.

description:
The ultimate best bakery to get your red velvet cupcake fix!  They're soft, moist, great flavor, and the cream cheese icing is a perfect sweetness.  You get a good size cupcake for the price too.  This bakery is on my top list of places to go to satisfy my sweet tooth.  I have yet to try the hostess-looking cupcake.  

If I lived or worked near this bakery, I would gain an extra two inches of muffin top!
author: Mary Ann M.

description:
I was introduced to the Love Bun a few months back and now I'm in this joint every other day. Or I find myself fiending for these things every other day. 

Working close by makes for a dangerous situation. I force myself to walk on the other side of the street and submit myself to that crazy conservative guy's window rants just to stay away from this place.

Co-workers constantly bring in pies, cakes, and tarts and I can never resist, hence the bigger waistline since working in this hood.

One of the best bakeries in the city. Minus one star for the inconsistent service though.
author: Art O.

description: I love just about everything about this place but ESPECIALLY their walnut whole wheat loaf! Just delicious and nutritious! This is a great local and independent bakery without the "hipster" pretentiousness of some other bakeries. Good baking and friendly staff.
author: Chris W.

description: They are great. Wonderful pastries and breads. If you are a senior; on Tuesdays you get a 20% discount!! The store is not good for your waistline tho. Every time I want to serve dessert, I know where to get something delicious !
author: Kerrie S.

description: Cupcakes are dry and cold and the frosting was dense and left a bad mouth feel.
author: Amin S.

description:
Yup NVB is great. Making edible jewel's. The breads....love the olive, the cherry. (have not seen it for a while) ok actually all of the breads are great..   The fruit tarts make me.....welll....u know..... (ooooop's, ok I admit to picking up a tart).
