ALL is good. (actually great), they are true bakers (not candle stick makers), and with the great and wonderful staff ..... this is a joint with class. (oooops didn't mean to sound classist )

Not a big fan of cupcakes ( ? cake in a cup?), but they are a staple @ NVB. 

Try it, you will like it.......
author: Matsuo U.

description:
more like 2.5

we bought a red velvet cake from here and it was a total fail.

the cake was inconsistent; dry in places and soaking in frosting in others. the upside, the frosting was good. it tasted *gasp* stale to others at the party. i had to discard what was left of the cake, which was more than half.

as i write this i do remember asking if they could make a custom red velvet cake to order. the staff (all three of them) said they would be unable to since the cakes would already be pre-made. i'm curious as to how long ago the cakes were pre- made.

the red velvet cupcakes didn't taste as moist either. 

on the upside, the customer service is still great.
author: Lola L.

description:
Full Disclosure: I AM A CUPCAKE SNOB!!!

I travel a lot and take the opportunity to sample cupcakes when I can. New York, Boston, Chicago, LA, San Diego etc... for me there are a couple of major hits:

- moist cake: tasteful but not dry.
- filling: not minimal but substantial to balance the frosting butyet complimentary to the overall theme of the cupcake (ie Boston Creme)
- solid topping: smooth yet not overwhelming  

This place makes it for me. Beats the downtown, Marina, SOMA and Mission sites. 

Honestly, I am very pleased and will visit this place often!!!
author: C K.

description:
I love this place because you can place your orders for cupcakes for late afternoon pick up so they wont run out of the flavors I like (sea salt caramel, Boston cream and lemon drop cupcakes)

I love their cupcakes over all other cupcake joints because they are bigger sized cupcakes and more reasonably priced (~$3.00) for a cupcake. Its not too hyped up yet and the flavors are nice and rich. Id come here to satisfy my sweet tooth esp with their "Moist-ess" (hostess like) cupcakes.
author: Vicky L.

description:
Cupcakes: Carrot and Most-ess (like the hostess packaged cupcakes w/ the cream filling). Both were inhaled immediately. 

They don't get cute and venture into crazy flavor combos like maple bacon pancakes or PBnJ. This place knows what they're good at: classic cupcakes. NVBBC may very well be the best cupcake bakery in SF. It's def one of the best cupcake places I've tried so far.
author: Maria A.

description: Nothing but 5 stars for Noe Bakery - they created a beautiful custom birthday cake for my daughter's third birthday.  It tasted as good as it looked:)
author: Heather S.

description: I've been here so many times over the past 10 years I feel kind of bad I haven't given the Noe Valley Bakery a review until now.  I come for the coffee, the blueberry scones, and the chocolate chip pecan cookies.  This bakery is a real gem on 24th Street, I am always happy they are here.
author: Oliver B.

description:
OK - don't know what got into that I gave them 5 stars. They are great and everything, but definitely not 5 starts. I can't think of a single thing that is amazing, but I can of many that are good.

So 4 starts sounds much more like it.

Don't run over there, come in if you are passing in the neighborhood, and just feel like something sweet.
author: Too M.

description: Cherry chocolate rugulach was awesome. Also he Milky Way bomb and it was delicious! Love stumbling across this place.
author: Su C.

description:
Noe Valley Bakery is definitely one of my favorite bakeries in San Francisco. It's a pretty short drive from my apartment complex to this place and I have never been disappointed. My favorite treats at this bakery our their red velvet cupcakes, Boston cream pie cupcakes, and the fruit tarts. Noe Valley Bakery never fails to satisfy my sweet tooth.
I also love their seasonal holiday treats they make me happy just to look at.
author: Nava N.

description:
WOW!! Is what you will say when you bite into anything you get here. Everything the bread,cookies,cake is out of this world good. There bread is the best. I will not have a dinner party without surving there bread. 
AWESOME! Place to go.
author: Lawrence G.

description:
Five-star for a simple reason:  NO ONE makes rugelach like these people. No one.

The window displays are cool, the people are polite and nice, the take-away make-at-home dough (for scones) is very good.

But the rugelach?   I'd take a job in the kitchen, just to learn how to make them like that.
author: Jeff B.

description: Perfect morning cup of coffee! I like to pair it with a raspberry croissant, it's like a grown up jelly filled donut, yummmmmmmm!!!
author: Lissette V.

description: Their Coffee is great, Their pastries, well, give me another year so I can try them all, but so far all I have eaten in the Bakery was So Delicious !!! I definitely recommend, and the Staff there is always smiling, and welcoming you , and it is nice to see happy people in the food industry.....Chocolate Eclair and Vanilla Latte is my number one choice !!
author: Wilson D.

description: I've been coming to this place for years because I lived in the neighborhood for a while and make trips to that neighborhood every week now that I have moved. I certainly do not think this is a destination bakery by any means but they had some items that I really liked such as their version of the Oreo, called the Noe-O, their cheese croissant and the cherry chocolate bread. However they have either stopped making these items or are only making them on weekends, which is sad because these are really their best items. Their croissants are not very flaky or buttery the way I like them. Their cupcakes are not the best but they are pretty good. The only good thing left are the  cute smiley cookies with yummy icing. But sadly this is not a place I will go out of my way to visit any longer.
author: melanie k.

description:
I came into this bakery with a guarded heart as I am forbidden to eat chocolate for the next few weeks and for me, any bakery visit is incomplete without leaving with some chocolate-goody in hand. On the bright side, I am now free to explore all the baked goods that I was once so closed off to in the past! 

The fruit tart caught my eye so I got a mini-one. Getting a regular sized one is just dumb because it totally limits you from sampling more pastries. It was fantastic. A little tart packed with berries! So good. Beware of the falling blueberry though. 

Then got the morning bun because it looked a lot less heavy and just more gentle than the typical morning buns I see. (La Farine and Starbucks I'm looking at you) Really, morning buns are amazing. It's like the beautiful lovechild of a croissant and a cinnamon bun. Speaking of love, they also have love buns which sound like morning buns with cream in them. They're a little uglier though so I refrained. Anyway NVB's morning bun is arguably the best I've ever had.  

We also got a hot cross bun because we'd never tried it before. It was my favorite thing even though I hate raisins. The nuts and raisins bring contrasting textures to the hot cross bun eating process. Whether or not this is pleasing is questionable.

Wish I tried their cupcakes! Next time. 

Oh and they only serve sandwiches on the weekdays.
author: Lydia W.

description:
This is an amazingly good bakery. Their stuffed cupcakes (Chocolate Fleur d' Sel and Mostest) are the best I've ever had. The Rugeluch (Jewish Cookies) are the best you can buy. Their pies have the most tender and flakey crusts. They have a Snickers Bomb that is out of this world. Their cakes are beautiful and delicious.

I don't understand why the line doesn't stretch out the door like it does at Tartine (which is a "rougher" more sugery-crass bakery with surly staff), but I'm happy that the knowledgeable staff is fast and friendly here, and I can get in and out in less than 10 minutes.
author: Richard L M.

description: I love this place so much that I don't even know where to start on a review. All you really need to know is that everything is awesome: cookies, cakes, bread, cupcakes, etc. The only quibble I've ever had with them was when they screwed up my birthday cupcake order by giving my box of cupcakes to someone else, then telling me they didn't have enough cupcakes to fill my order. It was highly annoying, and if this were any other business I probably would have drilled them on here and stopped going there. However, I can't stay mad at a place that produces this much tastiness.
author: Pat M.

description:
Working across the street from here is dangerous,
wonderful bread, wonderful cupcakes, wonderful life.

Thank you noe valley bakery!
author: Bea R.

description:
I concur with many of the yelpers on here about Noe Valley Bakery.

I ordered a couple of their cupcakes, specifically their chocolate cupcake (I think it had caramel as well) I can't remember the name specifically because I was so focused on eating it. I also had their Red Velvet (which is staring at me right now saying "eat me!") and lastly their pecan sticky bun which was sugary!

Anyways, nice little bakery in the heart of Noe
author: Eric A.

description:
Such a cute bakery!  I always love their window displays!

We stopped in there today to get some desserts after lunch.  we settled on the Red Velvet Cupcake, Salted Chocolate & Caramel Cupcake and the Milky Way Chocolate Mound of Mousse and Awesomeness.

The desserts were so good!  The frosting on the cupcakes were a little thick for me, but the actual cakes and mousse were so yummy!  They also sell their own sauces and ice cream, which is a nice touch.

I have tried their breakfast scones before and really liked the savory choices.  A great place to stop into on your way to work - the staff is very friendly, as well.
author: Carmel U.

description:
I LOVE THEIR PECAN PIE!!!  
   So I was told I had to try Noe Valley's pecan pie as my friend and I are always on the lookout for the best pecan pie.  Perfect crust, AMAZING filling, and fresh.  There was a huge line when we arrived and I always take that as a good sign.  The gentleman that helped us, (I think his name was Ted?) had a great personality and really knew his product.  He made a few other recommendations while we were there and I ended up walking out with more than I thought I would.  And the pretty young red-headed girl who rang us up was very sweet.  Great food, great people, and good location.  
Recommend:
Pecan Pie (special order)
Asiago bread 
Fruit tart
and premade cookie dough.
author: Matthew G.

description:
This place is dangerous!! Their Asiago loaf is soooooo good that I ate almost the ENTIRE thing in one afternoon. 

Didn't try the cookies or cupcakes, though they looked good.
author: Kim C.

description: WHOOPIE!! I got to try my first WHOOPIE!! Pie here and I did not say WHOOPIE!! It was just ok. I liked the texture to the chocolate cakie brownie tasting outside and the cream tasted very buttery. My 1st pie was all stuck to the parchment paper and I couldn't eat it. I asked for another one and the 2nd one I was able to slowly peel off the parchment paper, they need to fix that problem.
author: Karen T.

description: LOVE their flourless chocolate cake and the MILKY WAY BOMBE.. that ish is the BOMB! sooo good =)
author: A L.

description:
I'd recommend their butter croissant, sweet baguette and challah.
And their delicious crusted white bread.
author: Prague G.

description:
It was always hard for me to stay on the 48 bus and pass this place by. The lemon cupcakes were to die for (and I probably would have died had I continued to eat them on a regular basis). Their rosemary bread with the sea salt on top is one of the top breads I've ever eaten. The staff was always friendly even when I had to pay quickly and run out to catch the bus! 

Don't miss this little jewel!
author: Briza Y.

description: Cupcakes are a good size and very yummy.
author: Alison F.

description:
This place is fantastic. Why is it when I'm not supposed to eat gluten I find all these fantastic bakeries? Why?

Their apricot bread is sublime - more apricots than bread. The chocolate cherry bread is wonderful also.

My wife loves their rugalach.

Never had anything I didn't like from them - my only complaint is that they stopped distributing in the East Bay - but it makes me find them at the Farmer's Market - they are worth the trek.
author: Marco M.

description:
Seriously good cakes. I had the strawberry hazelnut cake for my birthday and it was simply great. The perfect blend of flavors and just the right amount of sweetness that allows an adult to finish an entire piece.

I gave a slice of my birthday cake to a waitress at Bliss and she said it was the best cake she'd had in her life. I'm hard-pressed to disagree with her.
author: Aaron V.

description:
The morning buns and pecan rolls are all I need for a perfect Sunday.

I always walk out buying twice what I expected to.  And I have never once regretted it.

Noe Valley Bakery should be designated a Noe Valley landmark.  God bless those bakers.
author: evan m.

description:
I picked up a few cupcakes and a red velvet cake for my husbands birthday... and both were very reasonably priced! My son and guests enjoyed the "Most-est Cupcake" It wasn't overly sweet, and real moist. 

Parking wasn't so bad because there is a parking lot a few doors down. It is definitely a great place to stroll with a cupcake and perhaps latte in hand.
author: Jenn V.

description:
Savory Cheese Croissant. That's really all I need. A thick slice of emmentaler in a buttery flaky croissant is the only thing that will carry me through several hours of morning meetings some days.

I've had a little bit of everything else they offer and always with favorable results, but it's really the cheese croissant that keeps me coming back.
author: Ennis O.

description:
Likes: Boston Creme Cupcake and chocolate Caramel Fleur de Sel Cupcake.  Size of cupcakes. Very moist cupcakes.  Perfect frosting. Pimp parking I got that day.  Quick service.

Dislikes: Red Velvet Cupcake and Carrot Cake Cupcake (they were good, just had better). The fact that I only have one stomach and could not fit anymore sweets or other baked goods in my belly.  Size of bday cake for my co-worker.  I wanted more. 

Noe Valley Bakery, you are a danger to my health.  I will probably need to rethink my diet plan after learning about you, but I plan on making a return.
author: Maybelline C.

description: Had the cranberry coconut scone that everyone seems to be talking about and it was dry! The scone didn't even smell yummy. Disclaimer is that I bought the last cherry coconut scone and the bakery was closing in 30 mins so I might come back and try their cupcakes earlier in the day when they're fresh.
author: Audrey T.

description:
Excellent loaves of bread that they will slice for you...thick or thin.

Yummy breakfast pastries.  Cool staff.  

Loaves of bread have a great price, everything else seemed expensive.
author: Cynthia B.

description:
Mmfrmrrmmphrffff oooooohhhhh mmmmmmm (the sound of me happily eating a NVB cupcake)

I think I must have died and gone to cupcake heaven. I have to admit I was quite skeptical. I have eaten some great cupcakes in my time so when my cousin brought over these cupcakes: 

Red Velvet 
Lemon Cream
Carrot Cake
Chocolate Caramel Sea Salt
Most-est cupcakes

I got excited about our cupcake tasting session. So my mom, aunt, cousin and I cut up the cupcakes into eights and began to sample and talk about the cupcakes. My mom really enjoyed the Lemon Cream whereas my aunt really liked the Red Velvet. My cousin loved the Caramel Sea Salt but my favorite was the Carrot Cake. I was totally surprised with this result because the Carrot Cake was moist and the cream cheese topping wasn't too sweet. The Lemon was tart and the cream topping was a little too sweet for me but overall very good. The Red Velvet was smooth and moist, coming in a close second. The Caramel Sea Salt was crazy and a total indulgence. It's a rich meal in itself! All the cupcakes were terrificly moist and delicious. We were happy campers after our sampling session. 

$2.50-$2.75 per cupcake is absolutely reasonable for the medium-size cupcakes. Better than places that charge a ridiculous $3 for the regular smaller sized ones! The larger size also makes it easy to have fun sharing. So far we've sampled two other places but this is our fave. I'll tell you about the rest of the menu someday but in the meantime, I'll have some more NVB cupcake please!
author: Dawn L.

description: Wow!  Was I a lucky birthday girl!  My daughters surprised me with a cake from Noe Valley Bakery and it was really one of the most amazing cakes I've ever tasted!  So very rich and chocolatey.  The frosting was pure fudge -- it was so delicious I felt it could have been served separately, as the candy course!  The cake was moist, tender, each bite a delight.  I felt a tear trickle down my cheek when the last slice was gone... but wait!  My next birthday is right around the corner... maybe a few carefully placed hints will pan out...
author: Bevy M.

description: Wow! What a hidden treasure outside the usual Kara-esque & cart cupcakes. Noe Valley Bakery has great cupcakes and great pastries to boot. Loved the Boston Cream Pie cupcake and the Carrot Cake...pure heaven!
author: Glenn M.

description:
Fantastic cupcakes from this Noe Valley neighborhood bakery where you want to eat everything you see - from the yummy cupcakes displayed in the window and in the case, to the pies, cakes, pastries, breads... everything!

Tried the 1) red velvet cupcake, 2) vanilla w/white frosting cupcake, and 3) the one with pink coconut slivers on top of a vanilla cupcake filled with raspberry frosting (forgot the name) - see picture. The cake in the cupcakes were so moist and light and the cream on top was so deliciously smooth but not too sweet. The pink coconut cupcake was THE BEST - it had this awesome raspberry cream that made me savor ever bite and made me sad when it was all gone. And the fresh coconut slivers at the top complemented the rest of the cupcake perfectly.

Pretty busy place on a Friday afternoon but service was efficient. Downside is that there's only metered street parking so good luck!

Bottom line: Probably best cupcakes I've had in SF area, even better than some of these other fancy cupcake-only places. Can't wait to go back and try the other 5+ kinds of cupcakes and all their other stuff!
author: Jim C.

description:
I'm torn, like a still-warm crusty loaf of happiness.
Still getting over Noe sticker shock perhaps. I just can't get over charging nearly five bucks for a loaf of bread. Am I totally behind the times?

Granted, this is no Wonder Bread, just Wonderful! The rosemary dinner rolls topped with a touch of grey sea salt could put a smile on my face every day and the crunchy, cheesy asiago breadsticks are the perfect savory snack - though I usually get them to entertain myself as I walk home with whatever other yeasted-wheaty goods I've picked up. The seeded caramelized onion baguette is nom-a-licous - definitely could work for dessert with a mild soft cheese or fruit spread.

It's likely I just need to shell out more and then maybe I'll be addicted. At that price point, I'm not sure I want to be though. Regardless, I'll be back.

***
Update. So a good hunka hunka yeast goes for five bucks. Forgive me for thinking it was a tad much for just the right crunch and chew with my flour and water.
Sugar craving: the Lady Kisses looked like macaroons (of the French, not coconut variety) so I asked what they were. They guy hesitated and then told me almond. Amazing. I want. Perfect. Out the door I go, first nibble... "this is not almond... *frown*..." It was hazelnut and while if I was craving the signature Ferrero-Rocher confection, this would have been perfect. But I expected, and only purchased it because it was almond. Note to staff: if you're not sure, ask someone else. Please.
author: Alissa A.

description:
BEST RED VELVET EVER! Granted, i haven't tried all the red velvet cupcakes in the city, but i love the fact that they use natural good quality ingredients and the red velvet is not overly colored with food coloring. All the cupcakes i've tried are incredibly moist and have real depth of flavor. I also love their apricot and ginger bread. 

I live pretty much on the opposite side of town, so i don't make it here very often. However, when i have made the special trip here and waited in line, it's been worth it. I admit, i much prefer a cake especially since cupcakes can be pricey, but you just can't help but want a cupcake after seeing them lined up so beautifully in the case. 

Definitely worth a visit if you're in the area.
author: Iknowasianfood C.

description: Don't get the Boston Creme Cupcake.  It's dry and does taste like a Boston Creme Pie at all.  I didn't even eat it all and that says a lot.  Other stuff looked and smelled great.
author: Kevin M.

description:
Awesome birthday cake experience! 

They have a great online reference on how to make your ultimate cake. I ordered a half-sheet hazelnut sponge cake, with mocha whipped cream filling and a chocolate ganache frosting. 

Let's face it, I'm a jaded Native Bay Area foodie who has "been around the dessert block" a few times. Consider this a good source. I live in Noe Valley and I chose this bakery because I'm committed to local vendors. This experience was so good, I'd travel across town if I had to do it again.   ;-)

This cake was delicious, yummy perfect. I highly recommend, for an upscale, gorgeous, incredibly good frosting, go with the chocolate ganache, it costs a few dollars more ... but WAY WAY worth it.

On time. Friendly service. Pray to the parking gods, although there is a tiny parking lot.
author: Scott S.

description:
We decided on a sheet cake from Noe Valley bakery for our wedding cake after having a delicious piece of their cake at a friend's wedding. It was more important to us to have something that tasted good than to have a multi-tiered fondant-covered affair that was made more for looks than eating. Not to mention that a sheet cake was about 80% cheaper per slice than a traditional wedding cake.

We went with a lemon chiffon cake with white butter-cream. I can't speak to the other flavors - but this one is great! We ordered a full sheet cake, which is HUGE. We actually probably had twice as much as we needed - but with it being so affordable we thought it was better to have too much than not enough. We had a complex design that required the bakery to print multiple scanned images on rice paper - and then cut them into separate images and place them onto the cake in a final design we had provided them with. The reason we did this is there was a charge for each 8 1/2 X 11 scanned image - and at that maximum size we had to make our design into several large images so that it would look right on such a large cake.

We were a little concerned because they said they had never done a job quite like this before. However, their staff was fantastic - happy to work with us - and very professional. We confirmed with them a couple of times and they were super helpful and patient. When the big day arrived, the cake looked fantastic! They packed it in a big box with a stiff board on the bottom. It to our venue in the trunk of our friends' car flawlessly. And it tasted as great as we had hoped it would.

Noe Valley did a great job and I don't have any real complaints. The only minor inconvenience is they have many people working there and some are a bit more knowledgeable than others about the custom cakes. So we didn't have a specific "point person" to deal with an answer questions. However - they really did a great job and we were very happy.
author: David C.

description:
This bakery, by far, is the best I have ever been to.  Yes, 5 stars....this is definitely as good as it gets!  I have been on a cupcake crawl for some months now and this time, the cupcake came through me through my loving boyfriend on our 9th year anniversary who knows how I love cupcakes!  Honestly, I think the only reason why he popped into this bakery was because it was the closest to his work (haha).  Whether that is the reason or not, I am glad he did.

I've had almost all the cupcake flavors here that I can't even keep up with it.  I am in love with the lemon, the most-est and most especially, the red velvet! ughhhhhhhhh.......i'm craving one right now as I write this review.  I loved the red velvet sooo much that I bought a cake for my boyfriends birthday.  I must say that the cake does not compare to the cupcakes in terms of moistness. 

I haven't tried the bread yet but I will soon. What can I say? I loe oooooove looooooove carbs and places like this make me love it a million times more!  Thank you Noe Valley Bakery & Bread company for being in existence =)
author: Mary-Anne C.

description:
I really like the chocolate cherry rugelach. Lots of chocolate and cherries piled in the pastry, and for a decent price too!

I tried their fig bread - really good. Tried their chocolate cherry bread too - even better, if you have a sweet tooth. I think I've tried a cupcake here before, and that was pretty decadent. Overall, cute, dependable, high quality neighborhood bakery!
author: Carol L.

description:
I had my wedding cake from Noe Valley Bakery 10 years ago, and have been a regular customer. I thought it would be appropriate to get my baby shower cake there as well.
I left very specific instructions about the cake decorations, since I wanted (and paid for) both  frosting decorations on the sides and a photo in the center of the cake. I made a sketch for them and they took a scan of the photo. The total cost was over $100. Come to pick up the cake the morning of the party, and there is a big blank expanse of cake with no picture. It looked so odd, I was surprised no-one double checked the order. 
They couldn't do anything on that day as the bakers were not in, so I took the cake and we made do. I was not happy, but it was my subsequent interaction that lead to this review. 
I went back to request a refund of what I paid for the picture and an additional amount for the embarrassment and inconvenience of their improper work. I didn't ask for a specific amount, but asked the manager what he would think was fair. He was very defensive, and said, well I'm sure everyone ate the cake anyway. 
The odd thing was, the manager didn't care when I said how disappointed I was,and that I was a customer for 10 years. But he did care when I mentioned in parting that the only recourse left to me was a negative yelp review. I got a partial refund, but I am so disappointed that what matters is their online reputation and not the satisfaction of their customers.
It seems that in the past, the owners/bakers were running the business, but now there is a manager who is primarily responsible.
author: Ana M.

description: Cute little bake shop with some of the best red velvet cake I've ever had! Always a highlight of my trips to Noe Valley.
author: Johnny W.

description:
This best apple turnover I've ever had in my short pathetic life! 

There's a perk in my step and the clouds parted. It's flaky, buttery, and sweet and every apple turnover that came before that one, didn't mean shit! 

This place has also seduced me with their chocolate covered Noe O's and their savory croissants. 

This bakery is cute. Nauseating cute. I want to hug the Asian girl that works here. Can I get some cute Asian with my turnover? She's cute. Too cute. Everything about this bakery is cute. 

If  you hate this place. You must not like joy. You are a joyist.
author: Christina Y.

description: I like this place. The staff are always friendly and the bakery has good morning buns. I have to agree with most that the prices are a bit much, but hey it's Noe Valley.
author: Danielle G.

description: This review is only for the cake since a friend got it for me for my bday. The red velvet cake was so rich and delicious!! It wasn't overly sweet :) Must check this place out in person one day.
author: Allyson L.

description: I was just so let down by this place!  I've got every family birthday cake/cupcake here for the past few years but apparently I wasn't hitting the "mean stoner" shift that I seemed to encounter when I went in today.  I was getting 4 cupcakes for us to celebrate my daughter's birthday.  After telling him which 4 we wanted, he asked me 2 more times before putting them in a box, then an additional time when he was ringing me up.  Then, when I asked for a bag, since I had a baby in my arms, they told me that the 10 cent bag wouldn't be enough, I needed the 28 cent bag.  FOR 4 CUPCAKES?!  Does the 10 cent bag just hold 1 cupcake?  Does the bag need healthcare?  I'm so confused!  I tried to make a joke about babysitting while I ran the cupcakes to my car and the employees gave me the worst stink eye ever.  When the cupcakes average $4 a piece, it seemed a little ridiculous to not even be able to joke about it.  The cupcakes and cakes are good, but there are plenty of other places in SF with delicious baked goods as well.  They can keep their cupcakes, their 28 cent bags and their bad attitudes.
author: Colette G.

description: Their goods are splendid.  They do have beautiful, delicious, and imaginative cakes!  I do agree, the cup cakes are the best ever!  But should be eaten over something so as not to allow the crumbs to be lost in follicles.  I think Martha Stewart & Miss Manners would agree, but that's a presumption, as I have not consulted with them.  But, they even have Hot Cross Buns & other such seasonal items, that are becoming increasingly difficult to find, even in a culturally diverse environment.  They are a bus trip for me, but one that is well worth the effort.
author: Thomas O.

description:
This rating is only for the rugelach.  I prefer a ratio of  70%pastry to 30 % filling.  It's the opposite here.  The filling fell out with each bite before I could get it into my mouth.  The pastry was doughy instead of flaky. 

I'll update this review after I've tried other stuff.  Their other items do look good.  Just wanted share my opinion with others who their rugelachs like I do.
author: Debbie T.

description: This place is absolutely amazing in every aspect of the word. The customer service, the quality of the pastries+cake+everything else, and the ambiance is unlike any other bakery in San Francisco. I just placed an order for my sisters birthday cake and Terry was SUPER helpful and nice! it's people like him that business owners should entrust their business with. Keep rockin' on Noe Valley Bakery & Bread Company!!
author: Nancy L.

description:
You know from other reviewers that their baked goods are great.  I've read that their challah is too but I haven't been able to bring it home.  Why?  Noe Valley Bakery, here's a tip: Jews eat challah with brisket, pastrami etc.  So no dairy in the challah please.  There is no such thing as challah with butter, it is called brioche.  

Now, please pass the cupcakes.
author: Rebecca L.

description: The doorstep offers an inviting look inside.  The assorted danish and cupcakes were all too alluring, cupcakes almost the size of your palm for under three dollars.  Trying to avoid sweet gluttony we opted for one red velvet cupcake.  Would I agree with the name, best ever red velvet cupcake ? Fantastic yes, best ever, nyet.  A little more cake per bite than cream cheese frosting.  Walking down the street with red velvet smiles, priceless.  A bakery with few warm beverage options, no seating available but freshly baked smells are free.
author: Jacob J.

description: The nicest guy ever waited on us. Great hanging out in the back patio on a warm day.  Relax.  Be satisfied.  Try it.
author: Anonymous T.

description: WOW! Honestly, I would call myself a cupcake fanatic and Noe Valley Bakery offers one of the best cupcakes I have ever had, the Nutty Buddy! I got the mini which consists of vanilla cake topped w chocolate frosting dipped in a chocolate shell an dipped in peanuts. DELICIOUS! it was so fluffy and light! I didnt feel obese or with sugar overload after eating this! I cant wait to go back
author: Susana M.

description:
For the last couple of days, I've been researching for the perfect cupcake, although I used Yelp primarily to find it. I had spoken to several people and went from bakery to bakery about cupcakes and what they think is the best in the city. I call it the quest for the perfect cupcake. Now, I know everyone has different taste and flavors they like and its really hard to judge these things. 

I remember two years ago, us "yelpers" had our very own UYE Cupcake Bake Off. It was one of the best event I attended b/c cupcakes are awesome yo. It turns out someone I know quit their job and decide to open her own cupcake business. Cupcakes has been a fav of mine since I was little. I wish I could bake and everyone says it's easy, but not all cupcakes are good. I made an "attempt" a few weeks ago, I know it was decent. Nothing fantastic. I am grateful for the thank you's thou. 

So, on my quest for the perfect cupcake, I went to several places around my neighborhood, did a little search and came here. Came in just looking, * had a huge smiley grin on my face and thinking to myself, WTH should I order and what does ( a person in mind ) would like? I ordered the ( cupcake ) and thought this is really good, it might live up to the 4 star review. I can't give it 5 until I tried every place in the city. And please don't suggest me Kara's. 

* Counter service was very helpful in explaining every questions I had - kudos for that.

* Another point to be made, " Why do people take pictures of cupcakes and not order them?" -yes, I'm taking to the girl who cuts me off to snap away. WOW, get the F out!

That's all for today, I know 499. What will my 500th review be?
author: Stanley K.

description:
If I could give more than 5 stars, I would. 

Most favorite:  Hazelnut Sponge Cake with Strawberry Bavarian filling. It's super moist. The filling isn't too sweet, and each bite always has a nice chunk of strawberry in it. 

The top of the top: they made my daughter's bday cake this year (3-layer chocolate w/ strawberry bavarian filling). The owner worked with me on getting the right "elephant" so my little munchkin would just love it.  Guests thought the cake wasn't real because it was so perfect. And once they tasted it,  all they could talk about was how good it was.  I also ordered red velvet cupcakes - and they were incredible.
author: Mari F.

description: We loved the cakes that we got for my husband's 60th B-Day party.  One was carrot and the other red velvet.  Both were delicious and beautiful -- just what we wanted.  I wouldn't hesitate to order from Noe Valley again.
author: laurel t.

description: I thought I had tasted plenty of scones in my lifetime.  When I had a scone here I realized that I had never tasted a real scone before.  Divine!  Pure and simple.  Amazingly fresh.  What else can I say?
author: Alejandro A.

description:
devoured three whole cupcakes yesterday evening, with no regrets whatsoever. wanted the cupcake-eating experience to last for a wee bit longer, but once i started munching, there was no way to pace myself. one bite and i got transported to my fat kid happy place.

all the cupcakes i had were not at all dry, nor were they unpleasantly sticky-moist. in short, beautiful.

chocolate caramel fleur de sel: the icing of chocolate ganache was just the right degree of stickiness and richness. the sprinkling of salt on top - yeeeeee! no trace of caramel in the ganache though, which was a bummer for all of a half-second. the chocolate cake was chocolatey without being overwhelming, terrific texture. it's filled with what's supposed to be caramel bavarian cream, but again, no trace of caramel flavor here. the cream filling was wonderfully light, flavorsome, and refreshing with bites of cake and ganache. no disappointment if i just took out the word 'caramel' from the cupcake name.

carrot cupcake: oh my. the carrot cake was of perfect density and moistness, amazing flavor in every bite. beautiful to look at too, as the cake had a generous amount of grated carrot, bits of walnut for great texture, and whatever else is supposed to be in a terrific carrot cake. the cream cheese icing? good universal energy almighty. just gotta keep on eating.

red velvet cupcake: the chocolatey earthiness of the red velvet cake was divine. i can't remember the last time i had such a full-bodied-tasting red velvet cake before. the flavor and texture was on point, and i felt like i was inhaling the earthy taste in my nose with every mouthful that i chew. and the cream cheese icing? GOOD UNIVERSAL ENERGY ALMIGHTY. gorgeous.

crave crave crave crave crave crave crave crave
author: Eliza D.

description:
Becoming slightly more favorable to Noe Valley Bakery... I tried the love bun today (thanks Panthea) and the Blueberry Pecan Scone (thanks Liz) - both were delicious!

But they're still no La Boulange (Union street). Sadly. I miss all my pals and friendly barristas over there - it was totally my neighborhood coffee shop & bakery, where they knew me, had fantastic coffee, amazing croissants, good ham & cheese croissants, chocolate fondants, salads, everything... tear :(
author: Sally M.

description:
I just bought a rye bread here today but the girl with the really short hair seemed like she was having a horrible day or something. She seemed really unenthused that I was supporting a local business and I was being soooo nice to her!!
She didn't even know what vegan was.
You work in San Francisco, and not only that but you work at a bakery in San Francisco, and you want to tell me that you don't know what a vegan is?!!

My bread tastes pretty good, but I've had better.

I think I want to get around to eating that cherry bread one of these days.
author: Amanda M.

description: Their cup cakes are very good, DELICIOUS!!! one of the last great neighborhood bakeries in San Francisco, never been disappointed in the cakes and sweets!
author: Joseph M.

description:
Since I subsist almost entirely on carbs, I knew when I moved to Noe Valley that I was in trouble -- and that this bakery and I would be good acquaintances. The baguettes are excellent -- I prefer the sweet baguette, but the sour is also very good. The double raisin bread is practically a dessert -- it's literally stuffed with raisins. I love the cinnamon oat scones, which are hearty and have just the right amount of glaze. The cupcakes are delicious -- I prefer a more sugary frosting, myself, but I do love the lemon drop cupcake (but what happened to the little bee that used to adorn them?? I haven't seen them lately!). I also love the holiday cupcake varieties with the rubber finger puppet toppers (I swear I'm not five -- I would never buy a $2.75 cupcake for the cute little ghost, turkey or snowman toy...no...not me, I..I...). Other standouts are the whoopie pies (both chocolate and lemon), the apricot hamentashen cookies (which are both buttery and tart), the Noe-Os and the iced circus cookies. Basically, you can't go wrong here! 

The staff has always been friendly and helpful, too, no matter how busy it is.
author: Katie M.

description:
Most-est Cupcake. That's it. That's all you need to know. Go there. Buy it. You'll take it with you on trips, send it over seas, send it to your friends as gifts, IT'S THAT GOOOOOD! 

I travel across town just to have one. Sooner or later you'll being the same thing!
author: Tedi O.

description:
Semi-complete review;

I had a few Croissants at the Ferry Building's Farmer's market.   Pretty good.  Light and smooth.  I should have ordered more items, but I only had a limited amount of space in my pack, and my friend and I were biking up the Embarcadero.... darn.  Next time.
author: Neil Y.

description: I had a pretty complicated order that involved putting our logo on a sheet cake for a work event, and I didn't leave much time to get it done.  Terry at Noe Valley Bakery was very easy to work with, and the cake was beautiful, delicious, and not expensive.  We were very happy.
author: Sue W.

description: Mostess cupcake...to die for. I ordered my dad's birthday cake here a few weeks ago. Vanilla chiffon with lemon filling and everyone loved it.
author: Joanie M.

description: Love this place! I try to get coffee there every morning (as long as I'm not running late). It's clean and inviting, the coffee is delicious, and the staff is so friendly! All the food from here is tasty, from the muffins, to cupcakes, and I even get my stuffing for Thanksgiving here.
author: Angela M.

description:
Walking through Noe Valley, we stumbled upon this bakery and decided to try it out. Took us the longest time to decide what to get.

- Red Velvet Cupcake: moist, nice not too sweet cream cheese frosting
- Vanilla Cupcake: sweet, moist, didn't like the whip cream-like frosting with sprinkles, it just tasted like cream & butter and wasn't dense enough
- Apple Wrap: basically a cinnamon glazed half apple wrapped in phyllo dough, not bad
- Coffee Cake Muffin: moist cake, very light on the nuts, but overall good

All their cakes seem to be moist, which I like. The worst is when the cake is dry and they try to compensate by over-frosting. The frosting on the cupcakes were lighter than other places, but I kind of like my frosting dense like the way Sprinkles makes it, although they pile on a little too much on their cupcakes. But the cupcakes are only $2.50 here.

Service was friendly and patient as we kept trying to decide on what to get. Cute bakery in Noe Valley with good moist cakes!
author: Linda C.

description:
6 simple words --  "Chocolate Chip Cookies with Pecans PLEASE."  
Definitely a must visit while taking a stroll through Noe Valley.  Might as well drop by a coffee shop near by to have coffee along with your cookie.
author: romeo b.

description: In a city filled with pretentious baked goods, Noe Valley Bakery is a breath of fresh air.  I really love the chocolate rugelach, but everything I've had here is good. It's just a simple, local, family bakery.
author: Lily S.

description: today i went by to get a couple of mexican wedding cookies, only to be told they have been discontinued because they were slow sellers.  i'm afraid they have lost my business because this was reason for crossing their threshold.  their mexican wedding cookies were the most expensive anywhere, but they were better even than tartine's, which is definitely not faint praise.  bye, bye noe valley bakery!
author: Susan C.

description:
There are certain things Noe Valley gets away with...

A bakery that is a bit overpriced, not all that great and doesn't open until after 8:00am (!!!!) thrives here. I mean, there are long lines sometimes out the door. Yes. Really?

There ain't no recession at NVB&B Co!

The coffee is so-so, I wouldn't go there for coffee, although if you do like it for some reason they have a frequent buyers card. Had decent "reduced-fat" muffin there...

I'd say the biggest draw would be their cakes & desserts (including cupcakes) especially for all the little tikes with bdays in babyville aka Noe. I totally love kids, don't get me wrong, but I have gotten better cakes elsewhere when getting for significant people in my life with milestones to celebrate over baked goods. I also get my bread elsewhere.

Really there are WAY better bakeries in SF/Bay Area, and I guess what I mean is a bakery you buy fresh, delicious bread at like, say Acme in the Ferry Bldg (that you can also buy fresh daily at many local businesses).
author: Abby W.

description:
Oh NVB, your fresh morning buns rolled in finger-lickin cinnamon and sugar, your sweet cheese filled love buns, and bavarian cream filled mostest cupcakes (best $2.50 ever!) are single-handedly thwarting my fitness plan.

But I still love you so.
author: Bipasha M.

description: Good cake! I don't say that lightly. So far my favorite go to for cake in the city. Counter service can be a bit iffy. Sometimes they see you sometimes they don't sometimes they are too busy talking to each other  Tried to  Special ordered like a few dozen petite fours out of season aparently that is a no no so I find thier rigidity a little odd.
author: Kitten M.

description:
It has got to be a sin for one place to carry so many pretty, yummy sweets. I can never decide on just one cupcake, so I usually walk out with three or four, clutching that white bakery box with their familiar sticker in my hot little hands. 

The cupcakes are so big that i don't dare shove one in my mouth while I'm driving back home. Instead, I break out the pretty silverware & cut into them and shovel forkfuls down the pie-hole. 

I have tried four & loved them all: 
- red velvet has amazing cream cheese frosting and moist signature red velvety cake 
- lemon drop has a perfect little bee sitting atop the yellow swirly frosting. Very tart, very delicious. 
- since pink is my favorite color, i always get a zinger'd. i don't usually like coconut, but the pink coconut on this cupcake is soft. The pink raspberry buttercream is so good and so sweet. 
- chocolate caramel-perfect combo of sweet & salty because there is a sprinkle of salt on top of the thick caramel ganache frosting. One bite and all your chocolate fantasies will be fulfilled. 

I'm going back as soon as possible to try the boston cream pie cupcake. But first, i MUST run a million and one miles on the treadmill!
author: Fancypants X.

description:
Went in at about 9 AM on a Tuesday to pick up some goodies for my boss' birthday brunch.  The young lady working the counter was gracious in dealing with my questions about what items were dairy-free, referencing the ingredients list for the few queries I had.  (Although I do have to admit that I think if you work in an establishment that carries baked goods, you should have some idea of what is wheat or dairy free.)  

Just moments later walked out with a cherry coconut ginger scone -- outstanding and they even sell the frozen dough there so you could bake at home.  Also grabbed a morning bun, which was perfectly flaky with a soft center and the most exquisite dusting of sugar & cinnamon to easily make it the best I've had.  Final purchase was a loaf of pumpkin bread, so dense, and topped with the proper cream cheese ratio.  (Yeah, that was my dairy-free item because I figured she could scrub the cheese off.  Nice of me, no?)

All the items were way above average and the young lady threw in a free rainbow candle for the birthday boss.  I must go back soon!  Sorry Arizmendi but Noe Valley Bakery is on the way to work.
author: Charla W.

description:
My favorite place to get Red Velvet Cupcakes. They make about 5 types of cupcakes for $2.50 each. My friend's son had the chocolate caramel.  They sell bread, cakes, pastries, coffee.  The cheese scone is really good too.  Staff's pretty nice here.  I left my friends shopping at a store nearby as I made a beeline into this bakery to line up for,... Red Velvet cupcake!
A luscious chocolate cupcake tinged with a lot of red food coloring and topped with delish cream cheese.  I really had to control myself or I'll eat up all they have in the display case.
author: Ry T.

description:
I have a couple of friends that live near here, but I hadn't tried NVB until I needed to find a bakery to order a cake for my brother's 21st birthday.  The bakery was pretty easy to work with and didn't require that much time in advance to place an order.  In terms of service, price, presentation, and taste (4 stars).

But what really bumped my review up to the 5 stars was their Cloud 9 cake.  O - M - G.  What moist, decadent, slice of heaven.  I took a chance on this cake because I had no idea what it was, but it was a hit with everyone!

mmm - Cloud 9 cake, what I wouldn't do to get a slice right now... :)
author: Alvina W.

description:
My friend got these for his wife's birthday party. Such a great variety of flavors - the first dilemma was 'Which one to choose??'

Loved the carrot cake! 

Then had half of the lemon cupcake - made me nostalgic for when I would have my mom get me a lemon birthday cake when I was a kid. 

My friend adored her chocolate cupcake with the caramel fleur de sel. And my boyfriend (who doesn't really prefer sweets) seemed to really enjoy the 'Hostess'-like cupcake.

And here's something even more impressive: my friend (who threw the party) brought some of the leftovers into work (3 days after buying them) and they were still insanely moist! Now that's something that you can't often say about some cupcakes on their first day!
author: Jen N.

description:
Background:
Past research by the principal investigator has demonstrated that consumption of cupcakes is significantly linked with feelings of euphoria and mild insanity (but the good kind). Additionally, field research in NYC has compared various cupcake purveyors (http://www.yelp.com/list_details?userid=DAf3UOAONCpgETWlNTERKg&list_id=SzFCtFQ2YOJxI54pxaUr3Q) and found Magnolia Bakery's cupcakes to be the frontrunner, described as "HOT and MOIST and HEAVENLY" (http://www.yelp.com/biz/85x3dZCMBj4rJ2LAdW-wFg?hrid=4nvPmoOAzAzW7hJjlMIjWw)  However, there is currently a dearth of research addressing the Great Cupcake Debate in the Bay Area (by the present PI). Therefore, the present review represents one study in a multi-site, ongoing research project to determine the Bay Area's BEST CUPCAKE EVAR.


Method:
The site for Study #1 - Noe Valley Bakery & Bread Company. Samples included:
1) Most-est Cake - popular among Yelp reviews, fashioned after the Hostess cupcakes;
2) Z'nger cupcake -fashioned after Dolly Madison raspberry flavored, creme filled cakes;
3) Carrot Cake cupcake - fashioned after...well, carrot cake;
4) Asiago cheese loaf (ok, so it's not a cupcake, but my co-investigator was kind enough to give me some of her loaf so it's fair for review)

Results:
OMG!!! (and I mean that in the most scientific way possible). Eating these cupcakes is like discovering a completely new, moister, more delicious level of existence. Let's break it down by each independent variable with the dependent variable (DV) operationalized as Steph's level of euphoria (where 1 = I would rather eat dirt, and 10 = I  could die right now and not give a crap):

1) Most-est - Biting into the chocolate ganache top gives way to moist, chocolate cake heaven. A second bite into the cupcake and negative memories of the nasty white pseudocream in Hostess Suzy-Q's and Twinkies dissipate as perfect portion of the fluffy, vanilla creme center melds together with the surrounding chocolate cake. A wonderful cupcake, but personal tastes favor frosting over ganache. DV = 8.5 

2) Z'nger - If angels came in the form of cupcakes, they would probably taste something like this. Moist angel food cake, filled and topped with a delicate whipped creamlike frosting that is speckled with raspberry preserves and dusted with pink and white coconut flakes. DV =  10

3) Carrot Cake - Perfectly constructed in sweetness, density, and incorporation of shredded carrot, raisins, and walnuts. The frosting is a traditional cream cheese frosting, but excecuted perfectly to achieve the ultimate balance of sweetness, lightness, and creaminess. Eating this evoked images of swimming in carrot cake. (I dunno?) Even my co-investigator, who doesn't like carrot cake, had to concede that this was a delight.  DV = 10

4) Asiago Cheese Loaf - A sturdy bread with large chunks of savory asiago goodness running throughout. I would imagine this would be quite delicious served warm as a sandwich bread or as is. DV = 7

Discussion:
While the present research did not incorporate the tasting of the plain chocolate or vanilla cupcakes(thus serving as a control in comparing against other bakeries), the intensity of the reactions formed suggest that Noe Valley Bakery is in the running for the best cupcakes in SF. It should also be mentioned that the next morning, these cupcakes were STILL moist and heavenly. The Asiago loaf also suggests that the bakery does a good job with savory items, though further research is needed for more confident results. Other observations worthy to note:  there is no seating in the bakery and few cafes nearby; plan ahead where you will be conducting your own research. At only $1.95 per cupcake, this is a great deal compared to some other places that offer gourmet cupcakes. This is located in Noe Valley, which is a pain in the ass for someone who lives in the Inner Richmond. But it is TOTALLY worth it. I will try to make more friends with cars just to have more of these cupcakes.

Conclusion:
Noe Valley Bakery has some DAMN GOOD, affordable cupcakes! Dare I say...better than Magnolia?!?! The PI's conception of cupcakes has been turned upside down and requires further investigation. Future research is highly recommended to assure reliability and validity of findings...and to induce states of euphoria!
author: Steph P.

description:
Best Chocolate Cake made for a recent birthday event. 

Glad to have found in the neighborhood. Good follow up and customer service and of course cake... 

Think of them for your next event....
author: Edgar M.

description:
I promised Nina that I would get her some chocolate dipped strawberries, so rather than take her to the typical Godiva or Rocky Chocolate Mountain shops - I thought that this place would be a better alternative. It was the day after Valentine's Day and it was raining cats and dogs in San Francisco. 

When we walked in you would have to be blind not to notice all the wonderful delights that line their display, never mind the long line of people fighting for cupcakes....for a business that has been there since 1995, they definitely have a following. Nina got her strawberries and I bought a red velvet cupcake for myself. Yums. 

This place is a definite must go when you are in Noe Valley.
author: Max D.

description:
Chocolate - Caramel-fleur De Sel Cupcake (4)
Red Velvet Cupcake (2)
Boston Cream Pie Cupcake  (2)
Zinger'd Cupcake  (1)
Mocha Cupcake  (2)
Carrot Cupcake  (1)

This is how I filled my dozen. 
Ate one sitting in the car because I couldn't wait!
I guarantee they'll be gone by tomorrow!!

Ever since a co-worker brought in Noe Valley Bakery Cupcakes, I have been craving them.  I make up reasons to go to Noe Valley just so I can have one.  Today, I couldn't resist and bought the whole dozen.  I'm so excited - it just made my week!!!!! :)
author: Lauren C.

description:
You can call me the "Hostess with the Most-est (Cupcake stuffed in my mouf)." The "Most-est" is Noe Valley Bakery's version of the Hostess cupcake, filled with Bavarian cream and topped with chocolate ganache. And at $2.25, why would you ever buy a Hostess cupcake ever again? And if you love Hostess Zingers, they make a Zinger'd cupcake. (Oh, I know you used to beg your mom to put one in your lunch box when you were little!)

So moist and rich, eating what seems like an entire stick of butter never tasted better! In fact, I'm actually eating a Chocolate-Caramel-Fleur de Sel Cupcake, which is a chocolate cake filled with a Caramel Bavarian Cream, topped with a Caramel Chocolate Ganache frosting with Fleur de Sel sprinkled on top. Yes, right now. Chocolate frosting is getting all over my keyboard, but it's so worth it. The combination of salty and sweet is heavenly. 

I've also had their cherry chocolate bread, which is delicious! Are they really vegan?! I would've never thought. 

Ok, gotta run to get some milk to wash this cupcake down!
author: Connie C.

description:
After my Krav Maga workout I came home sore, achy and tired.

20 minute hot Epsom salt bath for the tender muscles.

It's 9:20- I haven't had dinner yet.  Starving.  I don't even want to open a can of soup.

In the fridge - box of cupcakes.

Red Velvet with cream cheese frosting.   Yum!

The only thing better would be eating this cupcake while I was soaking in the tub!
author: Jenn A.

description:
Their blueberry pecan scones (the kind you buy frozen and bake at home) are excellent.  They are so buttery that we actually pour the excess melted butter off the pan after pulling them out of the oven.  Yup, no lie.

They make good cupcakes (good, but not the best - my favorite is the Chocolate-Caramel-fleur De Sel Cupcake), breads, and sandwiches.

Their coffee is really top-notch in my book.

I just tried their new "Stud Muffin."  I liked the name (though the guy behind the counter was cringing with embarrassment!), but it wasn't the studliest muffin.  It was a chocolate muffin, with cream cheese and sparse chocolate chips - it had a slight coffe taste (I don't like coffee in my chocolate - I'm a chocolate purist!), and I've had better at other places.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
UPDATE 9/1/07: After years of resistance, I finally grabbed a 'Morning Bun' AFTER heading for work. Now the wifey and I are addicted. It's absolutely perfect - light as a doughnut even though it is baked, with cinnamon and sugar sprinkled throughout its soft flakey layers. The 'Honey Bun' is similar, but with a super rich cream filling inside. 

This is why I resisted for so long, because I'd be hocking all YOUR stuff to get my morning fix. Laura B. is gonna cry her eyes out when she comes home to an empty curio cabinet...porcelain puppies = the new Google IPO! You heard it here first!

You get what you pay for in this neighborhood shop. I plunked down my 2 bills for their 'Most-est Cupcake' to go with my Peet's (they serve that, too). It had the curly-loopy squiggle like the one in my 'Hong-Kong Phooey' lunchbox. That's where the similarity ends.

The moist chocolate cake has a genuine chocolate 'burn' to it. Inside, real, fresh Bavarian cream (not that yellow donut shop goo) coats everything in your mouth! If really nostalgic, you can even peel off the frosting cap and let it melt in your mouth separately. More flavor with none of the parafin!

It's so good you could punch me in the mouth and I'd just smile at you like Snoopy after a hockey game.

Any concerns about spending a few extra quarters here are quelled by their VANLOADS of baked goods to homeless shelters and soup kitchens around the holidays.
author: Andy R.

description:
My cupcake culinary adventure results....

Cups and Cakes Bakery 5
Love at First Bite 4.75
Mission Minis 4.15
Noe Valley Bakery & Bread Company 4
Miette Patisserie 4
Cafe Madeleine 3.75
Leonidas Chocolates 3.5
Market Hall Bakery 3.25
Sibbys Cupcakery 3.25
Urban Bread 3
Cako Bakery 2.5
Bay to Breakers Cupcake Girls 2.1
Cupkates 2

Lemon cupcakes are the best flavor at Noe Valley Bakery. Mmm I want one now :-P
author: Anna S.

description: This bakery is the best!  All the cupcakes are de-lish.  They're moist, flavorful, and most of the time come with a filling.
author: ena p.

description:
FIVE STARS!  And here's why...

1. They are a small, independent local neighborhood store.

2.  They are generous during the holiday season and donate tons of pies and goodies to shelters in S.F. (so nice!)

3.  The chocolate cupcake filled with Bavarian creme...arrrgh...it's sooo tasty.  

4.  The (vegan) cherry chocolate bread is just about the best thing ever invented by man.  I ate a whole loaf in one sitting...and I'm TOTALLY OK with that.

5.  The sumptuous morning bun can be eaten even when it's NOT morning time!  WOO!

They have luscious pastries, cakes, tarts and breads, and the delicious scent of freshly baked goods floats onto 24th street every morning...I love bakeries, though...so I'm a little biased.
author: Kristina R.

description:
Asiago cheese bread is a tasty loaf of bread, with real cheese baked into it. Not little tiny flakes of cheese sprinkled on top, but real chunks of cheese baked into the insides. It's like ravioli, except without the tomato sauce, and with more carbs.

I'm not a fan of the "Noe-O's" (but I'm not a fan of Oreo's either).

The oatmeal raisin cookies are where it's at (after the cheese bread).
author: Rob T.

description:
It was midnight and officially my birthday. No champagne? Hmmm.

That's when I ate the carrot cupcake. 
The one reserved for breakfast. 

I don't usually choose carrot cake for myself, but it was a gift. (the givers  husband got the chocolate one, damn it!!)  Not that I don't like carrot cake, mind you.

It was delicious. Moist. Cream cheese frosting uber creamy!
My cat also enjoyed the super-creamy cream cheese frosting. 
She fancies herself as a connoisseur of all things related to frosting and yogurt and cheese.
It was so good I almost didn't share it with her. 
Her eyes pleaded. Pupils fully dilated. Head tilted.
I broke.
I shared.
That's just how I roll.

Thanks, Noe Valley Bakery for the sweet start to my b-day!!
author: Tiffinie T.

description: I had the red velvet and Boston cream pie cupcakes...and I'm afraid I was underwhelmed, especially for $3 a pop.
author: Maximillian M.

description:
My girlfriend and I raced back home from Union Square one Sunday night not too long ago to indulge our chocolate cherry rugalech addiction.  To our horror we arrived too late and the bakery had already closed for the night.  We staggered home and recoiled on the couch in despair.  Hours later, after we had recovered from our grief we decided to take a walk down 24th st back to the bakery to at least feel the aura of the chocolate, the cherries and the dough.

When we arrived at the bakery we noticed a light on in back and a baker preparing dough.  Despite a moment of hesitation we decided to knock on the window to see if we could somehow still salvage the evening with our cherished rugalech.  The baker came to the door, and we explained to him our plight.  After listening attentively to our story, he told us to wait and disappeared in back.  Moments later he returned with an enormous smile and a large paper bag containing five loaves of chocolate cherry bread.  We hadn't realized such a miraculous thing existed.  We felt that five loaves would be indulgent and after a bit of haggling with the generous baker we were able to negotiate that three loaves would be sufficient.  We thanked the baker, returned home, rejoiced, and devoured the bread.

I believe noe valley bakery bakes items that do not contain chocolate and cherries.  They're probably terrific.  But the chocolate cherry rugalech are truly extraordinary.
author: ariel b.

description:
Not very good but very pricey.
Very talkative and rude customer service.

Makes me feel the same way as if my therapist were baking cookies during a session. 

And, if you live in Noe Valley, you've probably been to France, have a therapist and know what I mean.
author: Bobby T.

description:
Apparently I am in the minority on this one, but I really don't dig this place at all. As far as bakeries go, I find it to be mediocre. 

I hate to pull out the "I lived in France" card, but I lived in France and would expect much better bread considering the prices they charge. They don't even have baguettes until 10AM for goodness sake! And they call themselves a bakery?? If you want an authentic baguette (or other types of bread), you're best off heading to one of Pascal Rigo's joints -- Boulange de "insert location name here" -- or any number of other places.

The cupcakes are just okay (the ones up the street at Kookez are much better) and the pastries too high-priced for what you get. Even Tartine has better prices and Miette better cakes. 

San Francisco has a decent selection of bakeries and it seems to me that this one just plays off its captive audience in Noe Valley.
author: Sarah B.

description:
Still my very favorite bakery in the bay area!!
  
if any of you out there know of a note-worthy bakery in the Palo Alto area, let me know!  until then,... I'll be making the long schlepp back to Noe, just for this yummy goodness.
author: thats r.

description:
This review is just for the cupcakes, since that's all I've had here.

They're good. Not great, but good. My partner and I got the boston cream and lemon-flavored ones to share. It turns out they both had the same cake, which was kind of like a poundcake--very dense, not really what I'd prefer on a cupcake. The fillings were delicious, as was the frosting, but the filling had been added in kind of a weird way: there was just a big hole punched right through the center of the cupcakes, so that if you didn't watch out you could either [a] drip a lot of filling out of that hole in the bottom, or [b] accidentally stick your finger right through said hole. This made them pretty messy to eat.

I wouldn't go out of my way for these cupcakes, but if I was in the neighborhood and they had another kind of cake available, I'd try another one.
author: Lynae Z.

description:
most-est cupcake - good take on a classic childhood treat. i think i still prefer sprinkles or kara's in terms of taste and selection. but pretty good for a neighborhood joint. 

fruit tart was classic, fresh and light
author: Annie c.

description:
I don't have a fondness for Noe Valley, but it is worth it to jet in for the bread, and get out before you realize where you are.  The multigrain walnut bread is a staple on my wooden cutting board- it is perfect.  smother it with jam, butter, hummus, goat gouda- it's delish. 

I am also a fan of the cheddar-chive scone. thank you for the savory options.
author: Emliy H.

description:
Disclaimer - this bakery's high reviews on yelp seem to be associated with their cupcakes; I've never tried their cupcakes (weren't cupcakes the fad in 2007?)

Starting with *** (in my past 5- 7 visits to the bakery over the past few months I have never had anything here that blew my mind or anything that has made me sick, and the customer service is generally OK.)

Minus one * for really bad customer service this evening
 - This evening I stopped in and was eye-ing their brownies.  When it was my turn to order, I asked the cashier what kind of chocolate they used for their brownies.  She then turned away and went off to check, rolling her eyes as she slowly walked towards a binder behind the counter.  If eye-rolling was unavoidable, she should have at least held off until she had completely turned away from the counter...
 - The result is that they use Guittard chocolate, which is average chocolate widely used but too sweet for my liking and nothing to write home about, so instead of ordering the brownie I went for something smaller in order to mitigate my losses while still satisfying my sweet tooth.  

Minus 1* for the worst cookie I've ever had
 - I ordered the Noey-Oh, their version of an Oreo...and it was...the worst cookie I've ever had...absolutely the worst...I can't get the highly processed, overly sweet taste out of my mouth, which is why I was inspired to write this review.
author: Jennifer V.

description: Every neighborhood needs a bakery, *especially* Noe Valley, where the most happening time is Saturday at 11...in the morning.  This place is certainly a cut above the average bakery, especially as they have lots of delicious bread in addition to all the sweet stuff.  If you find yourself in Noe Valley in the morning...you're probably exactly the kind of person who would want to stop in here.
author: Wes M.

description:
The white chocolate pistachio scone made my day!!! It was really good, not too sweet or dry as many scones usually would be. I also had their new product, lemon cheese something. That was good as well.

I think I should go to this place more often....yup.
author: Christa K.

description: I LOVE noe valley bakery.  The chocolate cherry bread is heavenly, and the double raisin bread is to die for.  They tend to run out of the raisin bread so I recommend that you call a day ahead and have them reserve a loaf for you.  You will need to give them a credit card to hold the loafs.  This place is so great I almost don't want to post because I don't want longer lines!
author: Michelle T.

description:
There we were, my boyfriend and I, that is. Pacing back and forth waiting for our adorable friend Ravi to meet up with us, so we can continue our Sunday morning meanderings on 24th Street. He was already close to 30 minutes late. I should have known...Ravi time is this notorious thing called indian time. I could just kick him all the way back to India. But, that doesn't make sense since he was really raised in Chicago. Oh well, Chicago is a far enough kick. Okay, I digress..

So, there we were pacing back and forth when I looked up to read "Noe Valley Bakery and Bread Company". 

I peeked in and saw the most delicious looking desserts. I immediately walked in, looked the guy behind the counter straight in the eye, pointed to the lemon drop cupcakes and the chocolate boston cupcakes, and said "one of each, please." Paid and sat on the bench right outside the door. I took a bite of the lemon drop cupcake...yummmm...so moist. I took a bite of the chocolate boston cupcake while my boyfriend held it...mmmm...creamy. Again, another bite of the lemon drop...not too sweet. Another bite of the chocolate boston cupcake...I think I'm in heaven. There we sat alternating between cupcakes. I was licking my fingers clean when Ravi walked up. I immediately jumped up, gave him a hug, and said "I'm SOOOO glad you were late!" He quickly replied, "Yeah, whatever. Let's go get coffee."

Overall: Delicious cupcakes from ($2-2.50) and an assortment of other yummy cakes that need my expert opinion.
author: Liz K.

description:
I've been here on 2 separate occasions.  First I happen to walk by and decided to pick up a carrot cake for a friends dinner.  It was DAMN good.  Best carrot cake that I've ever had.

2nd occasion, I remembered how great the carrot cake was and wanted to order some birthday cupcakes for my girlfriends birthday powwow.  I was pretty specific with how I wanted the cupcakes designed, 10 red velvet cupcakes with a chocolate cursive  initial F, with white pearls/sugar crystals, and 10 carrot cupcake with a chocolate cursive initial J, again with white pearls/sugar crystals.   Making the order and communication via email was no problem, it was a very smooth process.  Although when I went to pick them up, I noticed that some of the initial F's were on the carrot cupcakes.. which is not what I requested.  It's bad because we'd be eating them in a dimly light lounge, where the only way I would be able to tell people what type of cupcake they were was of the different initials.  Also, the Initials weren't the prettiest of initials.  The J looked horrible actually lol.  It looked more like an I.  Oh well, the girls loved the way they tasted.  Everyone was buzzed enough to not grade the looks of the cursive initials, and I was able to switch over the J & F's on the correct cupcake flavor.  Negative star for the mix up of initials.. 

I also have tried their blueberry scones in the AM, which tasted a bit over done.  It was a bit more brown then I had anticipated as well.  Their chocolate croissants are NOT worth the calories, please skip at all costs.
author: Alice E.

description:
I'm not really a sweets person and I don't really eat breads other than sourdough toast in the mornings, so I'm basing this review solely on the several cakes I've purchased there over the years and the excellent service. 

I started out with the chocolates, but bought a strawberry hazelnut cake for Aaron V's birthday one year and it's become a favorite of ours. We also got one for my mom's 50th, my last birthday and when our friend came back to SF from San Diego to celebrate her birthday. It's always a big hit because it's light, only slightly nutty, the strawberries are perfect and not slathered in sickeningly sweet strawberry flavored gel, and the real whipped cream topping and filling are also sweet without being too sweet. I like that it's unique, real quality and comes in a few different sizes to fit your needs.

There's a big book of cake designs they can do, but they're always happy to do a quick "Happy Birthday _____" for a couple extra bucks. They only have plain candles in the store, but Just For Fun & Scribbledoodles down the street has tons of fun candles and cake decorations.

The main pic here is my last strawberry hazelnut b-day cake with gold and champagne bottle candles from Just for Fun
author: Kristina A.

description:
This place is right down the street from my brother's place so one day he picked up some cupcakes to take to a potluck we were going to. After my first bite, I was in love and have requested them every special after that and stop by every time I visit my bro. 

The only thing stopping me from giving it 4 stars is that after the 1st time while the cupcakes have been delicious, they have not been as heavenly as that first time. Perhaps my expectations have gotten skewed, but in my opinion a true 5 star place should be mind-blowing no matter what your expectations are. I am a big cupcake fan and love even the simple cupcakes out of the box, but these cupcakes are really special. I feel like I can taste the love in them as you can really taste the individual flavors of the ingredients in the frosting/cake. They are moist even after a day or so in the fridge!

Writing this review, I think it's time for another trip up to the City soon!
author: Cindy N.

description: Tried all the famous cupcake shops in bay area, I finally decide Noe Valley Bakery's cup cakes are my favorites!! My top three flavors are... Lemon, Carrots (& I don't even eat carrots in salad or stew)  & red velvet.
author: Amanda W.

description:
Terrible customer service!  Seriously, how hard is it to be good to your neighborhood customers when you are a small business??  

I called last week for a large order of cupcakes...I was quoted a certain price and told that they could decorate them specifically for the party I was throwing.  I didn't have my cr card at the time to confirm, but was told to call back or stop on in and ask for Nick and I would be all set...

So I stop in Saturday morning.  I wait in the very long line until it was my turn.  I give the girl behind the counter my info and patiently wait.  And wait.  Turns out she cannot find the order but will call me back to confirm on the phone.  Okay, no sweat.  

After playing phone tag, Terry calls me today.  Tells me that they cannot decorate the cupcakes the way I had requested (all I asked for was a colored frosting---that was it!) and that instead of the amount I was originally quoted it would be slightly more.

Certainly not the end of the world, but c'mon.  Really now...this is the basics of customer service.  And now I won't go back and have nothing nice to say when asked... Sigh.
author: Kristie F.

description:
The Candyman makes
everything he bakes
Satisfying and delicious.
Talk about your childhood wishes...
You can even eat the dishes!

Okay, okay.  There are no dishes to eat, but if there were... well, you would.

This place rivals Tartine; which is another slice of heaven.  When you're here, though, don't miss the:

- Coffeecake (best in the world)
- Crusty white bread (buy it, slice it, toast it, butter it, love it.  I was a wheat bread eater for YEARS 'till i had this--amazing)
- Morning buns (orangey, cinnamonny goodness)
- Ham & cheese quiche (every weekend)
- Chocolate croissants

Sometimes the counter staff makes you feel like you're lucky to be buying their stuff (they're kinda right).  Except a brown-haired woman named Megan who always has a big smile on her face and is a service SupaStah.  She keeps the place at 5 stars.
author: Scott W.

description:
Best cupcakes in the City!  I think I've tried every one.... from the Fudge cupcake, to the vanilla cupcake, to their Zinger'd (an adult strawberry coconut Zinger), their Rocky Road (a little too much going on for me), their "Most-est" (like the chocolate fave Hostess cupcake complete with squigglies).....  My friends laugh at my cupcake obsession.

But Dear Noe Valley Bakery, I'm on a campaign for a vanilla cupcake with your fudge frosting.  It's my absolute favorite type, and *sigh* I have yet to see it in your presence.   I'll change this review to five stars if I see my fave cupcake in your glorious glass cases.
author: Jane A.

description:
Not bad..not bad at all. I love their chocolate cherry rugelach and am oh so intrigued by their frosted pumpkin bread. Their Almond Croissant was very disappointing but overall they are a decent bakery. I hear their cupcakes and tarts are the thing to try so next time I will come in for one of each and some of their CC rugelach.

Note* - don't expect it to be your typical jewish rugelach..cos it really isn't.. but whatever it is..it's awesome
author: Natalie G.

description:
Delicious, wonderful, beautiful cupcakes. Great challah and the soda (seasonal) bread are fantastic. Hiii-lariously poor customer service. WTF? How can someone be so miserable around delicious desserts? 

p.s. I p/u'd an ass-load of assorted cupcakes in January (for a party, geez) and the counter guy was nice to me. I don't remember his name but I haven't seem him since. Cupcake guy, where ever you are now, I wish you a happy, contented and peaceful life.
author: Mitsi M.

description: Nice little bakery, with a combination of Jewish yummies (hamantashens, rugelach, and challah) and cupcakes. Everything was very fresh, tasty, and cute. My morning bun tasted like a buttery and moist pastry version of cinnamon toast crunch. Methinks the owner went to my little, funky, undergrad alma mater.
author: Andrew K.

description:
I have a long history with this bakery, so bear with me.

I first fell in love with their olive bread.  I used to buy loaves and loaves of it whenever I was in The City and freeze it so it would held me over until my next trip to The City.  Pretty sure it could be classified as an addiction, but whatever.

Then they stopped making it.  That is just evil.

Fast forward to my wedding this summer.  Being one of the hip lezbo couples getting hitched (again!?!?!) in The City, we had about a month to plan.  We had the wedding at Crissy Field on the beach (aaaaah) and then kept the reception low-key with a picnic.  Of course, I was all about cupcakes. (I thought this was SO clever. Little did I know that cupcakes are all the rage for weddings. Whatever!!!). 

I yelped and decided on NVB.  I checked out their website and was thrilled with their cupcake selection.  I ordered a variety of 80 cupcakes, 2 tiered stands (each holds 40-45 cupcakes) , and a wedding cake with 2 brides because people told me they carry those.  

"We no longer carry those," the dude told me on the phone. Huh?  What is with this place not carrying the things I want?  Grr.  Ok, so where can I get them? "A store a block away carries them. You can get them and bring them here and we can put them on your cake."

Wow, how convenient for me (living in Tracy at the time).  Really?  It's too great an effort for someone from the shop to go a half block away, get the dang brides and hell, charge me double, I don't care!  Nice customer service.

So one of our SF friendies ran over there, got the brides and took them to the bakery about a week before the wedding.

I got no less than 4 phone calls to confirm this or that about my order. Huh?  And the night before my wedding, I got a call asking what I wanted on the top of my cake.  You have GOT to be kidding me.  Really?  The NIGHT BEFORE MY WEDDING you want to get on my nerve?  You think you know Bridezillas?  You should be running, boy.
