Keeping my most calm tone, I calmly (through gritted teeth) informed him of the situation, to get the following response: "Oh. Got 'em!"  I then calmly (still gritting) said, "Look. My wedding is TOMORROW.  Will there be any problems on your end?  If so, I need to know now.  Because all these phone calls are getting this bride VERY NERVOUS."  He assured me that everytthing was hunky-dory.  Right, as if he had a cloodle what was going on.

How many freakin' people do they have working there to have such horrible inter-office communications.........?  Ok, so anyway, my friend goes to pick everything up on the morning of the wedding, and the kid hands her 1 box of cupcakes and the cake and stands there. "Um, where's the rest?"  He looks.  Brings back one more box. "Uh, excuse me, where are the REST?"  He goes back, gets another box.  Alright, almost there...  "Dude, there are 80 cupcakes in the order!  Where are the rest???"  Now she is losing it.  Finally he brings the rest of the cupcakes and tiered stands and she's outta there.

Cake was fab. Freaking deeeeliciousssssnesss times a million.  It was white cake with fudge filling and fondant.  Like crack.

Everyone raved about the cupcakes, so that is good.

Next day when my friend went to return the tiered stands, some kid got all pissy with her, saying that there were parts missing.  Hearing the hubbub, the manager (or someone) came over and said no, it's all here and thanked my friend.  She was SO DONE with NVB and I bet she'll never set foot in there again.  And it's totally in her hood.  Hmm. Not good.

So regarding customer service and all, this place gets about a 1 star.  I'm pretty sure their whole staff smokes a fatty right before their shift starts.  At least that is how it seemed from my end.
But their stuff is so good, that would get 5 stars.
So overall, 3 stars.
author: Dele P.

description:
YUM! Even though I'd made a pan of brownies last night, I couldn't resist dropping by for cupcakes. Four to be precise. A Most-est, Red Velvet, Boston Cream Pie and the Chocolate-Caramel-Fleur de Sel. Lighter than Miette's, these are perfect as an afternoon snack. I hadn't read reviews beforehand otherwise I would have picked up some of that cherry chocolate rugelach everyone raves about. 

Now who wants to come over and eat brownies and cupcakes? I'll have cold skim milk waiting!
author: Nathalie L.

description: This review is solely on the cupcakes here.  My friend and I were craving a cupcake, and we looked on yelp to see where to go.  Saw the 4 star average here, so we decided to check it out.  The service was very friendly and the vanilla cupcakes were reasonably price for cupcakes, at $2.50 each.  However, I felt that the cupcake itself was pretty dry and totally disappointing.  It tasted more like a muffin than a cupcake because it wasn't moist.  Maybe this place might have good pastries or something, but stay away from the cupcakes.  They'll make you sad.
author: Tyler C.

description:
I have forbidden my boyfriend from over purchasing the Asiago Cheese Bread b/c I could eat it around the clock. I don't know how this is possible, but if you pan fry it in butter & salt, it tastes like fried chicken...and that's a good thing being a vegetarian originally from the south. Just b/c I don't eat fried chicken doesn't mean I don't miss it. 

The Mostest cupcake will make your eyes roll into the back of your head it's so good. It reminds me of a chocolate dipped ice cream cone - thick, rich chocolatey goodness outside, creamy vanilla surprise inside.

This is a place to grab stuff & go, no seating...so wait for the sun to come out & stop by and happily eat yourself into a carb coma.
author: Stephanie F.

description:
Everything I've had from here is soooo good -- from the challah (they come in dinner roll format, too!) to the cakes to the scrumptious morning pastries... it's a good thing that I am too lazy to go that far most mornings, or I'd be in trouble!

UPDATE:  I recently had an occasion to sample one of their cupcakes... DAMN, that's some good cake.  And frosting.  Excellent frosting.  A little pricey but an excellent size (read: too large and therefore highly caloric).
author: Nat K.

description:
Today is the first day I haven't eaten fried food since Wednesday, so I thought I could get a cupcake.  Unfortunately, Ritual didn't have the chocolate cupcake with salty fudgy frosting, so I yelped cupcakes and decided on Noe Valley Bakery and Bread Company as the closest high ranking cupcakery near me.

I got the vanilla cupcake.  Butter frosting.  I am not a fan of butter frosting...I like sour cream frosting and cream cheese frosting, and cream frosting...but not butter frosting.  I think it's too hard and doesn't go well with the soft crumbly goodness of cake. 

But....I also got a loaf of their double raisin bread, thinking I would eat some tomorrow.  Well, of course I wanted to try just a bite, just a tiny little taste.  I haven't been able to stop eating it since that first bite.  I think there's a whole box of raisins in the loaf.  And I am not even a huge fan of raisins...but it's really good in this loaf.  It's divine... and the bread is...moist?  I don't know how else to describe it.

So, not the cupcake I wanted, but an unexpected raisin pleasure. 
Oh, and the guy at the cash register was so nice.  
Guy: What would you like?
Me: Hmmm...Vanilla cupcake
Guy: Will that be it?
Me: Oh, wait, the double raisin loaf.
Guy: That will be all?
Me: Oh, and a small coffee as well.
(all this while the line behind me gets longer and longer).

Me...afflicted with inability to make up my mind before I get to the cash register....

Oh, oh, and they sell challah bread!  I am so going back to get some!
________

Update:

Since Steph P. is a cupcake fanatic, I decided to join her for an evening of chatting and cupcaking.  I will let her review her eats.  However, I will mention the Hostessy chocolate cupcake with a cream filling as being moist and obliterating the memory of the vanilla cupcake with the butter frosting. 

But, I am still more enthralled by their breads.  They had the most delicious Asiago Cheese Bread...crusty cheese exterior...and a core of Asiago Cheese enlivening the delicious bread.  While we walked over to Ritual to partake of coffee and cupcakes, we managed to devour most of the Asiago Cheese Bread.  

Steph was saying that she wished she could toast the bread.  Over the next couple of mornings, I toasted the little bit of bread leftover.  Very delicious toasted.  For those who don't plan to devour a large loaf of cheese bread quickly, they also sell Asiago Cheese rolls.
author: Sooj O.

description:
The very best bakery for cake ever.  Also excellent pastries (the apple turnovers deserve special mention), cookies, and bread.  But really, let's focus on cake.  

Noe Valley Bakery did our wedding cake 5 years ago: hazelnut sponge, whipped chocolate cream filling, and dark chocolate ganache icing.  It was so delicious and amazing that I have been dreaming about that cake for the past 5 years.  I wanted it so much that I decided that I had to have it for our anniversary.  Of course, like an idiot I didn't call them until Thursday afternoon when I needed it on Saturday.  Initially they were dubious about their ability to have the cake ready by then and told me that I should have given them at least one more day's notice.  But I told the guy on the phone that it was our anniversary and that I NEEDED to have this cake.  He checked with the actual bakers in the back room, told them the story, and returned to tell me that they would be able and happy to do my anniversary cake.  I was delighted.  I was even able to pay over the phone so a friend of mine could pick the cake up for me en route to the party.  When cake time arrived, everyone oohed and ahhed, but then once they started eating, there was silence.  No one could be bothered to chat because they were too busy having their worlds rocked by the best cake on earth.

I will not be waiting another 5 years between cakes, however.  We've got plenty of birthdays and other celebrations all year round.  Thank god.
author: Sian K.

description:
Stumbled upon this place by a total accident. The frozen scones were $12 and I thought they were super expensive ( as you only get 6 in the pack ). Let me tell you ... when I got home and made them for a little get together we were having they were a hit :) Next time you're there pick some up!

Also I hear rumors about the flowerless chocolate cake that will be available for Passover only! I want my space in line ... :)
author: Gennady Y.

description:
3 words: Pecan Sticky Buns!  Pure heaven in your mouth.  No joke. After moving into the neighborhood, our landlady of all people recommended this local favorite to us, claiming it to be the "best bakery ever."  And to be honest I would have to mostly agree. Although not everything I have tasted from the bakery lives up to its' excellence (the cupcakes for example ALL look utterly amazing, but taste just average imo...the Red Velvet Cupcake is the best out of the choices),  the overall "cuteness" of the buzzing shop makes it a true gem.  

As stated, the pecan sticky bun is by far my most favorite treat, a delectable sticky bun oozing with caramel, cinnamon, and candied pecans, and something I cannot resist anytime I walk by the packed joint.  

It's a very good sign that I don't mind waiting in the ever present line, as my taste buds are willing to wait for their perfect treat. Other baked goods prove to be just as delectable, so don't fear!  Give some things a try until you find a favorite. 

Hey even if you don't buy anything it is worth going in just to smell the scent of freshly baked bread at all hours of the day!
author: Ryan H.

description:
Got a nice array of breakfast pastries the other day and they were delicous.  Fresh and yummy.

Only thing I wished they made, is a breakfast/danish cake of some sort.
author: Gina C.

description:
this is where you find San Francisco's best cupcakes despite the fact there is not a coconut one and I LOVE coconut. 
..
try their salted carmel or moistest...boston creme pie. all three of these choices are sheer heaven and so rich, I make two reward meals out of each of mine.
..
I don't know why we don't hear more about these top cupcakes in the City. perhaps its b/c they're so good we don't want to run out.
author: shanestar h.

description: In my desire to try every single red velvet cupcake in the bay area, here's my opinion on NVB. I thought the red velvet cupcakes were excellent. The cream cheese buttercream topping was great, full of flavor and not too sweet, with just the right amount of tartness. The cupcake itself was good, although I thought it could use a little more cocoa taste. I think the ones at Sweet Things are also a little more moist. That being said, overall very nice. Now the red velvet journey continues.....
author: Dom L.

description:
Noe Valley Bakery serves great bread, cookies & cupcakes.  My photo includes a special occasion cake from NVB.   It was a 1/2 sheet vanilla chiffon cake with strawberry bavarian filling and vanilla buttercream.  The cake was adorable and very delicious!

The cupcakes are delicious.  For those of you that suffer from "dry cake syndrome", your search for a remedy has ended!   Some of the NVB cupcakes have filling within them. My cupcake faves include:
1.  Chocolate-Caramel-fleur De Sel Cupcake: Caramel ganache frosting, caramel bavarian filling
2.  Mocha Cupcake: Chocolate-coffee frosting, mocha buttecream filling
3.  Most-Est Cupcake: Looks like a Ding-Dong, Chocolate ganache, bavarian cream filling
4.  Red Velvet Cupcake: chocolate cupcake w/ red dye, topped with cream cheese frosting
5.  Zinger'd Cupcake:  Looks like a Zinger, Raspberry buttercream frosting w/ pink coconut shavings, raspberry bavarian filling
6.  Fudge Cupcake/Vanilla Cupcake: favorite classics

I bought these cupcakes for a party.  Everyone loved the cupcakes and was asking directions to NVB.  A definite crowd favorite!

I also bought the asiago cheese bread loaf, Mexican wedding cookies, and Pecan tarts. All were delicious too.  NVB is a complete bakery  -- will be back again soon.
author: Janet H.

description:
What I love about Noe Valley Bakery is the proximity of my house to this yummy yummy place. Considering my quest to eat healthier, I guess this can be perceived as a bad thing. However when you're craving for their famous red velvet cupcake, the things that are so wrong can taste ohhhh so right. Their hazelnut strawberry ready made cake is also a great pick-up for any celebration/occasion that you forgot to pre-order for. All I can say...tasty, tasty, & tasty! 

Recommendations: 
Red Velvet Cupcake (These go fast. Today, they were out by 11:30am. Come early!)
Carrot Cake Cupcake 
Sweet Cheese Croissant
author: Lisa T.

description:
I wanted to love these cupcakes, I really did.  I'm sorry, they were just OK.  Mine was a little on the dry side and the frosting was kinda thick and bland.  

What I did love was the ice cream cookie.  Oh my goodness...a cookie shaped in an ice cream cone complete with icing and sprinkles on a chocolate cookie base.  Three words:  Dee - Lish - Ous!
author: M L.

description:
i am sad to report that the cupcakes were dry and tasted very store-bought.. since the cake didn't taste very lemon-y, i was hoping it would be in the frosting. but the frosting didn't really have any taste but butter. same goes for the other cupcake we tried. i finally found a little lemon pudding/filling inside that was pretty tasty, not quite redeeming. they were cute (mine had a little bumble bee on top with almond wings) but just not what i expected. maybe we went on a bad day? or too late in the day? i was really hoping to find the best cupcakes in the city and was disappointed. 

the other baked goods (breads, pies, cookies) may be better so maybe i'll give them a try and up my rating?

i really wanted to love this place, but it goes against my philosophy of life to back a dry cupcake.
author: Stella C.

description: My God, my love of food has no bounds. Yes, I came in after a relaxing "pamper" day consisting in indulging on cookies and Yes BROWNIES! I am a cookie and brownie addict. Yes, I have come here to indulge in my cookie and brownie habit and Noe Valley Bakery is my pusher; Thank goodness!  The first bite of my brownie, I felt like I was floating on air. I waited until later to eat my cookie, I felt like I had heaven in my mouth. Chocolate and pecans ; Oh My!
author: Jennifer M.

description: Michael is an amazing artist!  This is the second year I have ordered a special 3d cake for a special party.  This one was Willy Wonka themed and turned out incredible.  The cake and decorations were right out of Cake Boss.  The cake itself was delicious.  It was a three layered cake with vanilla on top, chocolate in the middle and red velvet on the bottom.  Everything was fresh as could be.  if you want an artistic but yummy creation, go to Noe Valley Bakery!
author: sophie b.

description:
HOORAY FOR CUPCAKES! 
While I have not had the opportunity to drool over every one of Noe Valley Bakery's tasty creations, I have to say the cupcakes are extraordinary. Beautifully decorated and moist...oh yes, MOIST, these little cuppycakes make for a great (and cheap) birthday treat. It's like an edible present. mmmmmm, edible present. Check out the website.
author: Jessa B.

description:
The way to an employee's heart is her stomach. Employers should take note of that! Thats why Google was ranked #1 employer of the year in 2008 - thats because they fed their employees, kept 'em stuffed and happy. 

Being the overworked and underpaid staff that I am, I was secretly cussing at the boss for the past few weeks. Then today, he walks over to our department with a box of cupcakes. The cute oodles of sugar were screaming at me, "You fool! How could you be mad at him? Look at what he's treating you guys to!". My anger quickly diminished as I gobbled down the delicious red velvet cupcake. After my sugar-high, I am no longer cussing at him, rather praising now. He should win the award for "Best Boss Ever!" 

More cupcakes please.
author: Nancie T.

description:
a really nice neighborhood bakery, too bad i went late and a lot of stuff was gone.  decided to try their cupcakes, which are very large.
went for chocolate fleur de sel, red velvet, and most-est cupcakes $2.50 or $1.65? for small
i thought red velvet was the best.  the cream cheese icing was perfect, and the cake moist with a nice ratio of frosting for my tastes.  the fleur de sel did have a balanced sweet salty, but the frosting was too dense for my liking.  most-est mini was good too
author: Rob C.

description: So I groused about how little I like their cupcakes - oh well.  If I want a good cupcake I'll go to Baked in Potrero Hill.  But their breakfast-y pastries are decent, and their staff is always friendly and interesting.  It's a great neighborhood shop.
author: ML P.

description: This is my go to cupcake spot. I always get Red Velvet, Carrot, and Lemon. They don't overload the cupcake with frosting and the cake itself is the best in my opinion, nice and moist. The other baked good are pretty good too! My sister is a fan of the fruit tarts.
author: Natalie D.

description: I love the morning buns and the cinnamon twists, this is the best place to get them in the city. They have good cookies, and other pastries and breads too.  This is another bakery that I tend to get to late in the afternoon, as I'm on my way to aikido practice, and often they have run out of my favorites.  Couldn't you make extra twists?  They close at 7pm but they usually run out of their goodies by 5ish. There is no room to sit, actually hardly room to have a line in, but it's worth it.
author: Herschell L.

description: Okay, enough time had passed and I suspended my boycott of Noe Valley Bakery. I've gone in a few times for small treats -- a cupcake here, a cookie there -- and I've been satisfied with my experiences. The employees have been very nice, too. Perhaps I caught them on a truly off day back in 2008. I stand by my opinions on their full-sized cakes, though, and will continue to get them elsewhere.
author: Jessica L.

description:
their chocolate / salted caramel and the red velvet cupcakes are amazing!
also, the hot chocolate here is delicious!
author: S. M.

description:
I seem to have developed a bit of a cupcake fetish
and the ones here are moist, light and scrumptious!

In fact, pretty much everything I've tried here has been
superyum.

I used to stop by regularly for an almond croissant whenever I dropped my bf off at his shuttle. 
Well, he no longer takes this shuttle, but I don't need much of an excuse to cruise down the hill.
author: Sandrita R.

description: Thought I would give this place a try after seeing the yelp reviews. I had the raisin bun and was rather disappointed, it tasted stale and day old without much flavor. Also had a similar experience as another yelper where the lady helping me place my item on the counter and left it there rather than handing it to me which didn't really make any sense since I had to reach over the next customer being helped in order to get my item after paying. I love baked goods, but after this disappointment will not be returning.
author: Bernie H.

description: Okay so I've never actually set foot in this bakery or even driven by it but my coworker lives in the neighborhood and she spoils us with treats from them every now and then. I think this may be the best bakery for chocolate things. Today, since it is close to Easter, she brought in these chocolate eggs. They looked like they would be heavy things but one bite into it revealed a soft light cake filled with airy chocolate creamy mousse. I can die now. It was covered in chocolate ganache and decorated with pink flowers. It was so cute. I wish I took a picture of it but my mouth devoured it first. On my birthday, my coworker brought in chocolate cupcakes which were pretty much fresh grown up versions of Hostess cupcakes. People tried to be good by cutting them in half and only eating half. But then I noticed they went back to eat the other half. If you are going to eat a cupcake, eat the whole damn thing people! My coworker has also brought in chocolate cakes from the Noe Valley Bakery and they are pure decadence. It's not so fancily decorated. It's just high quality stuff. The chocolate is always on the dark side. It's never too sweet. Again, people would take only tiny slices. Oh my, "If you are going to cake, eat cake!!" What would we do without Marie Antoinette?
author: Rachel A.

description:
best morning pastries in SF.
Morning buns, love buns, best brownies ever, cup cakes, pies, ...
So very good. As with most good things in SF, not cheap. But worth it.
author: Fred A.

description:
The guy I have been dating needed "space" this weekend ...

*cue death march*

...and I needed a cupcake.

The Caramel Fleur de Sel cupcake is the best cupcake I have *ever* had.  Ever.  My eyes rolled back in my head.

The Lemon one with the bee is a close second.

Who needs men when there are little edible bees on lemon cupcakes??
author: Dwayne A.

description:
I've only had one item from here...the LOVE BUN.

After reading a ton of reviews glorifiying their cupcakes, I wanted to see what all the hype was about.  However, they looked too sweet with a lot of stuff on 'em.  How they looked too sweet?...I don't know.  I suppose that I was in the mood for something a bit more simple.  That's when the LOVE BUN on the bottom shelf caught my eye.

It's heaven.  A not-too-sweet cream-cheese filling inside a square-ish croissant bun with a light dusting of sugar.  Oh my, was it GOOD!  My intention was just to have a few bites but before I knew it I was licking the sugar off my fingers which was the only evidence left of the LOVE BUN.

4 stars for the LOVE BUN.  Did I mention that I love the name too?  I just like saying it.  I love my LOVE BUNS:)  Gots to have me some LOVE BUNS, LOVE BUNS, LOVE BUNS.

(I know, I know.  I have to try the cupcakes.)
author: michelle s.

description:
OMG! I love this place!

I have to say, that, for the most part, I've only really had the pie here... That is because I love pie, and GOOD GOD THESE PEOPLE MAKE THE BEST PIE EVER!!!

I remember one time I was picking up a delicious apple pie and the person behind the counter asked if it was for a special occasion.  I laughed and said "Yes!  Because I NEED PIE!"

Okay, after seeing the rest of the reviews I'm going to start trying everything they've got in those cases (swimsuit be damned!)  But, really, it will be hard to walk into this place and not come out with a delicious-flaky-crusted-mouthwatering-sweet-fruit-filled-straight-from-heaven-goodness that is their pie.
author: Lisa W.

description:
The chocolate mousse cake is my favorite. The chocolate ganache exterior is smooth, chocolatey, with just the right amount of chocolate richness. The chocolate sponge is moist and the chocolate mousse is just perfect; a little bite of heaven each time.

The Lemon Drop Cupcake (w/the Bumble Bee) has the most delicious lemon custard and yummy frosting.  Don't pass up the Chocolate-Caramel-Fleur del Sel, it has a perfect balance of flavors (yes, salt).  At $2.75 and up, these cupcakes are less expensive then some other Bay Area bakeries but why do all these darn cupcakes have to look so cute and cost so much?  But to save $$$ I'll pass on the Red Velvet cupcake, Noe Valley Bakery needs to work on the flavor and texture of it.  

I love the baked goods, from the cupcakes to the challah, at Noe Valley Bakery but I just wish the service could be friendlier.  I appreciate the quality of the food and I guess the price goes with the territory but a smile from the staff would be nice. It seems the counter people get grumpier and grumpier each time. I guess they think this fat girl doesn't need to eat anymore cupcakes. :P
author: just d.

description:
A Morning ritual, an elite treat, a cult catastrophe addiction may occur!

The staff is just as good of a reason to go as the food. Friendly and hipster-eqsue. The morning scones and just-right coffee can kick start anyone's day with a smile and the fresh baguettes seedy or sweet will turn any dinner into a treat! :)

In addition to the staff and good baked good you get the community atmosphere bonus. Always bustling with little kids, moms, busy businessmen, and the occasional straggler (like me!) It's a staple of the block. You leave with your long baguette, perhaps if you're a mom you're on track to see jane run or headed to the farmer's market. People there start to know you by name and it's just fun.
author: Christopher S.

description:
I love several things about this bakery:

1. Flaxseed cherry muffins
2. Pumpkin muffins
3. Fig Bread

Ok, so basically I love their muffins and breads and feel so-so about their cupcakes. The muffins are delicious, moist, and quite possibly the best...ever. The flaxseed cherry muffins are by far my favorite - they are not overly sweet and the cherries provide a great tart/sweet balance to the rest of the muffin. The pumpkin muffins have great flavor and the spices are perfect, too bad it is seasonal! The fig bread is so SO good. There are tons of figs interspersed throughout the bread and it is a great breakfast or snack. I really cannot say enough good things.
author: Abigail R.

description:
I love these guys.  I don't know what they hell they did to the pumpkin pie this year but holy moses.....unbelievably delicious.  Great pies and cakes and the cupcakes, which everyone knows.  If you are looking for a special treat try the raspberry croissant.  I take them to meetings and I find them to be a wonderful ice breaker/bargaining chip. 
Enjoy
author: Lennlee K.

description: I love all their cupcakes. Cheaper than Kara's Cupcakes, same size, but more flavor. Would recommend this place over others for cupcake cravings!
author: Timothy L.

description:
Red velvet anything here is a favorite. No matter how sweet a dessert, it's always light and fluffy in texture. Do not expect the gelatinous messes that tend to be cake fillings -- the mousse and whipped cream options for cake fillings are yummy.

Mini-cakes, tarts and cupcakes have always been a family favorite, but full-size cakes are lovely for sharing. Did not realize they expanded their website to educate you on the products and help plan cake options. Make sure to head by first thing for croissants and your various bread needs.

Lunch is always fun as well especially on sunny, lazy days or people-watching rainy days...but just leave room for dessert.
author: Tanya P.

description:
All local bakeries rock and the Noe Valley Bakery is following suite. Everyone in there is helpful and super friendly.  The cup cakes are delicious!  Every week our house hold gets a loaf of their pound cake and it is gone in three days.  

I love the shirts that they wear in the store.  "Shut your Pie Hole"  Love it.... I ask them all the time if they are for sale and the answer is no!  They will break at some point.  :)
author: Ryan B.

description:
I hate to be the cupcake snob but if you had the cupcakes I've had your standards would be a bit higher.  Case in point - the cakes alone are almost always a winner in and of themselves.  If you can't make a decent cake you are already out of the game.  But it's the frosting that is the tipping point, the make it or break it point, that will either put you in cupcake history or mediocrity.  Here, I hate to say it but either the frosting on some were an acquired taste or else just too thick and sweet.  Their most-ess cake was interesting and probably okay at best.  Their velvet cupcake had this sweet frosting that almost made me want to scrape off.  And a couple of others were just not memorable. 

It's too bad.  I just want all cupcakes to be enjoyable.  Inequality sucks.
author: Lorraine D.

description:
In one word: consistent.

The cheddar cheese and chive scone is rockin. The cheese croissant also kicks ass. I really like the morning bun, and the carrot cake cupcake it fingerlickin' good. They do have red velvet ones, but I don't understand what all the fuss is about because all it is is white cake DYED red! Anyone could make them, but they make some of the best cream cheese frosting around.
author: Stephanie P.

description: I don't come here often, but I'm always glad when I do!  Their cupcakes are my favorite.  I ordered them to serve at one of my birthday parties - even rented their display stands since I had ordered so many - and they were so DEE-licious!  Chocolate-caramel-fleur de sel cupcake.  Need I say more?
author: Vicente G.

description: Granted, it's a limited review, but if the butter croissants are any indication (and like an Italian restaurant, if the bread is good, that's always a good sign), and the amazing mocha I just had, this is definitely a neighborhood gem.
author: Jacques P.

description:
Too many tasty options!!

My favorite is the Organic Fig Bread.  Toast it in the morning and it tastes like a super-fresh Fig Newton!  I also loved the cinnamon coffee cake, but felt a bit gluttenous eating it.  And if you're having a party, getting a variety of cupcakes is a total hit.

You also have to love that they have a little metal hook by the door for "puppy parking."
author: Kimberly G.

description:
Such a disappointment Noe Valley Bakery has turned out to be.  I used to be a regular customer at this bakery and have frequently made large purchases of cupcakes as well just the occassional treat.   Last week I decided to spend the extra cash, go all out and get a fancy birthday cake for my son's 9th birthday.  Now, keep in mind that 9 year olds don't care where the cake is from and will be perfectly happy with a cake from Safeway....which is where I should have purchased the cake from the beginning. 

It started with the order....I called NVB and placed an order for a 1/4 sheet cake, chocolate chiffon cake with chocolate fudge filling and frosting.  I also picked their stock transfer/decoration of a racecar.   The girl taking my order informed me that I could not choose this combo and had to pick chocolate buttercream filling and frosting, otherwise the racecar wouldn't come out.   Well I really dislike chocolate buttercream so I told her to forget about the decoration....let's just go for the flavor that I wanted, and I'd throw decorations on myself.   Although she was trying to be helpful, she said to wait and she would talk to the decorator to see if she could make it happen the way I wanted it.   They called me back later in the day and said that they could do it afterall!  I was happy.

Until my husband picked up the cake 2 hours before the party.  It was a sheet cake alright.  And it had a racecar on it alright.  And sadly....it was about 10 pounds of chocolate buttercream!  No Way.  Five days advance notice, $60 dollars later, 3 back and forth phone calls and I GET THE WRONG FLAVOR CAKE???  With all that buttercream the cake tasted like a big slice of frosting.  I am not kidding, no child at the party finished their cake let alone went back for seconds and the remainder of my $60 birthday cake was left at Malibu Grand Prix.  WHAT A WASTE.

I am so annoyed at this.  I called the bakery to try and complain but the manager's were too busy to take the call.  I then emailed as they told me to do, but no response as of yet.  I was completely flexible throughout the order process and was willing to have a bare cake with no decorating even, just so long as it was the flavor we wanted.  I regret going here and will never order a cake or cupcakes again from NVB.

EDIT:  I did finally receive an email back from the owner and she was very nice, even offered me a full refund or a new cake.  That being said, I will change my rating.  I still love their cupcakes and appreciated the acknowledgment.
author: Nicole T.

description:
I love the smell of bread baking and lets be honest the last time I baked bread I lived with my parents, i was not of a legal age and they had just gotten one for christmas( i think they still have it hidden in a basement somewhere)...that said i love walking by here.  Often in the morning i can smell the bread and goodies if i am waiting for the bus.

In addition to the bread- their baked goods are good and they always have a seasonal display in the window to entertain me while i'm walking.
author: Maria F.

description: It's a cute little place though I wasn't thrilled with the selection. We tried the cupcake like a Hostess cupcake and it was delicious :)
author: Kai and Lauren P.

description:
parking is tough

this could be ranked higher.  i just don't LOVE it.  I like it a lot but i just don't know what it is.

i guess i could get bread like this anywhere but its just close on the right price.  sometimes something feels a bit too high.  usually just one thing is the RIGHT price here.

i like their foccacia and their breads.  

didn't love the cookies or the pastries.  don't like the cupcakes because the frosting tastes like the ones out of a supermarket to thick and rich its just pure sugar.  also the cake is a little hard, not moist like i'd like it to be.

it just seemed okay but this place is more than adequate for trying to find something you like.
author: Bing D.

description:
Yes, I live in Noe Valley. Yes, I'm white. Yes, I'm (sometimes/sorta) blonde. No, I do not push a stroller filled with kids. 

Someday however , thanks to the Noe Valley Bakery, somebody may need to push me around in a stroller because I won't be able to heft my fat ass down there anymore if they keep being fine purveyors of deliciousness. Mostest Cupcake indeed. Don't mind if I do.
author: Leah S.

description:
"Holy shit."

Such were the words out of my mouth after stopping in to escape the suddenly windy, chilly weather this afternoon. The cause? My Noe Valley Bakery & Bread Co. hot cross bun. Chewy, not overly sugary, raisins like little explosions of AWESOME. I washed it down with some of the best black coffee that's ever passed my lips.

And then I almost got run over by some ho in a Civic who insincerely screamed "sorry!" afterwards, which pissed me off more than if she'd just driven off. People suck.

But you know what doesn't suck? Noe Valley Bakery & Bread Co.
author: Alyssa R.

description:
Good: Cherry-chocolate rugelach, asiago bread and that baguette with seeds on the outside and carmelized onions on the inside mmm...

Bad: Tad expensive (like the rest of Noe Valley), sometimes there's quite a long and disorganized line (like on every Sat. morning), and the service is hit-or-miss.

Still it's a nice third stop to my farmers market-cheese shop-bakery stroll.
author: Melinda G.

description:
I want my 5 bucks back.

Red Velvet Cupcake - dry and tasted like it came from a box.  The frosting wasn't even good either and that's supposed to be the best part.  Definitely does not compare to Sprinkles Red Velvet....too bad because I would love to find a non-chain alternative .

Eclair - tasted old and the cream was kinda grainy.

We didn't finish either item...and it's a sin to not finish dessert.

Overall, this place is not worth the calories....sorry.
author: Neety P.

description:
I don't know really how to broach this, so I'll just come out and say it.  While I found the red velvet cupcakes enjoyable, I must object to the dye they are using.  Not so digestable.  I was pretty sure I had colon cancer until I traced it back to my birthday cupcakes.

(happy birthday to me)
author: Big Stu L.

description:
I only had the Red Velvet cupcake and Lady's Kisses, and both disappointed.  The frosting on the red velvet tasted like I was downing cheesecake, and the entire cupcake was cold, which I have never experienced in all my cupcaking adventures.  The cake was moist, but there was something a little off with the flavor too.  

The lady's kisses - it looks like a macaron so I thought it was be like a macaron, but it's not at all.  It's not soft and chewy ... it's crispy and crumbles.  Tasty, but not what I was expecting.
author: Melinda C.

description:
Always on the lookout for a tasty bakery, this is the one!

The bakery (and all the other stores on 24th btwn Church and Castro) are quintessential Noe Valley - cute, quaint, family oriented, clean-cut, and friendly.

I only have good things to say about the staff, the service, and the baked goods.  The sandwiches are great, too!!

It's a little pricey, but definitely worth it.
author: Jen T.

description:
this is amazing in every way but one. First the good:

1. super friendly

2. cool people

3. good prices

4. tasty foods 

Only complaint? not much on the vegan options. Sigh--
author: Vasile S.

description: Walnut bread is better than Acme. Muffins rock (is it pumkin season yet???), but can't believe they dumped the banana-nut chocolate. Nutty!
author: Cynthia G.

description:
Sweet Jesus - I am coming home.

This place is indescribably good.

But I will describe anyways.

When I am doing laundry, I love to start the washers then walk on down to this place to get me some sweets (makes up for having to do laundry).  They have this fruity tart thingy that practically makes me cry.  I drool over their pretty cupcakes...man, everything is perfect here.  I also bask in the glow of the Mexican Wedding Cookies (my fave).  I could pretty much go on for days about this place.  Go.there.NOW - I am!
author: Charlene E.

description:
I was on my way back from a dental appt yesterday and realized I was
close to Noe Valley and needed some bread for a casual dinner. I had
invited my friend over for some rustic homemade soup that called for some crusty bread. I was in a rush to get back to work so I  decided that if
there was a parking spot close by I would stop in. Low and behold the parking god found me a space right smack dab in front. Asiago cheese
bread still hot from the oven, pumpkin bread with cream cheese frosting for dessert and a buttery croissant for me since I'd skipped breakfast to get to the dentist. Smelling that warm asiago cheese bread in the car drove me to madness but I remained in control and didn't rip into the loaf. With the quality and tastiness of what I purchased and the parking spot right in front, the full 5 stars.
author: Cindy J.

description: I love the bakery.  Not a big fan of cupcake.  They make wonderful bread.  I recommend the Apricot bread.  I have had cakes made for special birthday at the office.  Only one mistake but the spelling on the name.  But we know laugh about it.  If you want a nice bread or dessert for dinner.  Check out Noe Valley Bakery
author: Fernando C.

description: The cupcakes here are YUMMY and definitely worth the little extra calories ;).  A week after we tried those yum cupcakes, the craving came back and we bought a full-on white cake that was mmm mmm good.  Noe Valley Bakery knows what they're doing and you won't be disappointed.
author: Angella S.

description:
I love this bakery. They are a block away from my house and have so many delicious baked goods. I stick to the front case with the sticky buns and the croissants which are always amazing. The Pecan Sticky Bun is everything I want from a sticky bun. It is cinnimony, gooey with lots of pecans. The gooey sauce is my favorite part. I've tried their cupcakes before but they've never been my cup of tea. I like a softer frosting but theirs seems really hard and sugary. 
The staff that works here is great too. I'm a neighborhood person and I love to get to know people who work in the neighborhood and they've always been super nice and if they aren't busy we can chat it up about whatever. I could make coffee at home but I really like getting my coffee from there. They're a part of my ritual.
author: Jennifer B.

description:
My wife and I bought a couple of things from them at their stand at a Ferry Building on Saturday morning.

My wife got their blueberry pecan scone. Pretty good, not as sconey (think dry) but because of the pecans was richer. 

I got the stud muffin (chocolate with cream cheese). We saved it for that night. 

WOW. I want to set the record straight on the stud muffin. The thing is fantastic. The chocolate flavor is so rich, just a wonderful taste. The chocolate chips are sparse and they compliment the overall effect just perfectly. 

I saw the other review that said there was a coffee taste in their stud muffin. Not even a hint of coffee in mine. I look forward to enjoying it again at the Ferry Building!
author: Tom M.

description: The birthday cake they made for me was fabulous: three tiers of white chiffon cake, chocolate whipped cream between the layers, and chocolate ganache icing. Delicious!
author: David K.

description:
I gotta say it's hard to find a good bakery.  Really, it's like finding a really good Chinese food place or that great cup of coffee.  You eat a lot of crap before you find something you like.

I wish I loved closer to this place because I think I'd stop on by a hell of a lot more than I currently do (2 times a year maybe).  

I stopped at this place when I'd take the 48 to and from work.  I was in total awe when I'd be picking up some stuff in the neighborhood after work and see their cakes in the window.  Talk about works of art!  And they look sooooooo yummy!  

Their little sweets are tasty, like the cupcakes, cookies and other goodies.  I have YET to try one of their cakes and I'd totally love to try one.  Anyone want to buy my birthday cake?  It's next month!!!  I'd love you forever!!

Too bad they don't sell the cakes by the slice, that would be totally awesome.

I gotta stop on by soon.  It's been way too long since I've had a tasty, sweet!
author: imelda j.

description:
I've been obsessed with their challah for years.  I've gone to Noe Valley Bakery, on 24th Street or at the Ferry Plaza, since they opened.  I love, love, love their breads, especially their challah and the chocolate cherry bread.

But the challah, I think it's the best I've ever had.  I've been on a quest to make challah that's even a smidge close to theirs, but I haven't been successful yet.  I doubt I ever will, I'm not a good baker. 

I dream of their challah.  It's a good excuse to drive into the city.  Really.
author: Melinna G.

description: After a desperate search on yelp for cupcakeries near me I sent my boyfriend to NV Bakery. I was craving a cupcake like it was some crack. Outer Sunset really needs a cupcake place. Anyhow, he came home with 6 different cupcakes. I wasn't too impressed. The cake was good but most of the frostings were too hard. It made you not even want to eat the cupcake because you had to bite through this rock hard layer of " frosting ". The only cupcake I really enjoyed was the one with ganache. Can't really go wrong with ganache. Can't speak for the other treats there. Probably won't come back due to the frosting.
author: Lauren N.

description: Okay we have some serious and delicious cupcakes going on here. They are definitely worth every single penny!!! I especially love  the dark chocolate ones with the salt on-top. Heavenly!!!! However, I have to say that what I like even better than the cupcakes are their sheet cakes. We have ordered several of them for celebrations and everyone just raved about how amazingly delicious they were. I always prayed we would have cake leftover from the party so that I could relish it the next day.  The cakes are also so beautiful to look at with lots of styles to choose from.
author: Lia P.

description:
I came on Yelp last night looking for scones and after all the reviews, it seemed that NVB&BC seemed the best. As actually no one really reviewed scones on any of the restaurants that popped up in the reviews.

So today is my friend's birthday and I wanted to get her scones for breakfast. Drove into the city and found NVB&BC empty. As I was looking through the cases though, people came in ordered and left. I opted for 2 blueberry pecan scones and 1 currant orange scone. I started to walk out and I spotted the Most-est cupcakes and I couldn't leave without getting 2, one for me and one for the mister.

Brought the scones to my friend and she shared them with me. YUM. I loved them both. moist and very falvorful.

Of course when I got home I had to sample the cupcake. The chocolate ganache frosting and cream in the middle were delish. The cupcake was dry but the frosting and filling totally made up for it. The mister didn't eat his, and he might not be able to as I think I might have to steal it.

I'll definitely go back and try something else... like the carrot muffin.
author: Dina V.

description:
A must stop for those compulsive shopping excursions on 24th Street.  Need a pick-me-up?  Try the carrot cupcake or one of the many varieties of ruggalah.  

While I can only speak for the sweet (not savory) options here, I've heard their croissants and breads are insanely fresh and yummy.  They've always got something tasty waiting to be devoured by hungry shoppers.  While I am tempted to give them 5 stars, that would mean putting their baked goods on the same level as Delessio.  Just can't do it!
author: Abby W.

description:
The cupcakes were great, but the cake itself was not moist enough.  I love the flavors though.  The lemon drop was refreshing and light, but still sweet.  The chocolate ones were also great.  
But when you get to the bottom, it's a bit dry.  Nice place to try, but it' still missing something.
author: AhLin C.

description:
I WANT to give it that extra one star but the service there caused the deduction! The girl "killed" my cupcake and caused the rest of them to suffer some irreparable damage.  Okay... before you all call me an anal retentive witch.... here's what happened:

I wanted to get some of their AMAZING cupcakes.  There were only TWO Most-est cupcakes left (GOT IT!!!)... and there were 6 of the CUTEST lemon cupcakes with the little piped on bee on top (yeah.. you know which one!!!). She went to get them... and PLOP!!! one of them took a nosedive into the front of the cases.... smearing the bee and the icing all over the front of the display case.  She looks at me and goes.... "so... you want that one too????" Ummm... NOOOoooo!!!! Not only did you "kill" one of the most adorable bees around...  you ask me if I want a SMEARED cupcake?  (granted... if i was not getting this for a party... the glutton in me might have thought twice!). 

Anyway..... she puts the rest of my selections in a box that is just a little  shy of the top of the cupcake!!! OMG!!! the BEEs!!!! (huh!  starting to realize I might have problems!).  

To make an already long story short - definitely go there for the cupcakes!  Cheaper than most places (they are in the $2-and change range versus the $3 and change range). Most-est Cupcake is KILLER! The lemon (and yes... with the adorable bee) is sooooo tasty.  Their other pastries and bread!  Yum yum yum yum yum! 

Going to seek some psychiatric help for me obsessive Bee issues now.
author: H. Q.

description:
Awesome bakery! I decided to try to place out after sampling cake from here. The cake, of course, was fantastic.

For weekend strolls, I like to pick up their cheese croissants. Great treat with coffee.
author: Barney M.

description: A bump up after my cake review. Someone brought some cookies and cupcakes. I went Lady Gaga over this stuff.
author: Michael H.

description: Omg...I woke up dreaming about their lemon tarts and Noe-os and may have gone here three times in one week.  Their morning buns and love buns (imagine a hollow morning bun with some pastry cream filling).  If you're in the area and are hesitant on committing to an order of a half dozen of their cupcakes (which I find yummy, but nothing I couldn't get better elsewhere), I would recommend getting a couple of Noe-os to munch on.   The real gems here are their non-cupcake pastries!!!  I'll be definitely coming back for more Noe-os tomorrow...
author: Ben T.

description:
at first, i thought perhaps we were a little more naughty than nice this year when we did NOT receive a batch of "auntie's" (bijan's) heavenly almond cookies for xmas.  i was resigned to satisfying my sweet tooth with the usual box of see's chocolates.

but then we received a loaf of noe valley bakery's pumpkin bread from hubby's cousin.

we must have been angels this year!

THE most incredible pumpkin bread ever.  so dense and moist, packed with a blend of spices and topped with the creamiest but not sickeningly sweet creamy frosting.  it perfectly captures the holiday spirit and at the same time is a nice break from the toothaching, sugary sweets.  and pumpkin is healthy, no?

definitely adding this to my "to-visit-soon" list!
author: Jen P.

description: I like this place! They are attentive and have a great deal of choice for cupcakes and pastries. I haven't tried their bread though. The cupcakes are good but they are GREAT if you order some for a party. They are really fresh that way. I have the red velvet...hmmm. Otherwise stick to the moistest cupcake, cause it's always moist. Good coffee too. This place is a little over priced but it you consider the area, it's probably ok. I love local places like this too!
author: Ange D.

description: Almost anything you can get here is to die for. Their hot chocolate, and asiago cheese bread are my favorites. I get a whole loaf of their cheese bread almost every time I go there. I bought a flourless pomegranate chocolate cake that was simply amazing. Highly recommend!
author: Mimi B.

description:
I love this place.  I started with the cheddar & chive scone, moved on to the olive bread (praise jeebus), was born unto the Noe Valley Bakery and have since sampled many breads and two kinds of cakes.  Highly recommended.

Edit (December '06): They've since discontinued olive bread. :(
author: Susan L.

description:
5 stars for the MOST-EST CUPCAKE!!!! think  hostess chocolate cupcakes!!!  BUT EVEN BETTER!!!!!   chocolate cupcake with light bavarian cream & chocolate ganache smooth frosting with the white squiggly line across!!!!  price not bad..........just $1.95.............. nice nostalgic feeling without the sugar rush & heaviness of that hostess cream.  

didn't get to try their other goodies............. other than their white cupcake with white frosting, which SUCKED!!!!!   the cake was dry reminded me of dry chinese white cake & the frosting just tasted like gooo -- taste & texture didn't blend at all -- what was that all about????

still like kara's more, but i do prefer their most-est cupcakes over belgano's.
author: Cindi N.

description:
What I get at the bakery:

1. Cinnamon twist (Perfect combination of fluffy croissant and cinnamon-sugar that is not to sweet and goes well with some tea).

2. Cookies (Recently had their Halloween cookies-cat face & ghost. Again I like these because they are the right amount of sweetness, like me)

3. Banana chocolate chip muffin (tasty)

4. Hot cross buns (yum)

5. Apple wrap...half an apple sliced and wrapped in a croissant. (Freaking fantastic!)
author: Romeo And Lola K.

description:
My sister and I have been searching the city for red velvet cupcakes and luckily, we stumbled upon this place. Their cupcakes are amazing and this is now our go-to place for cupcakes and other pastries. First off, the red velvet cupcakes here are sooooo good. They are super moist and just the right amount of sweetness. The frosting is also perfect, not too sweet and not too plain. The other cupcakes they offer are also really good! The hostess-looking cupcake is really delicious, especially with the cream-filling. The lemon-drop cupcake has a nice zing to it. And the carrot cupcake is perfect, just like the red velvet cupcake! delish! Also my sister gets the personal-size cheesecakes from here and it looked and tasted amazing!

I really like the location of this bakery. A lot of restaurants and clothing stores in the neighborhood. There is also a lot of metered parking so it shouldn't be too tough to find parking.
author: Christiana R.

description:
My daily breakfast bakery.
I wasn't a big fan until recently as I used go to Boulangerie and stock up some of their pastries on a weekly basis, but it changed after I tried their blueberry pecan scone.  It's not sconey - not as dry yet crunchy, and the edges taste fantastic.

Four items I love at this bakery:
Blueberry Pecan Scone
Brioche
Current Orange Scone
Banana Nut Chocolate Chip Muffin

My friends order their cakes for their b-days and weddings, and those were pretty fantastic as well.

Recommended.
author: Yoko S.

description: Gave them 3 stars because their cupcakes were delicious. I bought the carrot, mostest chocolate, chocolate-caramel, and red velvet. I'd have to say the carrot cupcake was the best one out of all. I also went their to order a cake. Didn't want to order the 2 tier cake for $160 but I loved the little butterflies and flowers designed on it so I asked the lady there if I can order an 8 inch round cake with the same designs as the 2 tier cake. She tried asking the owner of the store but he was much too in a rush to leave and told me to fill out a special request cake order form. I did that and was told I would receive an email from the owner today. I waited and waited still no email until 2 pm. I already found a different bakery (Sweet Art by Jennifer). She's willing to take my order over the phone immediately and I ended up ordering a 2 tier cake for $65.....wayyyyyy cheaper than Noe Valley Bakery
author: Dora P.

description: As you walk down 24th street to catch Muni or BART or one of the commuter caravans, you are suddenly hit by a wave of freshly baked bread emanating from a little place called Noe Valley Bakery... The breads are made every morning.  I usually get the sweet baguette, sour baguette, or walnut bread.  The pastries are also really good, except don't go in there on an empty stomach - that means a severely shrunken wallet.
author: B Y.

description:
I am so glad this place is far enough away that I only indulge once in awhile. I like to get their Apricot Ginger and Cinammon Challah breads, not to mention the Brioche which is almost impossible to find in most bakeries. They also have these tiny litle fruit tarts that you can simply pop whole into your mouth....buy several. The scones are nice and moist, not dry like some that I've had. Can you tell that I have not had a disappointing thing here?
update: scored the last Red Velvet and tried the Fleur de Sel lemon cupcake, that at first taste seemed like a simple white cake with frosting, but took a whole other turn when I got to the lemony surprise in the center. The guy behind the counter seemed really annoyed if you didn't know what you wanted before you even got to the counter.  Yes, you read right. Minus one star.
author: Arlene C.

description:
This place gets me happy.

It's your cute neighborhood bakery on the ground floor of a victorian on a pretty tree-lined street. Doesn't feel like you're in SF until the yuppie moms and dads with bugaboo strollers descend on the place and jostle their way in front of you, entitled.  Maybe that's why the wait staff is so curt. That said, the place overflows with just-baked goods and breads. Delicious pumpkin bread w/ cream cheese frosting and their scones are PERFECT (sorry Tartine, Arizmendi).
author: BroSauce J.

description:
We wanted to have a few different flavors at our wedding, so we decided cupcakes were the best (and most frugal) way to do that.  We sampled cupcakes at plenty of places recommended here on Yelp, but Noe Valley was the best by far.  We ended up choosing three varieties: red velvet, The Mostest, and the Zingers. We also had a homemade cake cake.

Now, whenever we want a pick-me-up, we stop by for a cupcake or two.  They really are the best in San Francisco.
author: Bill J.

description:
Why did I chance upon this place, just as my Cal Poly decathlete son is about to graduate and return home to nag me about diet and exercise!  I had never heard about Noe Valley Bakery - I was, in fact, on my way home from an appointment, driving slowly down 24th Street, when I simultaneously spotted their sign and the empty parking space in front of the store.  It was fate and I am not one to circumvent fate.

Forty dollars and thirty minutes later, I walked out of Noe Valley Bakery, armed with numerous bags, vowing that I must return for several items I just couldn't justify purchasing in the same visit.

That afternoon, I shared my treasures at a staff meeting.  What ecstasy!  Everything was wonderful from the Mexican wedding cookies to the apricot hammentashen, to my personal favorite, the chocolate and cherry rugelach.  En route to work, I ate a pecan sticky bun that almost made me turn around for more (  no will power, as you can see ).  

There were so many incredible choices, I had difficulty making a decision - the fruit tarts looked fabulous but I figured they would be a total mess by the time I arrived at my destination but I won't rule them out for a future visits...then there are the scones...oh, and wonderful cakes...good grief, I'm 63, how much more can I eat, especially with Jeremy coming home from college to nag me about my weight!!!
author: Carmen H.

description:
So I'm totally addicted to the Bluberry Scones at NVB&BC.  They are amazing.  The fact that they sell the bake at home dough should be a clue for all shoppers.

The subtle hint of pecan is very appealing as is the combination between an appropriately moist inside and perfectly crunched outside. I can't believe I'm addicted to a scone.  They are usually dry and well... boring.  This scone is anything but and when I did a "taste-off" compared to the Tartine scone, hands down the NVB&BC one rocks!
author: Elizabeth M.

description:
Everything I've ever had here has been so delicious.  I especially liked the red velvet cupcake I had.  Nothing is dry or too moist.  Their counter people are very nice, attentive and helpful.  

My one gripe came just recently, when I ordered a birthday cake.  First of all I tried to email them, asking if I could provide my order via email.  This was a few days before my desired date.  No response.  So I figured to go in to make sure I can order and get it by that Saturday.  I went over my choices w/ my sales lady, and requested the "Parisian" trim, which costs an extra $4.  The day comes to pick it up; a Saturday, and mid-day Saturday on 24th Street is not always easy so I had my niece pick up the cake while I went around the block.  She said it looked good and we went on our merry way.   

I get the cake home and only later to find the my Parisian trim wasn't done!  The cake, filling & frosting were fine.   I was pretty disappointed because the trim that was on there was (1) something that even I could've done and (2) wasn't even offered!  What happened?  Did the decorator do mine last and got lazy?  I later wrote an email about this to the email address provided on their website.  Only today, three and a half weeks later, did I even get any kind of response.

I'd advise not to get the chocolate fudge frosting w/ the chiffon cake.  It was a bit too heavy to be on top of the cake.  It would be better off as a filling instead.  It was really good, like mouth-smacking because it was nice and thick!

Don't ever try to email them about anything that has a time constraint. If they can't even respond to an email on time then they shouldn't provide it!  Also as a baker, details matter.  As minor a detail as what I wanted was, it still wasn't done and that is disappointing.

So despite the snafu, everything is a hit, from bread to cookies to cakes and tarts.
author: Benita E.

description: I drive across town to pick up their blueberry pecan scones.  And you can get them in frozen dough form and bake them at home.  I have tried thier other pastries as well and have never been disappointed.
author: Kim M.

description:
Given a fact that I manage a restaurant down the street from here but still swing buy to grab a delicious chicken sandwich and a cookie means this place is good. It's usually hard to justify spending money on food when all the free food you could want is in the same building, but this place is never hard to justify.

So far I've had the Chicken Breast sandwich and the Italian Stallion - both are great. I'm going to try to branch out more but that chicken sandwich keeps calling me with it's soft, fresh baked bread and it's moist chicken. Make sure to grab an M&M cookie with it.
author: James N.

description: For the past two years, I've had some Noe Valley Bakery and Bread Company delivered as holidays gifts from a vendor and their cookies are so good, delicious and moist. I've also had their cupcakes. My ultimate favorite is their lemon cupcake! If ever in Noe Valley, must drop by! ;o)
author: Mika D.

description:
they got 'em. 
i eat 'em. 
im referring to their fruit tarts. 
they are sooooooo gooooood.
wouldn't go anywhere else for a fruit tart. 
i walk all the way from my house just to get 'em. 
and all the way back ;)
author: Brenda S.

description:
The scones here are amazing. Any of them. The other pastries are pretty good (boyfriend gets the choc croissant or apple turnover a lot). The cupcakes.. um.. not so good. I am a huge cupcake fan, but I hate their icing. Too bad too.

Coffee, you are better off going somewhere else, in my opinion. But if you run in for bread or scones... a coffee is easy to grab.
author: Erin A.

description: I have never been disappointed in the treats offered at this delightful neighborhood bakery. Their chocolate croissants and butter croissants are as good as the ones you find at good bakeries in France. I also really enjoy their hamateschen cookies and their raisin & pecan rugelach. As for my highly discriminating teenage daughter, she tells me that their mostest cupcakes and love buns are simply the best!
author: Belinda J.

description:
I like the coffee here much more than Starbucks which is a block away.  This is on my walk to work.
The service used to be better.  The morning buns are delicious.

My gripe - the fat, bald douche bag that works there.  He's high & mighty and is a complete piece of shit.  He rarely serves people but, when he does he acts like everyone is beneath him.

My only real gripe.
author: Meghan B.

description:
Screw Atkins. Cherry chocolate bread for breakfast (try it toasted with cream or goat cheese on it) and fig bread (with just about anything) at lunch and dinner.

Yuuummmmmmm!
author: Karin S.

description:
Love their little cuppy-cakes.  And the price isn't too shabby, either.  My favorites are the red velvet and caramel fleur de sel.  So good.  The perfect little snack for strolling on a sunny day-- delightful.  The cupcakes are moist, and could maybe do with a bit more icing.  But I'm an icing fiend, so that may explain it.

Overall, a cute little bakery.  There's no place to sit, which is kind of a bummer.  But everything I've had here is great-- and not just the cupcakes.  The Swiss cheese croissant is very tasty and I've bought baguette and sliced loaves here before, which were also nice.  You can tell everything is very fresh.

They lose a star, however, for running out of cupcakes one Sunday when my friends and I made a special trip here for the express purpose of cupcake procurement.  It was only 2pm, and no cupcakes?  I was devastated.

But I will be back.  And I will have my cupcakes.
author: Christy T.

description:
My downfall was the Asiago Cheese Bread.  One sniff, one taste of the nutty cheesy goodness, I knew my life would never be the same.  Hopeless, addicted, I could furtively eat an entire loaf over the course of an evening.  Who the hell needed popcorn as a snack?  Thank God NVB does not come to the Tuesday Farmer's Market at the Ferry Bldg. any longer, I've lost 20 pounds!  Then, I made the fatal error in judgement,  I went to NVB on 24th Street...... for the damned delicious asiago cheese bread, the apricot ginger bread, the double raisin bread, the brioche (if you get there early enough) and the scones.  All yummers.  The cookies!  yes, yesy, yes, the cookies!  Baguettes, very tasty and the breadsticks, like popcorn!

I think I am in a minority, however, their cupcakes did nothing for me.  I like frosting, but the thick coating on top was heavy and ordinary in flavor.  The cupcakes were dry and the one's I tried with fillings, the fillings were sort of gummy and tasteless.  Dissapointing.  That said, I will not subtract a star for the cupcakes, they are not what NVB is known for.

Service is hit and miss.  Sometimes you get wonderful service, other times, your server is doing you a huge favor to bag the bread and take your money.  Be warned, surly behavior is not smiled upon, but the bread here is worth it.
author: Donna H.

description:
I came here with 2 friends to pick up a dozen cupcakes for a friend's party. A shout-out goes to Joanne for the recommendation of this bakery. The cupcakes here were delicious. We got there towards the end of the day right at closing and they had some cupcakes left. The display case was broken so they had to grab the cupcakes from the back. We ended up getting an assortment of cupcakes including the "most-tess" chocolate, red velvet with cream cheese frosting, and the Boston cream pie. I am a fan of the red velvet which went well with the cream cheese. The "most-tess" reminds me of my childhood days with the hostess cupcakes. 

This place was busy with people lining up to buy baked goods right before closing. They had all the cookies and cute pastries in another display case with a refrigerator full of buckets of frozen cookie dough. I was disappointed that I was not able to see what their cakes look like. I will be returning for another round of cupcakes. The prices for cupcakes range from $2.50-$3.
author: Candace F.

description:
three words: nom nom nom!!

everything here is soo good, from the breads to the cupcakes and pastries! the first time i came, the service was great. They were closing early for labor day but let a good 25 people in after they closed to buy their delicious treats! 

if you are in Noe Valley, probably one of the best places to be in San Francisco, stop by and get somee goods!
author: Paulo S.

description: I actually bought a bag of Circus Animal Cookies somewhere outside of Las Vegas for $4.99. They were amazing - better than these because you can't beat Red Dye #5 and Rainbow Sprinkles injected with Chemicals at the Mother's Factory. Thanks MOM!
author: Katherine B.

description: I had to try their cupcakes and I was impressed with the price, environment and looks of the bakery. The taste is good and healthy. I am a happy customer.
author: C G.

description: I really like all their baked goods. Everything is baked fresh and its all very tasty. I am really disappointed at La Boullange down the street where overly expensive goods taste so bland and are cold (like they were based yesturday). Even though this is a longer walk for me, I prefer a REAL bakery with REAL baked goods.
author: Beach L.

description: Though I have to say I haven't found all the people working here to be exactly friendly, I do love their cakes and their great selection of cupcakes. I also love that they have classic bakery items, so when you need a chocolate cake, you've got a chocolate cake!
author: Sara W.

description:
So, went there one morning to grab some morning pastries before heading to a friend's house. Btw, very delicious pastries. The girl helping me, Terry, asked what I wanted and pulled out a white lunch bag. I informed her that I will be purchasing a bunch of items, so If I may have them put in a box. You'd think I asked for her kidney. Didn't know that asking to have 5 pastries put into a box and not crammed into a lunch bag was such an ordeal. Wanted to ask her if it was the early morning that had her in such a dump, or the fact that it took her and extra arm movement to put the bag down and grab the box for my purchases. 
So, the lack of more stars is due to the service, which on more than one occasion has been lackluster.
author: S. F.

description:
Wifey's Review:

My friend tried Kara's Cupcakes after I told her my experience.  So as a way to say that my assessment on Kara's was spot on, she brought over cupcakes from her side of town.  The cupcakes from Noe Valley Bakery were so so cute, and they were quite good.  I only had one since everyone else got to the others before I could have seconds.  I turned my back for a minute and there was only an empty box on the table. So when my husband and I were there the other day, I stopped by to buy some.  It was a no nonsense kind of place; very quaint and cozy (a neighborhood jaunt).  I had their lemon drop and chocolate velvet.  Both flavors were very good, and it only cost about $2-$2.75.  Customer service was friendly and efficient.  Would definitely go back anytime rather than ever going back to Kara's!
author: Mr. and Mrs. L.

description:
"Everybody must get Sconed"  I love it.  That's what the back of there shirts say.  I stopped in with the girlfriend on a Saturday morning stroll through Noe Valley.  After browsing through all the Breads, Cakes, Tarts, and Pastries I went with a Cheddar Chive Scone and a warm Chi.  The Scone was warm, delicate and melted in my mouth. I seriously could of eaten 10 of theses.  This is better having a dough nut in the morning. We'll at least sometimes.

 I look forward to coming back real soon to take home some of those Chocolate Croissants I hear so much about.   Five stars
author: Robert M.

description:
Even though I have lived in the hood for a long time, I just discovered Noe Valley Bakery - which is so good - so good that i won't allow myself to go there anymore unless it is my birthday. 

I found out about it because a friend brought over Noe Valley Bakery cookie dough as a treat the week after I gave birth to my son. Only one batch made it into the oven, the rest my husband and I ate by the spoonfull (breastfeeding has made me ravenous). I went back once to get another batch and then vowed never to go back again after I gained 5 lbs in 2 weeks.

Then a friend who came over with a loaf of fresh baked NV bakery fig bread jolted me off the wagon. WOW was it good.  Tons of whole figs baked into a hearty whole wheat base. And then my friend told me that they also have Cherry Chocolate bread. It was more than I could stand so I went back and got a loaf.  It was delicious and so fresh. Not too sweet but just enough chocolate to give you hope with each bite.

Anyway, I am back on the wagon again, but don't let my inability to moderate my cookie dough/fresh baked bread intake discourage you from indulging.
author: Lynn G.

description:
Cupcakes are excellent as are the brownies - actually, all of the baked goods are great.

Stay away from the sandwiches - they sound great, but they're $7.00 for two tiny pieces of bread with two even smaller pieces of whatever meat choice you've made, with no condiments.  Go with Noe Valley Deli a few doors down.
author: David T.

description:
OK... where do I begin???

The BLUEBERRY PECAN scones, the FIG BREAD (get it unsliced), and the the Hamenlisch (sp?) PASTRY COOKIES....

Oh, and don't even get me started on their divine QUICHES!  I find myself making calorie choices when I'm at NVB - I can't eat it all, and be able to return for a repeat visit.....  Ah, the decisions!
author: hugh c.

description: Appparently, I need to get over to the bakery earlier in the day, because half the stuff in other people's reviews is never there when I walk by. I think it opens at seven and closes at six so you know Im never there at the start. However, even the dregs of what's there are good. So far have only tried the m&m cookie, the jam cookie, and the cookie dough. Yes, they have tubs of cookie dough that you can take home and bake... the chocolate chip one was so yummy! I aim to go early enough to get these cookies again, before theyre sold out, or get some cupcakes...or try a muffin. I wish they were open late around dessert time... I'm not an early eater. Just the fact that there IS a yummy bakery by my house is awesome though, so yay to noe bakery!
author: Merredith L.

description: So so good!  After reading reviews, I sampled cupcakes: red velvet, lemon drop, mini mint chocolate chip, and mini DQ'd.  Oh so yummy alla dem...the red velvet was my favorite tho :)
author: Rene C.

description: Snuck in for a molasses cookie and cup of coffee- made my day so sweet!
author: Jennifer W.

description: Delicious baked goods, especially those Asiago Breadsticks. BUT I DESPERATELY MISS the Linzer Torte, PLEASE bring it back!!!!!
author: Richard B.

description:
Their whole wheat sandwich bread is a staple for me. They have an orgasmic asiago cheese bread, that I always bring to potlucks, and everyone loves!
Their deserts are nice, I vote for the fruit tart, although the cupcakes are pretty good.

p.s - they sell frozen cookie dough - much ncier than the stuff you get in the stores, not as nice as the stuff you would make at home -
author: Shipra K.

description: Great breads and baked goods and cookies. I recommend their carrot cake, red velvet and mostest cupcakes highly. Unless you order a cake/cupcake with cream cheese frosting, though, it will taste more like Crisco than sugar.  The window displays are particularly wonderful at Halloween, Christmas and Easter.
author: Jane B.

description: Love bun, indeed!  Fresh brioche dough with custard nestled inside, crispy fried outside dusted with sugar.  This is a destination pastry.  If it had been warm, it would have been too good for my own good.
author: Esther R.

description: Great chocolate chip cookies and boston creme cupcake. the red-velvet left much to be desired so I wouldn't order that again. Great bakery, but don't make a special trip to the area for it.
author: Dionne G.

description: Incredible morning delights I picked up this morning. I really dig that they have savory scones and croisants as I am not a sweet tooth.  Still, the sticky bun was one of the best my friend had every tasted, and she knows her buns.  This would be a 5* review if it weren't for the grumpy person behind the counter who looked completely annoyed and bored while she was helping me.
author: e w.

description:
I've been a customer since they opened their doors ... it's a cross between a patisserie & boulangerie, and they do both equally well. 

Cupcakes are in this year, unfortunately at the expense of their savory selection (galettes are out!). Not a fan of cupcakes ... Chocolate Eclairs on the other hand YES!

Other notables - apricot ginger bread, strawberry rhubarb pie, pain au chocolat, chocolate chip cookies. 

the coffee has definitely improved over the years ... for those who avoid Starbucks in support of local businesses. 

To be avoided Saturday mornings, and the day before major holidays.
author: Joe 9.

description: Really good bread, tasty croissants, cupcakes and other lovely stuff. This is a bit higher quality than La Boulange. Basically, you can't go wrong here!
author: X O.

description: Rude staff and overpriced. Baked cakes are no better than Safeway. Do yourself a favor and avoid this place.
author: Ray f.

description: I can only speak of the cookie dough, but it was phenomenal. Advice for anyone baking cookies - do not do it yourself, do not buy premade dough at the store, go to NVB for their dough and bake at home. You can pass them off as your own.
author: David R.

description:
I go here every Saturday morning.  I walk here from the Castro, tie my dog up outside at the "puppy parking" and buy whatever looks good.  I'm not so into cupcakes, so the scones and fresh breads are what I buy.  I love the Blueberry Pecan Scones, Blueberry Muffins, Cheddar Chive Scones and Chocolate Chip Banana Muffins.   And the Chocolate Croissants have a generous slab of dark chocolate buried in the middle - my favorite.  The bread is standard fare -- nothing really stands out -- but tasty and fresh.  

The staff is friendly, the store is clean although crowded and the window display is always cheerful.  This is just a nice and pleasant place.
author: Paddy W.

description:
Some of the best cupcakes in town! Not too much sugar, butter cream, moist.

Also, good cheese scones and cakes.
author: Kevin R.

description:
If I have but one weakness in the world, it is my love of muffins. However, recently I've been disappointed with the muffin selection in this city - they're usually much too dry, or too sticky and gooey. 

But thank god I found Noe Valley Bakery. The other day I stopped in and ordered my typical breakfast: 1 medium coffee (which was excellent) and 1 blueberry muffin.

I must say, this muffin was perfect - not too sticky and gooey, not too dry, and made with what seemed like fresh blueberries. My boyfriend had the banana-nut muffin and it was spot on as well.

Did I mention that this place is super cute, and that they employ the nicest people? Yeah . . . I only wish it was closer to my hood.
author: Tom A.

description: I have been a customer, for too many years. This is just your average bakery. They have enjoyed a captive market, since opening. In reading the reviews, I agree with the negative thoughts, about both, cookies & cupcakes.  I cant buy anyone, thinking the goods or service , are great.They ,  are not. I think they do a few items well, but fall short on most.  Check out the "shut your pie hole" on staffs t shirt, also , if you are in line, don't expect to sample any goods, in 13 years, they do not give samples. Very un-generous. Lastly,new cookie, a circus cookie, $2.25 each, I find that hard to believe.
author: Hayley g.

description: Carlos A is now my favorite yelper... why? Because I can be won over with one damn fine cupcake. He brought a little love muffin (aka the Chocolate Caramel-Fleur De Sel) from Noe Valley Bakery by Yelp HQ today. I took one bite of dark chocolate with sea salt and whoa nelly. I haven't been the same since. Carlos, I heart you but I especially heart my cupcake.
author: Nicole G.

description: I picked up some of their cupcakes to share with some people, real cupcake connoisseurs BTW, and everyone raved about them. Five stars for making me look like the Mac daddy with the best cupcake hookup!
author: Manny F.

description:
Ugh Noe Valley Bakery, you're making me fat!

I love this place. They have the best yums. I live down the street and it's hard to walk down 24th without stopping in (praise you gym membership).

Loves:
-asiago bread/rolls
-love buns
-ginger cookies
-savory cheese croissant
-coffee cake muffins
-apricot hamentashen
-ah forget it, i love it all
author: kelly f.

description: Best baked goods in the city, hands down! The double raisin, cherry chocolate and caramelized onion sesame breads are three of my all time favorites. The cakes are magical and anything with fruit is amazing.
author: Stephen G.

description: This place rocks!!! The mixed berry torte was soooooo friging good, that I ate the ENTIRE thing by myself!!! Over the course of a few (3) days, of course!!! Have you ever had heaven on a plate? Try this and you won't be disappointed!!!
author: Chantel S.

description: Savory croissants are totally underrated and underrepresented. And while NVB's aren't quite Bay Bread's, they are pretty fucking great.
author: Megan W.

description:
