i really really liked this bakery.  used to get the best cheese croissants here.  then i saw mouse in there one day and kinda freaked out but thot it was an isolated incident.  

then i saw two mice in there a couple weeks later.  i dunno, kinda lost my appetite for this place after that.
author: Bird B.

description: we went here when the line at Tartine's was too long.  We got some morning buns and a cake for our mom's birthday.  Everything was delicious and really not that expensive.  I would definitely go back as a nice alternative and smaller bakery experience.
author: Kirsten M.

description: Great breads, but watch out for the mean lil troll that works behind the counter..... She's super mean and sassy,  thinks she much cuter than she is, and that every transaction is a night at the Lexington club......
author: Pammy S.

description:
It's the beginning of the year and I've been trying to curb my sweet tooth desires. I successfully gave up coffee last year, so I've really been trying to stick true to my resolution of cutting down on sweets.
You know how they say if you're gonna cheat, it should be with someone hot? While I myself am not prone to infidelity, I feel that the red velvet cupcake here was my sloppy one night stand. It kinda took care of my craving, but I simply didn't feel good about myself afterwards. And I'm certain I've had better.
Anywho, I get the impression they're definitely better at their breads than their desserts.
author: Alona N.

description: Great place to just go and grab a cup of coffee and a pastry. Everything there is fresh and tasty! Friendly people, and can get a little crowded, but that's because its a good bakery.
author: Lisa B.

description: I've only had their cupcakes and they are so so sooo good. They're a good size, well priced and the moistest cupcakes i've ever had. So much better than Kara's cupcakes. I'm a fan of their fleur de sel, the mostest, boston cream, the lemon one... pretty much all of them =) definately recommend the fleur de sel. It's a perfect balance of salty and sweet. Best cupcakes ever!
author: Rochelle I.

description: A dear friend of mine brought me some fig bread from here and I've since visited the bakery twice on my ventures to the city. Parking is a bit tough but the bakery has some yummy stuff. I love the fig bread and the rugelah is awesome. The service is so-so. They got my order wrong twice... and they seem a little indifferent. But-I will continue to stop in when I'm up here for the rugelah and fig bread.
author: Andrea K.

description: Just had my first cupcake from Noe Valley Bakery. Hmm. Helloooo diabetes!
author: Maria D.

description: I adore their chocolate cupcake with the bavarian cream filling. They are simply divine. Reminds me of mom putting one of those old fashioned hostess cupcakes in my lunchbox. Whenever I am feeling a little nostalgic, I'll drive across town just for this tasty treat.
author: Isabella L.

description:
i had a craving for sweets and today is my lucky day.

sooo many choices, i didn't know what to do!  so what did i do?  i got one of everything that caught my eye.  yahaa, that's....one chocolate croissant, one fig tart, one lemon cupcake, one red velvet chocolate cupcake, one carrot cake cupcake, one moist chocolate cake with sprinkles, and one chocolate chip cookie.  i came in for ONE cupcake, but i left with 7 goodies.  see anything wrong with that?  whatever, you only live once.  they were all good.  just kidding!!  hahahaa!  

okay, so as i was driving back....i was thinking, okay exercise some self control woman, let's just eat 3 today, and so that was the plan.  the chocolate chip cookie was alright - it was not warm or chewy, but i bet it would be so good if it was.  when i initially bit into the chocolate croissant, i was like "where the heck is the chocolate?" and then, uh ohhhh, oh! there it is......uh huh, alright, it wasn't like omg good but i liked it; it's not oily like some of the croissants i've had.  well, i was ready to devour my 3rd victim....i peeked into my pastries box and no doubt, the chocolate cupcake with sprinkles was speaking to me.  aw man, that made my day.  is it 12 a.m. yet?
author: Paulina C.

description: There were two Birthdays in the office this month, so my co-workers arranged to get two smaller cakes here- (I haven't actually been to the location) one Carrot cake, and one Hazelnut cake with Strawberries. They were frosted very 'cutely" Little carrots were depicted with orange and green frosting on the carrot, and the Hazelnut had a very moist nut filled texture and flavor. Yum!  I just ate another leftover piece! It held up really well.  This is not Tartine Bakery, nor is it Safeway cake, it's in between: better than average cake but not snobby. I identify with that!
author: Melissa B.

description: I would be (even more) GINORMOUS if I worked there, that's for sure!  It must be a nice place to work, though -- it feels like the workers are proud of the quality of the merchandise (as well they should), and happy to see you, and attentive.  Great place-- I will miss it when I move to the East Bay.
author: alex n.

description: The BEST cupcakes I have ever eaten. I haven't tried anything else simply because anytime I go in there my eyes head strait for the cupcakes. Yum simply delicious! Go hurry and get some!
author: angela i.

description: Best Red Velvet cupcake I've ever had.  Cake was super moist and not too sweet, and the cream cheese frosting... Holy Moly.... Again, not too sweet, super smooth and cream cheeeeeeeeeesy!
author: Cassie C.

description: I just had a cupcake from Noe Valley Bakery, and I guess you could say I'm in cupcake heaven. Moist and rich, the perfect blend of frosting. The one I gobbled down was their own take on the Hostess Cupcake, but done fresh and without any processed taste. I am very happy that this place is not in my neighborhood or else I'd be kissing my lithe figure goodbye!
author: Nish N.

description: Alright, my lady and I are hooked on cupcakes at the moment!  Noe Valley Bakery doesn't help me ween off of this addiction.  They have really good bread, cookies, pies, etc., but you don't come here for that stuff!!!  It is the moistess, zinger or the rocky road cupcakes that makes us come back at least once a week.  Near their display, I think the SF Guardian voted them the best cupcake of 2006 and I don't doubt that.  Kara's Cupcakes are just as good, although different kind of good!
author: Jason A.

description: I bought 5 lady kisses cookies and five noe-o's to celebrate two coworkers birthdays this morning, I thought both were delicious cookies but there were no lady kisses cookies left over so I guess that was the winner. This is a cute bakery, I would probably have given it 5 stars if 10 cookes weren't $15. But I guess thats life, good things can't always be a bargain. Especially in noe valley.
author: Dana H.

description:
Update:
***
Went to the bakery itself to give the cupcakes a try. 5 stars all the way! This time we tried the red velvet, zinger and of course the Most-est. The red velvet cake was denser than their other cupcakes and not as "red" as other places, but the frosting was GREAT. Not a straight up cream cheese flavor, but not too sweet either.  The Zinger had a fluffy and light whipped rasberry filling, and also delish (and I don't even like coconut!) The Most-est was its usual delicious self. $2.75 for filled cupcakes and available whenever I get the cupcake crave? FIVE Stars! 
****
This is a review of their cupcakes only. Just had some of their cupcakes at a birthday party, and boy oh boy, are these TASTY! and flavorful. Tried the carrot and Most-est (their homemade version of a chocolate hostess cupcake with the white icing squiggle) cupcakes. The carrot cake was perfectly dense, filled with all sorts of goodness (carrots, nuts, spice) and the cream cheese frosting is very light and fluffy. The Most-est cake is not very dense, but the cake part is very soft and moist., and the cream in the middle, Yu-hm. The ganache top pairs with the cake perfectly. I could of eaten another two of those easily. The cake to frosting ratio is just right. Definitely on par with Sibby's in texture and tastiness. At $2/cupcake definitely a great value. Will have to check out their store soon!
author: Mashi M.

description:
This place is close to where I work.

Such a staple in my diet. Some things a bit on the pricey end (i.e. cookies)

Loves:
*Scones (any and all)
*Cakes (ditto - my faves include Cloud 9 & Carrot Cake; I personally find the Red Velvet a bit dry; these and others can be ordered in advance - advised around holiday/weekends)
*Breads
*Breadsticks (SOOOOOO ADDICTING)
*Sandwiches (chicken sandwich is nice and basic)
*Quiches (that can be toasted on site)

Am I a carb person much?
author: Angela T.

description:
theres a few things here that are amazing!!!   
1) the carmelized, sesame bagette!!
2) the raisin rugelach!!
3) the carrot cake!!
4) the regular tuna salad sandwiche
5) the egg salad sandwich
6) the brownies!!

everything else is good but these are my favorite things. Hard to make better
author: luke b.

description: You can't go wrong here.  They have the yummiest cupcakes here.  Well, everything is delicious. I usually don't like cakey things, but I've been given several cupcakes from here and they're all GOOD.  I don't usually like lemon pastry things, but the lemon cupcake is exquisite. Anyone around here knows this bakery is the sh-t.  You gotta try it, seriously.
author: Karen J.

description: I told myself, I just need one cupcake...5 mins later, I walk out with 4 and an Asiago cheese roll.  I had to get the most-est cupcake, chocolate cake with a creamy filling.  I also had to get the lemon drop, how could I resist the little bumble bee on the top?  I also had to get the vanilla,  It's a staple, I have to get this one everytime.  Lastly, how could I resist the peanut butter and jelly?  I actually never tried that flavor before.  I always wanted to but thought it was a little weird.  Well, it is...it tastes exactly like a pb&j sandwich.  the top creamy part is a nutty peanut butter and the filling is grape jelly.  yummy...
author: Jen L.

description:
I was very excited when i found another place to try cupcakes in San Francisco. However, my excitement quickly turned into disappointment when i bit into this cupcake. Between my boyfriend and I we tried the Lemon, red velvet, and the fleur de Sel cupcakes. We both whole heartedly agree that this place knows how to make cake. The cake part was DELICIOUS! Perfectly moist, except that the two filled ones (the lemon and the fleur de Sel) had way too much filling thus taking away from the moist yummy cake. The frosting was not as yummy as the cake. I love frosting, i think that's what makes cupcakes so delicious, the perfect cake to frosting ratio. However, the frosting on these cupcakes was way too sweet and ganache tasting. I wasn't feeling it. I actually peeled the frosting off of the Fleur de Sel cupcake and threw it in the garbage. Thumbs down. 
If the frosting on these cupcakes was more creamy i'd give them a 5 star review. The 3 stars is solely based on cupcakes. We didn't try anything else, though now i wish we would have bought something OTHER than the cupcakes.
author: jennifer p.

description: Great little bakery. Love it here. I love getting their buttery croissants, cinnamon twists, crisp breadsticks, scones, and soft-centered, crusty Italian style white bread. Every time I come here, I have to cut out my carbs for the rest of the week. Well worth it. YUM!!
author: Juliane N.

description: OHMAGOD that chocolate cupcake with the swirly frosting on top like a hostess, but BETTER and filled with CREME is SO GOOD THAT I JUST ABOUT, um, well, you know...just about....it was that good.
author: Claire C.

description: I really love this bakery!  I get birthday cakes here and everyone asks where I got the cake.  Everything else they have is great too!  I took away one star for the time I went there in the morning to pick up some breakfast treats for my coworkers.  I was quickly scolded for not preordering since I wanted to pick out 50 pastries from what they baked that morning.  I actually thought about preordering but didn't in the end.  Anyway, I really didn't see what the difference was between me buying 50 items and 50 people coming in to buy 1 item each.  I didn't get a discount for buying in bulk.  I still highly recommend them.
author: Julie D.

description: It doesn't have quite the variety of Tartine (or the snob value that stings you as you wait in a long line for such an expensive pastry) but it's possible that the croissants and morning buns are better.  I would probably have to perform a side-by-side taste test in order to sign off on that.  Maybe I will.  Yeah, I think I will!  It's too bad there is nowhere to sit in this place and that I found myself taking my parents down the street so that we could eat our morning buns in Starbucks (they live in rural Vermont so maybe that's not quite as painful as it was to me) but at least it's open at 7:00 while Tartine is sleeping in!
author: Melissa B.

description: Chocolate-Caramel-Fleur de Sel - This is an awesome cupcake.  I cannot believe you can get this for a mere $2.75.    Really now.  Try it, you will NOT be sorry.
author: Mishka W.

description: Cupcakes are one of the top in SF!  The cake part is very light and spongey.  They are HUGE.  The frosting is decent, very subtle.  I can't wait to be back.
author: Deanna K.

description: It is a little on the expensive side, but everything I've had here has been incredible, from the savory cheese croissants to the chocolate cake with raspberry whipped cream filling.  We also got a vanilla cake with lemon filling for the cat's birthday (I know, I know) that everyone raved about. I've never even seen cupcakes with Sno-Balls on them before!  It is probably a very good thing for my waistline that I need to walk over a huge freakin' hill both ways to get to the Noe Valley Bakery.
author: Jude F.

description: Cupcakes are outrageous here.  I love ALOT of frosting and these babies have it!  If I lived in this town I would be here every flippin morning!  The smell of bread was what drew me to this place.  Then it was the cupcakes.  Ab-Fab
author: Joie P.

description:
review of cupcakes only b/c that is what I love and had

my favorite is the vanilla. has a very light frosting and who doesn't love the cute circular sprinkles! so happy!

chocolate/chocolate - frosting a little too sweet but cake was light and wonderful

had something like a hostess something or other.
great! and light!

rocky road, also wonderful and light

$1.95/each

and they bake them fresh throughout the day. I went in and they were out at 1pm. I was soo sad. but they said come back in 1 hr and there will be more. I came back and there was more!  yum!

husband says he likes them better than Miette!  (sacrilege!)
author: Sophia Y.

description: OMG! I was at a friend's birthday party last night and they served cupcakes from Noe Valley Bakery for dessert.  The cupcake that I tried which I thought was "just" chocolate turned out to be the Chocolate-Caramel-Fleur de Sel Cupcake.  This cupcake is to die for!  Imagine my surprise when I cut into what I thought was plain chocolate cake only to find caramel cream inside.....it was so creamy and the cake portion was so moist!  What is the Fleur de Sel that they sprinkle on top??  It's salt!!  Who knew?  There's only a few sprinkles of it but if you like the combination of sweet & salt, you will love this cupcake as much as I did.  I went back to the dessert table to snag a 2nd, and all the "chocolate" ones were gone! :-(
author: Virginia A.

description: I had a chocolate bunny with a mouse filling and a marshmallow in there somewhere. It was amazing. I can easily see myself making a trip out to Noe just to grab a sweet little snack from this place.
author: melissa g.

description: I've been a Noe Valley Bakery fan since I moved to the neighborhood 12 years ago. When did they add sourpuss to the menu? I got two yummy quiches, and a so-so cupcake (maybe because it was on the cool side?), but I didn't know they came with a side-order of ire from the staff. I mean she was efficient enough, but I could smell the disdain from a mile away. Providing good customer service isn't about covering all your bases ("room for cream?"). It's about your customers walking away, but wanting to come back.  I hope this was just a rare occurrence.
author: Chris R.

description: I'm lazy. I'm always late to work. I think I have cavities. I shouldn't be eating bread. Either I'm stupid for avoiding it OR the raspberry croissant is sooooo effing good that I can't help  but stop for one on my to work every other day!!!
author: sri b.

description: Great cakes that we always get a lot of compliments on when we bring them to parties. Cupcakes are stellar. Nice variety of freshly baked bread- esp like the wheat bread they make. Its kinda dense and chewy. The pastries are also top notch.
author: Adrian F.

description:
Okay I should be pro since it is in my old neighborhood, and it is still there! Okay so it has changed hands several times, but the spirit is still hanging in there. Also it is a feat to still be in existance in the ever changing and shifitng opf Yuppie Valley. 
As a kid growning up, you could always could count on an awesome birthday cake with all of the trimings. Sometimes my mother would get two!
But sadly now, my taste buds have been corrupted due to the fresh bakeries of Holland and France. So when I returned to SF to live, I made due. I am glad they still try. I do enjoy the service very much there. No matter how grumpy some of the clientele can be and how unreasonable some the clietele can act, the staff still find a great outward attitude with real smiles for me.
I do enjoy their seeded onion baguette, cream filled center and generously topped chocolate cupcakes, butterpound cake, cheese scones, cinnamon twists and iced cinnamon bun cake. But the rest of the baked goods I ignore. But I will dare to venture to try their other attempts one day knowing that it is a hit or miss due to stalness.
author: e.s.s. A.

description: I love cupcakes so as I was going to the rocketdog adoption they hold every first Sunday I seen noe valley bakery n I herd thru yelp they had really goodcupcakes so I bought a vanilla one and red velvet. Lemme tell u...super good n moist. I love it. The only downside was the customer service. The gurl who rang me up seemed like she was hella in a rush other than that super good cupcakes. Yumm oh yah n there only $2.50. :)
author: Fran N.

description:
When I heard about the cupcakes that are a gourmet version of Hostess' classics, I made a special trip out to Noe Valley to sample one.  As it turns out, I ended up with three.  I couldn't resist the play on the "snowball" the "the lemon zinger" and the "original chocolate cupcake".

I love cakes with cream filling.  I asked the staff which ones were filled with cream.  When the choices became too overwhelming, I got all three.  The lemon zinger was filled with lemon curd, the snowball was filled with raspberry cream, and the chocolate was filled with whipped cream.  

None of them disappointed.  They were all beautiful.  They were all a great value at $1.95 per cake.  Most importantly, they were all super delicious!  All three had vanished in less than an hour.

They have a lot of other specialties here that I look forward to sampling.  Again, I'm gonna have to spend a little extra time at the gym each week because of this place.  I need to start going on salad binges instead of these sugary ones.
author: t l.

description: I dream about the "mostess" cupcakes from Noe Bakery.   Also love the bake-at-home blueberry pecan scones, the mini quiches, tartlets, croissants, and just about everything they make!  So good, you'll be addicted!
author: Ana C.

description: Every once in a while I have to wake up early on Saturday and drive to Noe Valley for one or two of their pastries. Today was one of those days. They make the best "cheese and chive" scones. No where else can you find a scone like this. I also love their blueberry muffins and sticky buns. While I'm not a cupcake fan, I have tried a couple, and the Boston Cream Pie cupcake, in particular, was pretty good except for the overly sweet icing. This place is better than Tartine's, which in my mind is an overrated dive. NV Bakery maybe small, but it has a lot to offer. A nice start to my Saturday.
author: Gregory C.

description: Never have I found such a friendly and wholesome-but-yummy bakery. They are always trying out new creative delectables, but I usually get a raspberry danish for brecky. Sometime I'll have to try the Love Bun, it's their rendition of a creme filled sugar donut, sounds amazing.
author: Shannon B.

description: been looking for that "it" cupcake place in san francisco, and i think i finally found it. friendly staff, great choices and delicious cupcakes. i'm shocked i didn't order a dozen just for myself. im looking forward to trying some of their other pastries.
author: Leslie T.

description: Absolutely amazing baked goods! Both the breads and the desserts here are always fabulous. Some of my favorite desserts include the coconut ginger cherry scone, the chocolate cupcake, the earthquake chocolate cookie, and the chocolate covered coconut macaroon.
author: Eater S.

description: I don't live in San Francisco, but I have family here and since I'm just down in Monterey, I come to SF all the time. This morning I was starving but since we were waiting on some other people, I just wanted to grab some pastries or something good but quick. I found this place on my GPS (VZW Navigator actually) and oh my, I'm glad I did. After checking out all these other reviews on YELP, it was for sure that I had to sample some of this place. Especially the cupcakes! I HEART CUPCAKES! Anyway, there were three other people with me, so we each got a little something, my cousin got the fruit tartlet, which looked too pretty to eat, but she did anyway and it was delish! I got the Ham and Cheese Croissant, which thoroughly satisfied my appetite and my other cousin got a brownie which was incredibly rich and decadent. My husband got a sweet cheese danish and oh my, so nice and flaky as well. I got a red velvet cupcake to go. The only reason why I did not give all five stars was because unless you buy a little box to take the cupcake in, they put it in a white bag which doesn't work too well because then you have the delicious frosting all over the inside, but I guess that's not soo bad. Anyway, I will definitely come back to Noe Valley Bakery...YUM!
author: Maya B.

description:
must...stop...buying...cheese...loaf...and eating whole thing in one day. 

i think they should host a contest for guessing how many fig halves are in one loaf of fig bread - my guess is around 30? cakes: i've bought choc mousse, strawberry hazelnut, and fruit tart for people's birthdays and people love them. every time i'm in there, i'm tempted to run into the kitchen and beg them to let me work there so i can learn their bread magic.

and get this, they make a SAVORY cheese croissant, which is like my holy grail. finally, i have found you, elusive savory breakfast pastry option!!
author: Angi C.

description: I really wish this could be a glowing review.  This place is in my 'hood.  But alas, it is simply, ordinary.   I've had drip coffee, sandwiches, lattes, scones, cookies and cupcakes-  and everything was just... ordinary.  I am surprised as many others have raved about their product.   I guess I will make my trips across town for baked goods.
author: Gabriela C.

description: I keep trying to love this place, as it's my neighborhood bakery, and that can be a useful thing. I first got turned onto it one morning when my hot water tank blew, and my landlord was not around to let anyone in to repair it, so my neighbors let me shower in their apartment. When I got out, they offered me breakfast--tea from Spike's and a thick slab of NVB's fig bread, toasted and slathered in butter. At the time, I thought it was terrific. But now I wonder if it was just the hospitality that made it taste so good. Because I've since bought the fig bread again, tried a cookie, an eclair, a quiche, and a couple of cupcakes (over many, many months, mind you; I don't have THAT much of a sweet tooth!), and none of them have wowed me. They are all fine, but to be honest, they're a little bland. I think I will stick to buying my fresh breads at Pasta Gina and my tasty-yummies at Tartine.
author: Lara F.

description: I remember when "Plate's Bakery" occupied this location many moons ago and glad that NVB is now in this space. I've enjoyed many of their pastries and breads over the years. My favorites are the cherry chocolate bread and the blueberry pecan scones. I don't go here often because I feel they have become too pricey for what they're offering.
author: Sabrina L.

description:
i always come back for their chocolate mousse cake. very rich in chocolate, i don't know what chocolate they use, but it's damn good. all people i bought the cake for (birthday), they all love it. !

the staffs are friendly too...
author: Suki S.

description: OK, I know I've written a lot of 5 star reviews - but my philosophy is that if I'm going to write a review about a place it'll only be when I'm absolutely blown away by how wonderful it is, or when I can't believe a place is still in business because its absolutely horrendous. Well, this bakery definitely warrants a 5 star review - it has some of the most tantalizing, mouth-wateringly delicious baked goods I've ever come across. I used to work down the street from this place, and would go in thinking "I'm only going to get a cup of coffee" - yeah right! Word of advice: you will be extremely tempted by the beautiful pastries, cookies, and cupcakes displayed - and the awesome smell of it all! I especially loooove their red velvet cakes and cupcakes, but really - everything is good at this bakery.
author: Sookie P.

description: Solid four stars for a delicious savory cheese croissant and a tasty chocolate-covered Noe-O (how could I resist?), but a bit pricey.  As a special treat calorically or financially I would come back.
author: David N.

description: Yay...I found a great place in SF that sells delicious red velvet cupcakes! Definitely worth a visit if you are in Noe Valley.
author: Shweta V.

description:
Whenever I go to the Ferry Building Farmer's Market on Saturday mornings, I *always* stop by the Noe Valley Bakery tent and get a little pastry for breakfast.

Scones are my thing, I looove them above all other breakfast pastries. And the blueberry-pecan scone, with a cup of coffee while wandering the market smelling lemon basil and lavender is just a moment of heaven in my week.

Thank you Noe Valley Bakery!
author: Laura K.

description: If you happen to walk by and see a disheveled person cramming a cupcake into her pie-hole like she just got out of prison... it might be me. I'm currently obsessed with their rocky road cupcakes... the crunch of the almonds, the squishy marshmallows, the chocolate ganache top and cream center...........
author: L. M.

description: A red-velvet cupcake is a red-velvet cupcake, delicious in its own right, always worth the cost.  At $2.50 a cupcake, I have often found myself subconsciously driving towards Noe Valley Bakery when craving one.  In honest, its not 'thee absolute' best I've ever had, but they certainly do the cupcake justice!  They have an adorable 'ice cream cone cookie' that is tasty too.
author: Gina L.

description:
Best sticky bun that I've had in the city.  Gooey, caramely, buttery goodness...yum!  Cookies, scones, and cupcakes are pretty good as well.  

Minus one star for the other stuff I've tried such as morning bun, quiche and Mexican wedding cookie.  They were all right but nothing to write home about.  And yes...like the other reviewers have stated the service can be quite rude so if you go, be prepared.
author: Remus L.

description: I might go into a food induced coma after eating 3 of Noe Valley's scrumptious vanilla cupcakes! Very moist and very friendly staff is all I have to say. If your in the neighborhood, stop by and buy a cupcake, you won't be disappointed!
author: Melissa Z.

description:
three words: asiago cheese roll

cheesy goodness :)

i always stop in here and pick one up to munch on. i've yet to really move on to anything else. pity.
author: eve l.

description: The Lemon Drop Cupcake is amazing. I've had three in the last day and half. I'm not big on sweets but this thing is delicious.
author: Alana K.

description: Every time I come here, I've the hopes of getting a sticky bun or red velvet cupcake. And every time I come, they're sold out. They're absolutely delish and a staple for every Ferry Building Farmer's Market trip. Head up to Noe Valley early - the treats get snatched up quick.
author: Erika C.

description: I went to an event this weekend where the cake was from this bakery. I heard their red velvet cake was the best so I went to get one for my family. The cake was dry & frosting/filling taste like plain cream cheese. It was nothing special at all. I would have been happier with a Safeway cake! :o(
author: May G.

description: The Carrot cupcake was DANG good but the Chocolate-Caramel-Fleur de Sel Cupcake was too much and put me in a sugar shock coma.
author: Pelle Y.

description:
the staff here are very kind and patient on helping to customize personal cakes.  they explained to me what flavors, frosting, cake flavors i could mix and match, and which would work well with the photo i had requested to have copied on the cake.

they have a great selection of breads and sweets!
author: Sheri N.

description: Their desserts are good, but not great. They have some interesting ones (like the un-rugelach cherry and chocolate rugelach) that seem appealing enough, and taste pretty delicious. Their cupcakes are various, but I did not try one only because I was more into trying some pastry magic. It wasn't so magical. I was not a fan of their almond croissant. Their cookies are pretty decent. I must come back to try their bread and tarts, which I hear good things about. Maybe next time I'll grab a cupcake as well. For now, they hover in my 3.5 range, obviously leaning toward a 4. Good, but not great. I will find greatness in this city's pastries yet. The hunt continues.
author: Shannon F.

description: We make a special trip across town to get the fig bread. the apricot bread is like dessert. worth it to pick up at the Sat. am Ferry Plaza farmers market too. ONe of  SF's very best!
author: Michelle S.

description: I really appreciate this place! I called last minute needing unbaked croissant dough for a recipe and Michael was happy to oblige. It was delicious, very buttery, flaky, and volumious. The cupcakes and cookes were beautiful. I can't wait to return and stock up on the sweets! Thanks!
author: Jenny H.

description: Sometimes I really miss living in Noe Valley, home of the delicious breakfast items. The pecan and blackberry scones are incredible, and the carrot muffin is the best lowfat muffin on the planet -- remarkably, it tastes nothing like cardboard! Grab a scone to share while you're waiting for your eggs in those long Noe brunch lines.
author: Laurel N.

description: Very good pumpkin bread, neighborly feel - pricey on the cookies & cupcakes but damn, they looked good! Overall, a good stop that has far less 'tude than Tartine and a good stop on the way to work in the morning.
author: Anika K.

description: Noe Valley makes some of the most scrumptuous croissants in the Bay Area, I think:  totally buttery and flaky, and comes in chocolate, raspberry, and cheese versions.  For a little more heft in your pastry bliss, try the apple wrapped in a pastry.  Yes, it's half an apple completely encased in puff pastry.  They have a good variety of breads, cookies, and lunch items like premade sandwiches and mini quiches.  Everything I've bought here has been delicious, but I have to ding it one star because their prices are high.  They used to have a branch in the East Bay which is now defunct, and I suspect their pricing didn't fly with the residents.
author: maiko h.

description: I have friends, who will fight people over the chocolate cherry rugala
author: Niki M.

description: Yep, yep, gimme some of those cupcakes. But even better than that is their challah. The cinnamon one is delicious to make french toast out of. Yum. Also the frozen cookie dough is good. For some reason the few times I got a cookie there it had a strange taste to it. I was a little hesitant to try the dough, but what the hell. The ones I baked at home tasted just fine, so hooray! Also, the dough seems to last a few weeks just in the fridge, so this also made me happy.
author: gabby m.

description: I used to live in the neighborhood and frequented this place often. I loved the bread, the pastries are fresh and never too sweet, and the cakes and desserts have been heavenly!! I compared their cupcakes to the famous Magnolia cupcakes in Manhattan, and hands down, Noe Valley Bakery has the best! The frosting is not too rich and sweet and compliments the cake.
author: S. P.

description:
I feel SO lucky to be living within walking distance of Noe Valley Bakery.  Anything I have bought there is beyond delicious.  Our entire family would happily live all summer on their outstanding strawberry rhubarb pie.  What I especially love about NVB is how it is not focused on sugar.  Aside from cakes and pies, they have yummy breads (try the challah) and pastries like ruggelach.

I agree that they can, on occasion, hire someone whose doesn't completely get customer service.  But, those people usually don't last.  And when you need something special, if the counter person can't come up with a solution, one of the owners will.  I needed a flourless birthday cake for my wife and wanted one of the delicious chocolate cakes they make for Passover.  The counter people told me no go.  But, when I asked Mary, she told me why that was tough.  But, she could and did make a delicious flourless fruit torte.  It was great.  My wife was happy.
author: Gary B.

description: On my way to an open house this morning, I stopped in for a quick bite.  I was rewarded with a truly solid, well-made, artfully crafted, sweetly sugary raspberry croissant.  And, it was handed over with that quiet, humble sort of attitude that, somehow, always manages to make the food taste better.
author: Ann M.

description: Aside from the tarts, cookies and quiches, which are delicious, there is one thing that can't come close to them all. The only one thing that gets me excited and that is...you ready? the asiago bread. The best.  Beware since everyone eyes the middle, that's where the treasure cheese is at.  Smiles to you Noe Valley Bakery for putting together some of my favorite things. Oh, and the mini tarts were the perfect size for my parakeet, Jolie, it was her birthday!
author: Glu C.

description: NVB has done birthday cakes for my family, first communion, anniversary and everything in between. They also have the best eclairs I have ever had!!!! There bread is great, muffins are great....I can't say enough good things about this place!!
author: JR H.

description: I have fallen in love with the crack coated fruit tart.
author: Faye P.

description:
sunny day:

sweet bun - consumed and enjoyed
cheese roll - disappointing, slightly dry and hard. consumed and enjoyed (by my dog)
chocolate cherry rugelach - gifted to jewish housemate (hey, I try to be culturally sensitive!)

nice peeps. nice items on display. gonna try other stuff if i find myself in the neighborhood again, like those yummy looking cupcakes.
author: ray e.

description: 5 stars for their current window display--a mini carnival scene that my son absolutely loves.  Unfortunately, he's got an egg allergy that prevents him from enjoying most of the delectible delights but no matter--he's pleased as punch to stand outside and gaze at the mini merry-go-round, parachutes, and roller coaster in the window.   Words cannot describe how excited the Z-man gets when we take him to see "carnival capers" at the bakery.  And for that, Noe Valley Bakery will forever be my favorite bakery.
author: Sharyn F.

description: They had an awesome Chocolate-Caramel-Fleur de Sel Cupcake that had a salty chocolate frosted that tasted amazing!  Their red velvet was good too. I haven't tasted their other baked goods, but i adore their cupcakes!
author: sharon m.

description: The BEST bakery ever.  Extremely friendly staff.  Delicious cookies and cupcakes.  Most excellent baguettes.  I haven't found another bakery quite as good in the Noe Valley / Mission / Castro districts.  Wish they would open another location on Valencia St.
author: nicole l.

description: The cherry & chocolate bread is delicious. A little pricey but good selection of sweet and savory pastries. The female cashier who helped me the other day was very nice and friendly. I want to give them 5 stars. However, the other (male) cashier who was helping another customer had a condescending attitude. He looked and acted as if he was too important and too busy to help customers.
author: Mia D.

description: Has the BEST flourless (read: passover safe) chocolate cake I've ever had. It's so rich just a sliver is enough to satisfy your craving for something sweet (think fudge-like) but unfortunately it's seasonal. The cookies are a bit overpriced and are just okay.
author: Alden C.

description:
Since I recently stopped eating wheat, I miss the bread from this place the most. 

The raising bread is more crammed with fat juicy raisins than anything I've ever seen.  Also, they are picky about their ingredients - their chocolate chip cookies have real chocolate in them, not that waxy Nestle stuff.  Do not miss their "Mostess" cupcakes, which are like ding-dongs made with real ingredients.  Don't get me started on their take on Oreo.  I'm getting a sugar rush now. 
  
They also make the riches hot chocolate, ever. 

Minor points: It would be nice if they had wheat free options.  Also, when we asked them to create a birthday cake without dairy, they were not able to accommodate.  But if you don't have any dietary restrictions, this place is as good as it gets. 

Oh- and it's woman owned.  Bonus!
author: Becka R.

description: The quiche was yummy or as the bf said 'flavorful'!! I enjoyed the baked goods : danish, scones, cookies etc;  i would have like them more if they were warm or fresh.  I was definitely come back if i was in the area. I liked the tshirts and train decor outside, very homely
author: Hana ..

description: They have the best challah in SF (even if no one who works there can pronounce it - say it with me people CHallah; not holla, not chola. CHA-lah!)
author: Melissa Y.

description:
i love their cupcakes!!!! all of them are good! 

I've also had their bread and cookies..their baked goods are on point!

this is a gem of a place on this block.

my only peeve is when the person in front of me takes ALL the chocolate cupcakes before I can get to one!!!!
author: Jenniflava R.

description: Went in to get cupcakes after eating at Barney's gourmet burgers. I ended up spending $11 on four cupcakes, two of them being red velvet. Well worth every penny!
author: Jacqueline E.

description: i've gotten some great treats from noe valley bakery via their ferry market stand on saturday mornings. i love me some savory goodies, and the cheddar chive scone really makes me happy! the morning buns were recommended to us by another patron standing in line with us and was the best suggestion ever! can't wait to try the breads!
author: Andrey C.

description: My aunt brought us red velvet and vanilla cupcakes from Noe Valley Baking and they were FAB!!!    I like cake/cupcakes cold so we chilled them overnight and ate them today.....SO GOOD!   Moist delicious cake, perfect amount of frosting - tangy creamcheese on the red velvet and a buttercream on the vanilla that was just sweet enough.  Cannot wait to go check this place out myself now!
author: Jen p.

description: This place has the most delicious quiches I've ever had the pleasure of eating.  The Jarlsberg and asparagus one in particular is delish. Whenever I work from home, I find an excuse to head over there and get one for lunch.  Yummy!!!!!1
author: salsa s.

description: mmmmm..I haven't had anything yet that wasn't splendid...my favorite is the pumkin bread or muffins...you must eat these baked goods! My friend got a cake for my baby shower here..not only was it a work of art in fondant...it tasted delicious..Yummy.
author: Yvonne M.

description:
Lots of reviews here. But how is it that nobody has mentioned the heart-rendingly delicious blueberry pecan scones? Yes, the cupcakes, pies and cakes are excellent too, but the blueberry scones are what drive me out of bed and up the hill to the bakery. They look innocent, but are actually quite filling, and are most delicious if you warm them up a bit at home.

Also, when you're walking down 24th Street and have a small hunger pang, which happens to me surprisingly often, stop into NVB and treat yourself to a breadstick (or two or three). They're cheap, delicious, and crunchy, and you can eat them while leaving one hand free to find your MUNI transfer in your purse...under the bag of scones for tomorrow's breakfast.
author: kelly r.

description:
i couldnt help admiring the festive window display - it's all decked out for valentines...

the bf bought two desserts.  he wasnt impressed w/ either.  he prefers the red velvet at sprinkles (la).
author: Dorothy L.

description: I ordered a photo cake for my friend's 30th surprise birthday party and it came out great! The cake, vanilla cake with strawberry bavarian cream and white frosting was absolutely delicious! The strawberries were real fresh strawberries and the cream was light and fluffy, as was the cake. Light, delicious and not overly sweet. Perfect! Their cupcakes are yummy as well...can't wait to try more!
author: Nicole Sooah C.

description: They do have good cupcakes.  The chocolate w/ ganache (reminds me of a ding dong) is my fave.  I ordered a baptism cake here that was supposed to be shaped like a bible.  Although it didn't really look like it & it cost an extra $18.  But it was delish.  Not to sweet but sweet enough to crave some more.
author: Jo B.

description: Great bakery and place to get a latte. The blueberry walnut scone is great. They have great desserts as well. Cup cakes. Anything you want. Buying a whole pie is kind of expensive ($30) but worth it if you are going to a party! Also sell dough in the freezer to make scones and cookies at home! LOVE IT!
author: julie q.

description:
I usually stop in on the way to work, but I occasionally will drive across town on the weekend for these must-eats:

Croissants - I was missing Parisian croissants until I tried these guys.  Pain au chocolat is my fave, but i've bought almond and raspberry for others who love those flavors.  Light, buttery, flaky goodness warm from the oven - so good!

Cupcakes - I like the chocolate carmel fleur de sel and the Most-est best.

Mini-quiches - get whatever flavor (jarlsberg & asparagus; ham & cheese, spinach & goat cheese) floats your boat - they're all good!

The staff is genuinely friendly, which makes life oh so pleasant.  And if there happens to be a line out the door (it happens), never fear:  it moves fast and is worth the 2 minute wait.
author: Joan K.

description: Smells great walking by.  Love the blueberry-pecan scone.
author: cheryl f.

description: Such a cute bakery, they're display makes it hard to choose! They staff is super nice and they are open at convenient hours! Their Mostest cupcake will get my lazy ass out of bed and have me walking the 6 blocks on a rainy Saturday - which says a lot! I haven't tried it yet but they also have pre-made chilled cookie dough you can bring home and claim you baked from scratch!
author: All About Town ..

description: Heck, when you compare their Most-est cupcake with a Hostess' cupcake, it's practically health food.  And their carrot cupcake?  Carrots?  They're vegetables.  Again.  It's a health food.  Your body will thank you.  Your butt might not, but, hell, who cares?
author: Idala T.

description: I'm only writing this review because I've been thinking of getting a cupcake...a cupcake....a cupcake.  when you first bite into the most-est you won't think much of it until you hit the center.  but blah, blah, blah about the cupcake, did i mention the sticky bun....the sticky bun....the sticky bun?
author: Jackie C.

description: Kitchy cupcakes aside (no offense, kiddies), this place delivers great baked goods. The Cherry Ginger Coconut scone is delicious, as is the carrot muffin and chocolate brownie. Also has very respectable bread--Kalamata olive loaf is great. Noe is lucky to have this place.
author: Kelsey E.

description:
I love it! A first class bakery within a fifteen minute walk from my house!

Ever since discovering this place, I have been making the walk up from my home in the Mission to collect cupcakes, cookies, pies, pielets, muffins and assorted pastries. And basically anything else that looks good--I can't think of a time when I have disliked something I've gotten there. And the prices are quite reasonable, given the high quality.

Try doing a taste test of a pie from here and a pie from Mission Pie. One tastes professional and the other, well... As is true of the best San Francisco establishments, Noe Valley Bakery & Bread has ruined my palate for the products of mere mortals.
author: Jared B.

description:
Summary: The counter help was attentive and quick, but not very helpful.
The Most-est cupcake was bland compared to a chocolate cupcake from Miette. This was confirmed by my friend.
The Mousse cupcake was also bland and chocolate flakes on top weren't very tasty either. The presentation is good. The bakery is clean and well lit. Service was reasonably fast.
The details:
I was considering ordering a wedding cake for my sister here but changed my mind. First off, beyond showing me the order book, the counter person was not very helpful. When I told him that I wanted to try something that would give me an idea of what their cakes tasted like, he told me that there wasn't anything. He said that the cupcake batter was completely different than the cake batter and the mousse cupcake was different too.
I ended up buying a mousse and a Most-ess.
Compared to a chocolate cupcake with butter cream from Miette, the Most-est had no flavor. My friend stated that she would have preferred a real Hostess cupcake.
Compared to a chocolate mousse from Citizen Cake, the mousse was bland and uninteresting. After sampling it, we threw the other 1/2 of it away because it wasn't worth wasting calories. (it's not every day that I throw away chocolate mousse!)

Maybe it's unfair to compare it to the other 2 bakeries since it's in a lower price category, but I doubt that I would make a trip to Noe Valley for the cupcakes. Next time I'll try their savory offerings.
author: lia k.

description: Im in love with this place, thats all I have to say. Everything in this bakery is delicious, my favorites are the cherry ginger scones and all the cookies. But honestly if you are looking for great bread or amazing pies, this is the place.
author: Salvador O.

description: Honest, unpretentious, high quality and reasonably priced baked goods including great muffins, breads, croissants, pies, cakes on order and even terrific hot cross buns like I remember from the 1950's at Easter with my Grandparents and Parents.  This small bakery is an landmark anchor for the neighborhood that creates and extolls good will and taste for all who enter their doors and stroll the street with some of their great goods.  My favorite thing is the orange cranberry muffin which boasts wonderful flavor, texture and crunch at a really fair price.
author: Stu S.

description: Best sourdough bread bakery in San Francisco. Organic Whole Wheat Sourdough Loaf is da bomb.
author: Mara S.

description: The strengths: They make great baked goods. The weaknesses: The staff always seem like they have better things to do (at best) and even treat you like they don't want you in their store. I ordered a birthday cake. The person who took my order seemed to be in a hurry and asked the name of the birthday person. I gave the name and that seemed to be it. When I picked up the cake, only the name was on the BIRTHDAY cake, but no 'Happy Birthday.' The clerk looked at me as though I was asking for the moon, and VERY reluctantly sent it back to have the problem fixed. When they slapped a piece of fondant over the cake with 'Happy Birthday' written on it, they shoved the cake in front of me, and rather meanly said 'Is this OK?" I was ordering a birthday cake. They make plenty of personalized birthday cakes. I think they should know that 'Happy Birthday' usually appears on these cakes. Anyway, even if they didn't (doubt it, though), they seemed to have forgotten that 'the customer is always right.' I will not order cakes from them again, no matter how tasty. They need an attitude adjustment.
author: 和子

description:
i will not hold noe valley bakery and bread company responsible for its environs.  jesus christ people, i thought i was going to catch a case of pregnancy just walking up the block.  where do all of these children go once they get to kindergarten?  seriously, this city has barely any school aged children, yet noe valley has about 2 children or pregnant women for every other human.
oh yeah, the cupcakes are unfuckingbelievable.  and the strawberry rhubarb pie!  there aren't words for that pie.
author: Eric L.

description: My occasional weekend treat is a ginger coconut cherry scone.  So delicious.  I haven't actually tried anything else because I fear it will not live up to the coconut cherry scone.  All this talk about cupcakes is tempting me.  I've always had great service, too.
author: Amy V.

description: I love this bakery. I would give it 5 stars but the bloody carbs make me fat.
author: Jack K.

description:
Has turned into a fairly nice, but somewhat pricey bakery. Things I've purchased are usually fresh now.   

There's something strange going on, where outrageously priced "high end" bakery goods with a different brand name are showing up on the shelves.  

I guess it has something to do with the Google, Genentech, etc. Crowd taking over the 'hood.
author: Monte C.

description: I have heard good things about this bakery, especially that their lemon cupcake is fantastic. However, I didnt feel like eating cupcakes for breakfast for that day and I got a morning bun instead. Prices are reasonable and they have a large selection of pastries. I think I went on a Sunday morning around 8 or 9 am and there was no crowd whatsoever.
author: Retired B.

description: one of the best cupcakes i ever tasted fuck sprinkles cup cake place
author: nike s.

description: The "most-est" and red velvet cupcakes are excellent. I also love their frozen bake-at-home blueberry pecan scones. Friendly service.
author: Matt B.

description: The blueberry pecan scones are incredible. I'd eat them every day if I could.  My girlfriend is more excited about the muffins. I stop in pretty regularly for a cup of coffee on my way to work. It's nice with a little cinnamon and a scone to go. The fig bread is also awesome and has huge figs all through it.
author: Damon K.

description: I am a cupcake fanatic, and I would say that theirs are THE best! A good variety of flavors, very moist and not too sweet. My favorite is the Lemon Drop Cupcake - complete with a cute little decorative bee on top! My manager lives in Noe Valley near this place, so whenever there is a special occasion in our office, he always picks up cakes from here.
author: Gabby G.

description: Thank you Maria and Michael and staff for a wonderful pastry and coffe and lots of good laughs.
author: Andrei A.

description:
The "Mostess" cupcake is a religious experience.  Seriously, these folks are terrific.  I had to pick up cupcakes for a friend's baby shower and they were great about helping me load my car.

The cupcakes are justifably popular, generous and an absolute guilty pleasure.  Staff is really friendly - even when you stand before the counter for ten minutes trying to pick a flavor. :-)
author: Jayne L.

description:
I see that they have Pumpkin Spice cookies!  A bakery at Cole and Carl and Just Deserts used to make great pumpkin cookies but alas no more!
I will have to make a cookie trek to try theirs.  Enjoy!
author: L H.

description: Rugelach are amazing!  and love the fig bread as well.
author: Gigi S.

description: chocolate cherry bread is heaven.  and it's vegan!  it is like bread and delicious had a baby and named her dessert.  not much else for vegans (except the yum baguettes and yum fig bread) but seriously.  what else do you need?
author: Laura B.

description: Found this place by accident.  Needed to pick up dessert for a dinner. Tasted the best cupcakes I've ever had...The Rasberry Zinger...temporarily discontinued and then brought back by popular demand. Yay!
author: Coco M.

description:
I have been going to Noe Valley Bakery for their muffins and cookies for a long time, and have always been happy.

When my mother recently asked me to help her find a bakery that could make three custom birthday cakes, I checked out Noe Valley Bakery. Most other bakeries in the city seemed to make really expensive, over the top, sculptural cakes. All my mother wanted was a cake with a drawing of a princess, one with a drawing of a pirate or captain hook or some vaguely Peter Pan theme, and one with a golf theme. 

The Noe Valley Bakery site indicated that they would be able to do this type of simple illustration no problem. The website advertised their custom cakes and how you could work with the cake decorator to create the design, etc. Under "Custom Designs" on the "Design Your Own Cake" section, they state that "each design is a carefully hand-rendered work of art in frosting." They list the prices for custom designs starting at 6" for $21. They show several examples of custom designs they have done in the past. Simple, frosting illustrations. Just what we needed.

My mother made the trip to Noe Valley Bakery from her home in Marin to place the order. When she got there, the salesperson behind the counter told her that they did not actually do custom frosting designs on cakes, and that she would either have to choose one of their standard designs or bring in a photograph that they could scan onto the cake. My mother cited the website, and the salesperson told her that the website was wrong. Disappointed, my mother still placed the order for 3 6", 2 layer cakes, and went off to find a photo of a princess, captain hook, and something golf related to bring back to scan on the cake.

When my mom told me of her experience, I immediately called the bakery to find out what happened. I felt bad that I had recommended such a dud of a bakery and I felt like they might just be taking advantage of my 64 year old mother.

The salesperson who answered the phone when I called was beyond rude. I first asked if they did custom cakes, and he said that yes, they do. I told him of my mother's experience and he said that although they do offer custom cake illustrations, they discourage it (note: why discourage one of the services you offer??). He seemed incredibly annoyed to have to talk to me about custom cakes and he seemed to continually want to direct me to their standard designs or the photo scans. He said that the original salesperson probably said no to the  custom designs because the designs were too complicated. I told him that she only wanted a princess, a pirate, and a golf theme. Not complicated. Plus, she was flexible in how those would be executed. Basically he just threw me a bunch of BS. I explained that she really wanted the hand drawn frosting illustration and not the photo scan, and asked him how much that would cost. He said that a custom design starts at $45. I was surprised and said that on the website it states that the 6" custom design starts at $21. He said that is the price for the cake. I said ok, but the website should be updated because that is not how it reads.  He said "I can't control what is on the website." I informed him that clearly I understood that he was not the web developer but that I just wanted him to know about the misinformation portrayed on the site. After much discussion, he said that if my mother would bring in photos that the cake designer could copy, they could do the custom illustration.

Since they were so uncooperative and really quite nasty, my mother decided to simply buy some toys at Target and place them on the finished cakes. She did, however, go in once more because she wanted to change the "Happy Birthday" wording on one of the cakes. Even though they had not yet started the cakes, they were reluctant to change the wording. Eventually they did. 

At that time, she also asked for a refund for the custom photo scan for each cake that she had already paid for, since she was no longer going to be using that service. She unfortunately didn't have her receipt on her. The same nasty guy that was on the phone with me was helping her, and told that since she didn't have the receipt, how was he supposed to know that she even paid for it in the first place. She told him that she was told she had to pay in full when the order was placed, so of course it was paid for as evidenced of he order being placed! She told him to find their copy of her credit card receipt in their files and refund the extra charge. Then she marched out.

The cakes, in the end were fine. Not great. Fine. They each just had a simple "Happy Birthday" message written on them. We decorated them with the toys ourselves. She could have gotten them at the bakery down the street from her house since they didn't have any custom drawings. 

Total waste of time and energy to go all the way to Noe Valley Bakery. They need to update their website and train their staff in customer service.
author: Elana W.

description: the cheese quiche, the delectable hostess cupcakes with real whip cream  are too good to be true. everyone just seemed to sigh with relief as they got in line, assured they would soon have a treat from noe valley bakery and bread company. it was like a coming home.
author: Liz S.

description: i had the lemon cupcake. thought it was cute cause it had a candy bee sitting atop it. joyfully i went to take a bite only to find that the cake was dry and the buttercream frosting was gross. i am completely biased because i don't like buttercream, so keep that in mind. i spit it out and threw it away. sorry, folks! cute bee doesn't make up for lack of everything else. maybe i'll check it out for their other goods another day but for now, no thanks!
author: Regina C.

description: MMMMM, bread.  Really, I love all products with bread, but Noe Valley Bakery does everything with carbs right.  Pecan rolls are definitely the way to go.  My family was in town from the East coast and fell in love. Great choice!
author: Emily J.

description: Cupcakes.  Order them. Eat them. Die happy.
author: Jason S.

description: I ordered cupcakes for a party: red velvet, carrott cake and Chocolate Caramel.  All were delicious.  I was able to order and pay over the phone over a week early and had a friend pick them up for me.  Couldn't have been easier or yummier.
author: Shauna C.

description:
RUDE RUDE RUDE.
I live in the neighborhood.
I walk and shop up and down 24th street almost every day of my life, sometimes with my kid, sometimes with my husband, sometimes with both, sometimes alone.
My point is there are three of us loose fisted consumers spending a good deal fo time and money in this, "our friendly neighborhood", where we prefer to spend our money, instead of at the chain stores...after all, this is why we move to these cute little neighborhoods, is it not?  We live here to get great warm, personalized, repeat service from businesses we are friendly and warm, and loyal to.
BUT NOT WITH THESE PEOPLE!!!
These people are ruder than rude, nasty, cold, and give horrendous customer service.
No smiles, no sense of humor, no "hello glad to see you again, we love you because you are fun and warm, and make us laugh, and ask us how we are, and you are sweet and funny, and spend thousands and thousands of dollars a year in our store...".  NO,  just  a terse, "no, we can't and/or wont do that", "no, you have to pay extra for that",  "NO, you have to wait in this slow unserviced line like everyone else" (even though I was told my daughter's bday cake would be ready for me to pick up at 9am, which exactly  the time I was there to pick it up) and still they treated me like shit.
NEVER AGAIN!  I'll bake my own cakes from now on.
author: Lisa C.

description: One of the simple pleasures of living in Noe Valley is an early morning walk on 24th Street with a stop at Noe Valley Bakery for a cup of coffee and a flaxseed and cherry muffin.
author: Jay B.

description: they were a bit rude and rushed when I was placing my cupcake order.  however, it all worked out okay in the end. cupcakes were entirely too sweet for my taste and nothing to write home about but they have a good looking selection of desserts and pastries.
author: michella s.

description: Their cupcakes are to die for around here. It's moist and has the perfect ratio of frosting to cupcake. Red velvet takes the cake!
author: amanda c.

description: Carrot cake and red velvet cakes and cupcakes are divine!
author: siciliana s.

description: I've been in this place dozens of times, but I can only give it two stars. Why? Lately, their delicious goods are fairly ruined by the bad attitudes of the employees. They make what I'm trying to enjoy a little less sweet.
author: Sue C.

description: got the bf's birthday apple pie here and it was PHENOMENAL!!!!  amazing and delicious.  the right amount of sweet and crusty.  yum yum yum.  i can't wait to see what other treats they have.
author: Natalie H.

description: I love their crostini breadsticks, could eat them all day long, but they only bake them on sundays and thursdays so they run out quickly, especially the asiago cheese ones. Their bread is decent, the fig and apricot and interesting and the raisin is great because it's more raisin than loaf, which I like. The 7x7 grain bread was disappointing though, the flavor was just not good and the texture was both crumbly and dry. Onion/sesame baguettes, delish. Their oatmeal raisin cookies are great if you like them very dense and not soft, snickerdoodles and gingersnaps are just ok. Their rugeleh is to die for however, the pastry is denser than I'm used to but good and the fillings are not skimped on. The scones are good and they sell the dough for that and their oatmeal cookies if you want to make it at home, which is nice. The service is pretty shockingly distant, I've never seen people surrounded by that much yummy stuff be so unexcited to be there. I was really excited at first when I found the place but now that the newness has worn off I have to say, the products (esp. pastries) are very expensive for what they are. I go back for the breadsticks and the raisin loaf/onion baguette.
author: Allie D.

description: every time i have a party, i get noe valley cupcakes.  they're such a hit. . .especially the Mostest cupcakes, which vanish instantly.  I also LOVE their croissants, and that's saying a lot.  they're just so good!
author: Lisa C.

description: Oh gracious me, the pie...you must have the pie this instant! Today I bought a Strawberry Rhubarb pie to take to a work function and it was pure heaven in a pie plate. I take my fruit pie seriously and it is crazy hard to find the perfection I had today, even in the 'food is oxygen' city of San Francisco. I'll start with the crust: it had the decadence and substantialness of a butter crust but still managed to be crisp, flakey and not at all bread-y. The fruit layer was really generous, avoided being overly sweet and held up well to baking (i.e. did not turn to the consistency of chunky fruit puree after being baked). Chunks of tart rhubard interspersed amongst layer upon layer of delicately sliced and flavorful strawberries. Let's return to the crust, shall we? Even the bottom layer had a good amount of snap to it! Writing this review kinda makes me want to try all their other flavors ASAP (I mean like this weekend) but I'll try to pace myself. The hipster-ish pie places popping up around the city right now are pretty good, but never have I had anything there that nailed it like this did.
author: Rita E.

description: Everything is delicious.  They have perfect pasteries.  Great challah and breads.  And their chocolate chip cookies are to die for.
author: B B.

description: holy moly! my boyfriend bought me my bday cake from here. . . the chocolate mousse cake. i can thank him for the new addiction. deep dark velety ganache. super light layers of chocolate cake. layers of rich, creamy chocolate mousse and raspberry. lord have mercy. i am still working on losing some weight. with this newfound discovery, it ain't gonna happen. shheeeeeit!
author: mary c.

description: sandwiches, cupcakes, and pain au chocolate -- oh my!
author: hillary h.

description: picked up some cupcakes here since i was in the neighborhood and with the whole rise and popularity of the cupcake I guess I'm becoming more and more of a snob. The best one I have tried since I went to Magnolia bakery in NYC about 3 years ago was just last month at another bake shop in NYC this time in the Lower East Side - unfortunately I forgot the name. I do remember is how giddy it made me - plus since I'm pregnant at the moment every meal of the day involves some type of sweet! Well I was just as happy and giddy when I saw the cute cupcakes in the window of the Noe Vally Bakery.  My sister and I bought the Boston Creme and the lemon one to share. Normally I never do this but I found the chocolate ganache overwhelming and the vanilla cake of the Bostom Creme to be dry. The creme filling was almost non-existent - I guess I was hoping it was going to come at me like a chocolate custard bar. However, the lemon cupcake with the cute little bumblebee created by frosting made up for it. The cake was very moist - the filling abundant and the lemon frosting - perfect! I'll go back to get another and maybe this time I will try the Red Velvet or Carrot Cake - just not the Boston Creme ever again. But since I've been traumatized by Boston (okay people I have met from Boston) in the past I should have taken that as a hint!
author: Alexis D.

description: Great for when you need a high quality sheet cake or cupcakes for an event, and like me, you just don't believe in crisco frosting, but can't afford Kara's cupcakes for your husband's 100 plus cousins.   Everything is fresh and delicious, and they make challah for shabbat and flourless for passover baked goods that work for my family events, and will pipe a cross and write Dios Bendiga on a cake for my husband's, perfect. Noe Valley Bakery has never let me down.  ok, once they let me down, they mixed up my cupcake order for my nieces double first communion and I was all the way in the East Bay before I figured it out and it was too late to fix it.  But that was the only time and I have been using them for years.  They were totally sweet, totally credited me for the wrong cupcakes and I have not had a problem since.  These things happen (I shoulda checked all of the boxes, but we were running behind) and it says a lot how they handled it, so I'm hearting them more than ever.
author: Shona M.

description: my review is solely on their cupcakes.  i've been by this bakery several times but never acutally stepped inside.  i finally got a chance to stop by and taste one of their cupcakes.  i was craving something lemony and thus bought their lemon cupcake with the cute little bee on top.  It smelled incredible and i couldn't wait to take one bite.   It was creamy, moist with just enough lemon.  it was just detectable.  I can't wait to try their other flavors.  their other offerings also looked delicious.
author: Arlene L.

description: Everyone talks about their cakes, but buy bread here too! The whole wheat sour dough is close to perfect bread: crust crusty enough to shatter, perfect moist texture inside, and a great flavor where the sour dough and the whole wheat combine. Bread as it ought to be.
author: Malcolm C.

description: Great neighborhood bakery with yummy coconut cherry ginger scones and seasonal pumpkin muffins.  Cupcakes are also quite tasty.
author: Mohana A.

description: One you get past the rudeness of the counter clerks who talk nonstop to each other while they're waiting on you, barely coming up for air except to tell you the price, you'll find the pastries, bread, cookies very, very good.  Seasonal offerings, e.g. Hot Cross Buns, very good. (Added attraction:  Harry Aleo's tacky window directly across the street and its cardboard messages about Reagan and other Repugs.  Get ready to hiss)
author: Rosemarie M.

description: Delicious! I love all of their baked goods, especially their cupcakes and challah rolls. I'm so lucky to live in a neighborhood where I can stroll down the street and pick up a fresh baguette every morning from a bakery this good, and owned by a local couple too!
author: T W.

description: the best cupcakes i've had so far! the carrot cake cupcake and vanilla is the best! actually all the cupcakes are good!
author: Milana S.

description: I have to say I'm glad to see that the highly rated entries for this bakery are all regarding its food and not its staggeringly poor customer service.  I live nearby this bakery and the baked goods are really good.  So every few months I wonder why I don't go there more often - so I go and I am IMMEDIATELY reminded why - the people there are just not nice.  When did this kind of customer service become O.K.?  The last time I went I decided I will never go back and I will tell my friends to find baked goods elsewhere.  Here's what happened: I went in for a box of cookies.  Not only did I have to fight the other customer who came in after me and tried to butt in front (not the bakery's problem - but someone could have spoken up) but as I was leaving I dropped a whole box full of cookies on the floor.  The box came open - so embarrassing - but, to my amazement, no one who worked there moved a muscle to help me!  I ended up CLEANING UP THEIR FLOOR FOR THEM.  This is just not O.K.  Maybe their baked goods are yummy but why reward this kind of service?
author: Jennie A.
